original: rang sangs rgyas kyi brtson 'grus ni rang sangs rgyas kyi lus la gnas /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi brtson 'grus ni rang sangs rgyas kyi lus la gnas /
translated: The effort of a pratyekabuddha is based on the body of a pratyekabuddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus ni byang chub sems dpa'i lus la gnas so //üîΩbar chad rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen po'i bye brag ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bar du gcod pa'i chos bzhi ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus ni byang chub sems dpa'i lus la gnas so // bar chad rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen po'i bye brag ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bar du gcod pa'i chos bzhi ste /
translated: The effort of a bodhisattva is based on the body of a bodhisattva.üîΩThe specific antidotes to the four kinds of obstacles are the six perfections.

original: longs spyod la chags pa dang / nyon mongs pa la chags pa dang / brtson 'grus las skyo ba dang cung zad tsam gyis dga' bar 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: longs spyod la chags pa dang / nyon mongs pa la chags pa dang / brtson 'grus las skyo ba dang cung zad tsam gyis dga' bar 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The four dharmas that are obstacles to the perfections are: attachment to possessions, attachment to afflictions, weariness from effort, and grasping at satisfaction with only a little.

original: de'i gnyen po yang brtson 'grus yin par bshad do //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po yang brtson 'grus yin par bshad do //
translated: And it is explained that effort is the antidote to those.

original: dge ba'i tshogs kyi nang na brtson 'grus mchog / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: dge ba'i tshogs kyi nang na brtson 'grus mchog / ces bya ba la /
translated: Effort is supreme among the accumulations of virtue.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa dkar po'i chos thams cad kyi nang na brtson 'grus mchog tu bshad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa dkar po'i chos thams cad kyi nang na brtson 'grus mchog tu bshad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is explained that effort is supreme among all virtuous dharmas such as generosity.

original: 'di ltar bsam gtan gyis nyon mongs pa 'jil bar byed /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsam gtan gyis nyon mongs pa 'jil bar byed /
translated: In this way, afflictions are destroyed by meditative concentration.

original: shes rab kyis nyon mongs pa rtsa ba nas 'joms par byed pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyis nyon mongs pa rtsa ba nas 'joms par byed pas /
translated: Since wisdom eradicates the afflictions from the root,üîΩhow can it be that effort is taught as the supreme virtue?

original: de dag dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi nang na mchog yin na ji ltar brtson 'grus dge ba'i mchog tu bshad ce na /
analyzed: de dag dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi nang na mchog yin na ji ltar brtson 'grus dge ba'i mchog tu bshad ce na /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / gang phyir de la brten nas de 'thob 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / gang phyir de la brten nas de 'thob 'gyur // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because, in dependence on it, one attains that.

original: 'di brtson 'grus @42b mchog yin pa'i gtan tshigs su bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di brtson 'grus @42b mchog yin pa'i gtan tshigs su bshad pa'o //
translated: This is explained as the reason why effort is supreme.

original: gang gi phyir sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams ni brtson 'grus la brten nas skye ste de bas na brtson 'grus mchog yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams ni brtson 'grus la brten nas skye ste de bas na brtson 'grus mchog yin no //
translated: Because the virtues such as generosity arise in dependence on effort, therefore effort is supreme.

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni myur du de mchog spyod //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni myur du de mchog spyod //
translated: Through effort, one quickly attains the supreme

original: 'jig rten 'das dang 'jig rten rtogs pa 'grub //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'das dang 'jig rten rtogs pa 'grub //
translated: and accomplishes the realization of the supramundane and mundane.

original: ces bya bas las kyi bye brag bshad de /
analyzed: ces bya bas las kyi bye brag bshad de /
translated: This explains the different types of actions.

original: brtson 'grus kyis tshe 'di la bde ba thob par byed pa dang tshe rabs gzhan du bde ba thob par byed do //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis tshe 'di la bde ba thob par byed pa dang tshe rabs gzhan du bde ba thob par byed do //
translated: Through effort, one attains happiness in this life and attains happiness in other lives.

original: tshe 'di la bde ba thob par byed pa ni gang gi phyir brtson 'grus dang ldan na sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos dang ma 'dres pa'i bde ba rnyed cing de bzhin du gnyid las sad pa dang / de bzhin du gnyid kyis log pa'i bde ba mchog myong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: tshe 'di la bde ba thob par byed pa ni gang gi phyir brtson 'grus dang ldan na sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos dang ma 'dres pa'i bde ba rnyed cing de bzhin du gnyid las sad pa dang / de bzhin du gnyid kyis log pa'i bde ba mchog myong bar 'gyur //
translated: Similarly, one experiences the happiness of being awake and the happiness of going to sleep.

original: tshe rabs gzhan gyi bde ba ni 'jig rten gyi bde ba dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan gyi bde ba ni 'jig rten gyi bde ba dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba'o //
translated: The happiness of other lives is the happiness of the world and the happiness beyond the world.

original: de la 'jig rten gyi bde ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten gyi bde ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The happiness of the world is threefold:

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi bde ba dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi bde ba dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi bde ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi bde ba dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi bde ba dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi bde ba'o //
translated: the happiness of the desire realm, the happiness of the form realm, and the happiness of the formless realm.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The happiness beyond the world is also threefold:

original: nyan thos kyi mya ngan las 'das pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa dang / mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi mya ngan las 'das pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa dang / mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: the nirvƒÅ·πáa of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, the nirvƒÅ·πáa of the pratyekabuddhas, and the nirvƒÅ·πáa that is not a place of abiding.

original: de dag kyang brtson 'grus la gnas pas 'thob bo //
analyzed: de dag kyang brtson 'grus la gnas pas 'thob bo //
translated: And they are attained by one who is established in effort.

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni srid spyod 'dod pa 'thob //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni srid spyod 'dod pa 'thob // ces bya ba la /
translated: Through effort one attains the enjoyments of existence and the desired.

original: srid pa'i sgras ni khams gsum la bya ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i sgras ni khams gsum la bya ste /
translated: Here, the term ‚Äúexistence‚Äù refers to the three realms.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha dang mi'i longs spyod kyi bde ba yang brtson 'grus la gnas pas 'thob bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha dang mi'i longs spyod kyi bde ba yang brtson 'grus la gnas pas 'thob bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the happiness of the enjoyments of gods and humans in the desire realm is attained by one who is established in effort.

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni dag par rab 'gyur ldan //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni dag par rab 'gyur ldan // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Through effort one becomes endowed with the pure and the sublime.

original: rab 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mi brtan zhing 'gyur ba la bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mi brtan zhing 'gyur ba la bya ste /
translated: Here, the term ‚Äúsublime‚Äù refers to the unstable and the changeable.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos thams cad spangs pa'i gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi dag pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dag pa yang brtson 'grus la brten nas 'thob po zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩbrtson 'grus kyis ni 'jig tshogs 'das nas grol //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos thams cad spangs pa'i gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi dag pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dag pa yang brtson 'grus la brten nas 'thob po zhes bya ba'i don to // brtson 'grus kyis ni 'jig tshogs 'das nas grol //
translated: The meaning is that the purity of the four meditations of the form realm and the purity of the four formless states of composure that are free from all the nonvirtuous dharmas of the desire realm are attained on the basis of effort.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Through effort one passes beyond the perishing collection and is liberated.

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i mtshan nyid nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa @43a * //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i mtshan nyid nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa @43a * //
translated: The nirvana of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas, which is characterized by the abandonment of all the afflictions such as the afflicted view of the self,

original: yang brtson 'grus la brten nas 'thob po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang brtson 'grus la brten nas 'thob po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: is also attained in dependence on effort.

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni byang chub mchog rtogs so //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni byang chub mchog rtogs so // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The supreme enlightenment is realized through effort.

original: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid bla na med pa'i byang chub kyang brtson 'grus la brten nas rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid bla na med pa'i byang chub kyang brtson 'grus la brten nas rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The supreme enlightenment, which is characterized by the perfection of abandonment and the perfection of intuition, is also realized in dependence on effort.

original: de la rab tu nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la rab tu nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is not firm and certain.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi bsam gtan dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams ni shi 'phos nas med par 'gyur bas brtan pa dang nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'gyur ba zhes bya'o /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi bsam gtan dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams ni shi 'phos nas med par 'gyur bas brtan pa dang nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'gyur ba zhes bya'o /
translated: The meditative concentrations and meditative attainments of the form and formless realms are called changeable because they are not firm and certain, since they are lost upon death.

original: brtson 'grus 'bri dang 'phel zhes bya ba la sogs pas brtson 'grus kyi rnam pa'i bye brag ston te /üîΩbrtson 'grus kyi rnam pa ni yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang ldan pa'i brtson 'grus dang / dbang po lnga dang ldan pa'i brtson 'grus dang / stobs lnga dang ldan pa'i brtson 'grus dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang ldan pa'i brtson 'grus dang /
analyzed: brtson 'grus 'bri dang 'phel zhes bya ba la sogs pas brtson 'grus kyi rnam pa'i bye brag ston te / brtson 'grus kyi rnam pa ni yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang ldan pa'i brtson 'grus dang / dbang po lnga dang ldan pa'i brtson 'grus dang / stobs lnga dang ldan pa'i brtson 'grus dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang ldan pa'i brtson 'grus dang /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdiminution and increase of effort‚Äù and so on indicates the different aspects of effort.

original: lam gyi yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i brtson 'grus la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i brtson 'grus la sogs pa'o //
translated: The different aspects of effort are the effort that is associated with the four right efforts, the effort that is associated with the five faculties, the effort that is associated with the five powers, the effort that is associated with the seven factors of enlightenment, and the effort that is associated with the eightfold path.

original: de la yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang ldan pa'i brtson 'grus ni 'bri ba dang 'phel ba'i brtson 'grus zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang ldan pa'i brtson 'grus ni 'bri ba dang 'phel ba'i brtson 'grus zhes bya ste /
translated: The effort that is associated with the four right efforts is called ‚Äúthe effort of diminution and increase.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: brtson 'grus des sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed par byed //
analyzed: brtson 'grus des sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed par byed //
translated: Because, through that effort, one causes unarisen nonvirtuous entities not to arise and one causes those that have arisen to be abandoned.

original: skyes pa rnams ni spong bar byed pas 'bri ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skyes pa rnams ni spong bar byed pas 'bri ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúthe effort of diminution.‚Äù

original: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa ni skyed par byed la /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa ni skyed par byed la /
translated: The virtue that has not yet arisen is caused to arise.üîΩAnd that which has arisen is caused to increase.

original: skyes pa ni rgya cher byed pas na 'phel ba zhes bya'o //üîΩthar pa'i dbang dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skyes pa ni rgya cher byed pas na 'phel ba zhes bya'o // thar pa'i dbang dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is called ‚Äúincrease.

original: dbang po lnga dang ldan pa'i brtson 'grus ni thar pa la dbang byed pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang ldan pa'i brtson 'grus ni thar pa la dbang byed pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya ste /
translated: ‚Äù The effort that is endowed with the five faculties is called ‚Äúeffort that controls liberation.

original: des mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la dbang byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmi mthun phyogs spangs gzhan zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: des mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la dbang byed pa'i phyir ro // mi mthun phyogs spangs gzhan zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚Äù Because of that, one controls the roots of virtue that lead to the attainment of nirvana.

original: stobs lnga dang ldan pa'i brtson 'grus ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya ste /
analyzed: stobs lnga dang ldan pa'i brtson 'grus ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya ste /
translated: The effort that is endowed with the five powers is called ‚Äúeffort that abandons resistances.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: ‚Äù Why is that?

original: brtson 'grus des ma dad pa dang le lo dang dran pa nyams pa dang sems g-yeng ba dang 'chal ba'i shes rab rnams zil gyis gnon cing spong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus des ma dad pa dang le lo dang dran pa nyams pa dang sems g-yeng ba dang 'chal ba'i shes rab rnams zil gyis gnon cing spong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that effort overcomes and abandons lack of faith, laziness, loss of mindfulness, distraction, and poor wisdom.

original: de nyid 'jug pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de nyid 'jug pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: That very effort is called ‚Äúengagement‚Äù and ‚Äúdisengagement.üîΩ‚Äù

original: byang chub kyi yan lag dang ldan pa'i @43b brtson 'grus la ni de nyid la 'jug pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag dang ldan pa'i @43b brtson 'grus la ni de nyid la 'jug pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya ste /
translated: Effort endowed with the branches of enlightenment is called effort that engages reality.

original: byang chub sems kyi yan lag bdun ni sa dang po thob ste mthong ba'i lam skyes pa dang / mthong ba'i lam gyi tshe byang chub kyi yan lag bdun la bsgom par gzhag go //üîΩbrjes pa dang zhes bya ba la /üîΩ'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i brtson 'grus la ni brjes pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems kyi yan lag bdun ni sa dang po thob ste mthong ba'i lam skyes pa dang / mthong ba'i lam gyi tshe byang chub kyi yan lag bdun la bsgom par gzhag go // brjes pa dang zhes bya ba la / 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i brtson 'grus la ni brjes pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya ste /
translated: The seven branches of enlightenment are attained on the first bodhisattva stage, when the path of seeing has arisen. At the time of the path of seeing, one is established in the cultivation of the seven branches of enlightenment.üîΩEffort that is transferred is effort endowed with the eightfold noble path.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it called effort that is transferred?

original: de ni yang dag stobs //
analyzed: de ni yang dag stobs //
translated: It is said to be the power of reality,

original: bdag nyid rjes su 'jug par bshad //
analyzed: bdag nyid rjes su 'jug par bshad //
translated: and to be engaged by oneself.

original: ces bya ba 'dis bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi'i mtshan nyid 'chad de /
analyzed: ces bya ba 'dis bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi'i mtshan nyid 'chad de /
translated: This explains the characteristics of the four principles for gathering disciples.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi las /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi las /
translated: The four principles for gathering disciples are

original: sbyin pas bsdu ba'i dngos po ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi skabs su sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid ji ltar bshad pa dang don mtshungs shing 'dra ste /
analyzed: sbyin pas bsdu ba'i dngos po ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi skabs su sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid ji ltar bshad pa dang don mtshungs shing 'dra ste /
translated: The object of attraction by means of generosity is similar in meaning and the same as the characteristic of the perfection of generosity explained in the section on the six perfections.

original: de bas na 'dir mi bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir mi bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is not explained here.

original: phyi nas snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang / don mtshungs pa gsum gyi mtshan nyid bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: phyi nas snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang / don mtshungs pa gsum gyi mtshan nyid bshad par bya ste /
translated: After that, the characteristics of the three: pleasant speech, purposeful activity, and sameness of purpose, will be explained.

original: sbyin pa nas shes rab kyi bar du pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid gzhan la gtan tshigs su 'chad de snyan par smra ba'i mtshan nyid do //üîΩpha rol tu phyin pa drug la sems can bstabs te /
analyzed: sbyin pa nas shes rab kyi bar du pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid gzhan la gtan tshigs su 'chad de snyan par smra ba'i mtshan nyid do // pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sems can bstabs te /
translated: The characteristic of pleasant speech is explaining to others the general and specific characteristics of the six perfections from generosity to wisdom as a reason.üîΩThe characteristic of purposeful activity is establishing sentient beings in the six perfections,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bkod pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub tu bcug pa ni don spyod pa'i mtshan nyid do//
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bkod pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub tu bcug pa ni don spyod pa'i mtshan nyid do//
translated: establishing them in the six perfections, and causing them to practice the six perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa gang la sems can bkod cing sgrub tu bcug pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa de nyid la bdag nyid rjes su 'jug cing bdag nyid kyang de sgrub par byed pa ni don mtshungs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa gang la sems can bkod cing sgrub tu bcug pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa de nyid la bdag nyid rjes su 'jug cing bdag nyid kyang de sgrub par byed pa ni don mtshungs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The characteristic of similarity of aim is that one practices oneself in the very perfection in which one has established and caused other beings to enter.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi'i mtshan nyid ni de ltar bshad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi'i mtshan nyid ni de ltar bshad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The characteristic of the four principles for attracting a following has been explained in that way.

original: pha rol tu phyin pas bsdus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pas bsdus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because they are included in the perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bshad pa'i skabs yin pas pha rol tu phyin par gtogs pa'i chos gzhan la bstan pa ni snyan par smra ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bshad pa'i skabs yin pas pha rol tu phyin par gtogs pa'i chos gzhan la bstan pa ni snyan par smra ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since the topic is the explanation of the perfections, the teaching of other phenomena that are included in the perfections is agreeable speech.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi rnams ci'i phyir bzhir bshad ce na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi rnams ci'i phyir bzhir bshad ce na zhes bya ba la /
translated: Why are the four principles for attracting a following explained as four?

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid bshad nas bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhir grangs nges par ci'i phyir bshad pa'i grangs la spyod de /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid bshad nas bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhir grangs nges par ci'i phyir bshad pa'i grangs la spyod de /
translated: Having explained the characteristic of the principles for attracting a following, why is the definite number of the four principles for attracting a following explained?

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po lnga la sogs pa mang du yang ma bshad /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po lnga la sogs pa mang du yang ma bshad /
translated: The four are not explained as five, such as the four means of gathering, nor are they explained as three, etc.

original: gsum la sogs pa nyung du yang ma bshad ma bstan par ci'i phyir grangs rnam pa bzhi kho nar gzhag @44a * //
analyzed: gsum la sogs pa nyung du yang ma bshad ma bstan par ci'i phyir grangs rnam pa bzhi kho nar gzhag @44a * //
translated: Why are they established as just four in number?

original: ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the question.

original: de dag pha rol rnams kyi thabs //
analyzed: de dag pha rol rnams kyi thabs //
translated: They are the methods for others.üîΩBenefiting, holding,üîΩengaging, and likewise following

original: phan par byed dang 'dzin pa dang // rab tu 'jug dang de ltar rjes su 'jug / bsdu ba'i dngos por shes par bya //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phan par byed dang 'dzin pa dang // rab tu 'jug dang de ltar rjes su 'jug / bsdu ba'i dngos por shes par bya // zhes bya ba la /

original: 'di ltar bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams ni sems can bstan pa la ma zhugs pa rnams bstan pa la gzung ba dang / bstan pa la zhugs pa rnams yongs su smin par bya ba dang / smin par byas pa rnams grol bar bya ba'i thabs yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams ni sems can bstan pa la ma zhugs pa rnams bstan pa la gzung ba dang / bstan pa la zhugs pa rnams yongs su smin par bya ba dang / smin par byas pa rnams grol bar bya ba'i thabs yin te /
translated: Thus, the means of gathering are the methods for causing those sentient beings who have not entered the teaching to enter it, for ripening those who have entered it, and for liberating those who have been ripened.

original: de la thabs kyang rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de la thabs kyang rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: There are four methods.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: phan par byed pa'i thabs dang / 'dzin par byed pa'i thabs dang / rab tu 'jug par byed pa'i thabs dang / rjes su 'jug pa'i thabs te /
analyzed: phan par byed pa'i thabs dang / 'dzin par byed pa'i thabs dang / rab tu 'jug par byed pa'i thabs dang / rjes su 'jug pa'i thabs te /
translated: the means of attraction are four because there are four means of attraction: the means of attraction of giving, the means of attraction of pleasant speech, the means of attraction of meaningful action, and the means of attraction of consistency between words and deeds.

original: de ltar thabs bzhi yod pas na bsdu ba'i dngos po yang bzhi kho nar zad de mi mang mi nyung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar thabs bzhi yod pas na bsdu ba'i dngos po yang bzhi kho nar zad de mi mang mi nyung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The means of attraction are four because there are four means of attraction. The means of attraction are just four, neither more nor less.

original: de la phan par byed pa'i thabs ni sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: de la phan par byed pa'i thabs ni sbyin pa ste /
translated: The means of attraction of giving is giving material goods to sentient beings.

original: bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa sbyin pas sems can gyi bkres pa dang grang ba la sogs pa med par bya ba'i phyir sems can gyi lus la phan btags so //
analyzed: bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa sbyin pas sems can gyi bkres pa dang grang ba la sogs pa med par bya ba'i phyir sems can gyi lus la phan btags so //
translated: The means of attraction of giving is giving material goods to sentient beings.

original: 'dzin par byed pa'i thabs ni snyan par smra ba ste /
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa'i thabs ni snyan par smra ba ste /
translated: The means of attraction of pleasant speech is the pleasant speech of those who are skilled in methods.üîΩThe means of attraction of meaningful action is meaningful action.

original: 'dzin par byed ces bya ba dang / khong du chud par byed ces bya ba don gcig go /
analyzed: 'dzin par byed ces bya ba dang / khong du chud par byed ces bya ba don gcig go /
translated: The means of attraction of consistency between words and deeds is consistency between words and deeds.

original: 'di ltar snyan par smra bas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid bshad pas pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid mi shes pa dang / log par shes pa dang / the tshom du gyur pa rnams bsdus nas pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid ma nor bar byed pas na 'dzin par byed pa'i thabs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar snyan par smra bas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid bshad pas pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid mi shes pa dang / log par shes pa dang / the tshom du gyur pa rnams bsdus nas pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid ma nor bar byed pas na 'dzin par byed pa'i thabs so //
translated: Thus, by explaining the general and specific characteristics of the perfections through agreeable speech, he attracts those who do not know the characteristics of the perfections, those who have wrong ideas about them, and those who are doubtful about them. He causes them to understand the characteristics of the perfections without error, and thus it is the means of taking hold of them.

original: rab tu 'jug pa'i thabs ni don spyod pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu 'jug pa'i thabs ni don spyod pa ste /
translated: The means of engaging is the service of the goal.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa mi shes pa dang / the tshom du gyur pa rnams kyi mi shes pa dang the tshom bsal nas pha rol tu phyin pa'i don khong du chud pa rnams kyang pha rol tu phyin pa rnams spyod pa la 'jog cing /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa mi shes pa dang / the tshom du gyur pa rnams kyi mi shes pa dang the tshom bsal nas pha rol tu phyin pa'i don khong du chud pa rnams kyang pha rol tu phyin pa rnams spyod pa la 'jog cing /
translated: Having dispelled the ignorance and doubt of those who do not know the perfections, he causes those who have understood the meaning of the perfections to engage in the practice of the perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa spyod du bcug pas na rab tu 'jug par byed pa'i thabs so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa spyod du bcug pas na rab tu 'jug par byed pa'i thabs so //
translated: Thus it is the means of engaging in the perfections.

original: rjes su 'jug par byed pa'i thabs ni don mtshungs pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su 'jug par byed pa'i thabs ni don mtshungs pa ste /
translated: The means of following is the same goal.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba gang la sems bkod pa'i dge ba de las ma nyams shing rgyun du spyod du gzhug pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba gang la sems bkod pa'i dge ba de las ma nyams shing rgyun du spyod du gzhug pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to make the virtue in which the mind is placed not degenerate and to make it always practiced,üîΩthe bodhisattva himself practices that very perfection.üîΩThus, having practiced it himself, he causes other sentient beings to practice the perfections.

original: bdag nyid kyang pha rol tu phyin pa de nyid sgrub par byed da 'di ltar bdag nyid kyis bsgrubs nas sems can pha rol tu phyin pa spyod du bcug pa rnams @44b 'di snyam du sems te /üîΩpha rol tu phyin pa dge ba gang la bdag cag bkod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa de la byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyang de la sgrub pas na bya ba 'dis ni dam pa yin no zhes sems can dag nan tan gyis pha rol tu phyin pa
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang pha rol tu phyin pa de nyid sgrub par byed da 'di ltar bdag nyid kyis bsgrubs nas sems can pha rol tu phyin pa spyod du bcug pa rnams @44b 'di snyam du sems te / pha rol tu phyin pa dge ba gang la bdag cag bkod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa de la byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyang de la sgrub pas na bya ba 'dis ni dam pa yin no zhes sems can dag nan tan gyis pha rol tu phyin pa
translated: Those sentient beings who have been caused to practice the perfections think,üîΩ‚ÄúThe bodhisattva himself practices that perfection of virtue in which we are placed. This practice is excellent.‚Äù

original: la sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: la sgrub par byed do //
translated: Thus, sentient beings are caused to practice the perfections with effort.

original: yang dag par bstan pa la ji ltar smra ba de bzhin byed par shes nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yang dag par bstan pa la ji ltar smra ba de bzhin byed par shes nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Knowing that he acts in accordance with what he teaches, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos rnams ni dam pa dang gtso bo yin pas sgrub pa'i rigs so zhes smras nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos rnams ni dam pa dang gtso bo yin pas sgrub pa'i rigs so zhes smras nas /
translated: The bodhisattva has said that the dharmas of the perfections are excellent and principal, so they are the kind of practice.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la sems can bkod pa'i sems can de dag byang chub sems dpa'i tshig tu ji skad smra ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyang de la sgrub par shes nas sems can rnams kyang nan tan gyis pha rol tu phyin
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la sems can bkod pa'i sems can de dag byang chub sems dpa'i tshig tu ji skad smra ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyang de la sgrub par shes nas sems can rnams kyang nan tan gyis pha rol tu phyin
translated: Having thus established sentient beings in the perfections, the bodhisattva himself, knowing that sentient beings should practice just as they have been taught, practices the perfections himself.

original: bsgrub par byed de /
analyzed: bsgrub par byed de /
translated: And he causes sentient beings to practice them.

original: de bas na sems can sgrub tu gzhug pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyang pha rol tu phyin ba sgrub par byed pa'i ni rjes su 'jug pa'i thabs zhes bya'o //üîΩthog ma kho nar snod du gyur //
analyzed: de bas na sems can sgrub tu gzhug pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyang pha rol tu phyin ba sgrub par byed pa'i ni rjes su 'jug pa'i thabs zhes bya'o // thog ma kho nar snod du gyur //
translated: Therefore, in order to establish sentient beings in practice, the bodhisattva himself practices the perfections. This is called the means of engagement.üîΩOne verse on the analysis of the function of the four principles

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi'i las 'chad de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi'i las 'chad de /
translated: .üîΩThe function of the four principles is to be known as the means of engagement, of entry, of purification, and of attainment.

original: de la dang po kho nar pha rol tu phyin pa rnams sgrub pa'i snod du byed pa ni sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: de la dang po kho nar pha rol tu phyin pa rnams sgrub pa'i snod du byed pa ni sbyin pa ste /
translated: Generosity is the first of the perfections, and it makes one a vessel for the practice of the perfections.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pas sems can la phan btags na byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar dge ba byed du bcug pa de bzhin du sems can dge ba byed pas ni sbyin pa'i las ni sems can snod du gyur par byed pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pas sems can la phan btags na byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar dge ba byed du bcug pa de bzhin du sems can dge ba byed pas ni sbyin pa'i las ni sems can snod du gyur par byed pa'o //
translated: When the bodhisattva benefits sentient beings through generosity, then sentient beings, in turn, engage in virtue just as the bodhisattva does.

original: gnyis pas su ni mos par byed //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: gnyis pas su ni mos par byed // ces bya ba la /
translated: The second causes them to aspire.

original: gnyis pa ni snyan par smra ba ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni snyan par smra ba ste /
translated: The second is pleasant speech.

original: snyan par smra bas ni pha rol tu phyin pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'i chos rnams la mos par byed do //
analyzed: snyan par smra bas ni pha rol tu phyin pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'i chos rnams la mos par byed do //
translated: Through pleasant speech, one causes others to aspire to the teachings that are associated with the perfections.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How does one cause others to aspire?

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid mi shes pa dang / log par shes pa dang / the tshom du gyur pa rnams la pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid ma nor bar bshad pas /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid mi shes pa dang / log par shes pa dang / the tshom du gyur pa rnams la pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid ma nor bar bshad pas /

analyzed: gsum pas yang dag pa sgrub par byed // ces bya ba la /

original: gsum pa ni don spyod pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni don spyod pa ste /

analyzed: don spyod pas ni yang dag par sgrub par byed de / pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par sgrub pa la sems @45a * //

analyzed: can 'jog par byed pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: bzhi pas rnam par spyod par byed // ces bya ba la /

original: des ni rnam par spyod par byed de /
analyzed: des ni rnam par spyod par byed de /

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /

original: sems can pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub pa la brtan por bya ba'i phyir yun ring por bdag nyid pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub par byed de /
analyzed: sems can pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub pa la brtan por bya ba'i phyir yun ring por bdag nyid pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub par byed de /
translated: For a long time, one practices the transcendences oneself in order to stabilize other beings in the practice of the transcendences.

original: sems can gyi don du yun ring por bdag gis pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrubs nas pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid dri ma med cing dag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can gyi don du yun ring por bdag gis pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrubs nas pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid dri ma med cing dag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: For the sake of sentient beings, I will practice the perfections for a long time, and the characteristics of the perfections will become stainless and pure.

original: bsdu ba rnam pa bzhi dag ni /
analyzed: bsdu ba rnam pa bzhi dag ni /

original: bsdu ba rnam pa gnyis su 'dus //
analyzed: bsdu ba rnam pa gnyis su 'dus //

original: zang zing dang ni chos kyis kyang//
analyzed: zang zing dang ni chos kyis kyang//
translated: By material things and by the Dharma,

original: dmigs pa'i chos la sogs pas so //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i chos la sogs pas so //

analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi rnams don gnyis su sdud par ston to //

analyzed: kha cig las bsdu ba'i dngos po gnyis zhes bshad de / bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhir gsungs pa de yang bsdu ba'i dngos po rnam pa gnyis su 'dus te /

analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po gnyis ni zang zing gis bsdu ba dang / chos kyis bsdu ba'o //

analyzed: de la sbyin pas bsdu ba'i dngos po ni zang zing gis bsdu ba'i nang du 'dus so //

analyzed: snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang / don mtshungs pa gsum ni chos kyis bsdu ba'i nang du 'dus so //
translated: The three, namely, agreeable speech, performance of benefit, and sameness of purpose are included in the conversion by Dharma.

original: gsum ji ltar chos kyis bsdu ba'i nang du bsdus she na /
analyzed: gsum ji ltar chos kyis bsdu ba'i nang du bsdus she na /
translated: How are the three included in the conversion by Dharma?

original: ji ltar chos rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: ji ltar chos rnam pa gsum ste /

analyzed: dmigs pa'i chos dang / bsgrub pa'i chos dang / de rnam par dag pa'i chos so //
translated: the Dharma as object, the Dharma as practice, and the Dharma as purification.

original: de la dmigs pa'i chos ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa'i mdo sde la sogs pa la bya ste /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i chos ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa'i mdo sde la sogs pa la bya ste /

original: dmigs pa'i chos kyi nang du snyan par smra ba 'dus te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i chos kyi nang du snyan par smra ba 'dus te /
translated: Agreeable speech is included in the Dharma as object.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /

original: ji lta zhe na /

analyzed: don spyod pas sems can pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub tu bcug pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i chos ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams ser sna la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang bral ba ste /
translated: The matter of the pure Dharma is the perfections, free from the resistances of stinginess, etc.

original: de'i nang du ni don mtshungs pa 'dus so //
analyzed: de'i nang du ni don mtshungs pa 'dus so //
translated: The matter of the same benefit is included in that.

original: rnam dbye tha ma dang ni bar ma mchog /

translated: One verse on the analysis of the four persuasions.

original: gzhan gyi don mi byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrang sangs rgyas kyi bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi ni bar ma zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don mi byed pa'i phyir ro // rang sangs rgyas kyi bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi ni bar ma zhes bya ste /
translated: The four persuasions of the disciples are called the last, because they do not benefit others.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi ni /

original: mchog ces bya ste /
analyzed: mchog ces bya ste /
translated: are called supreme,

analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don du zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are engaged in the aims of self and other.

original: yang na byang chub sems dpa' bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis bsdus nas nyan thos kyi theg pa la bkod pa'i bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi ni tha ma zhes bya'o //

translated: Or else, the four social practices of the bodhisattva which attract disciples by means of the four social practices are called inferior.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can bsdus te /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can bsdus te /

analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la bkod na bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po de dag bar ma zhes bya'o //

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can bsdus te /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can bsdus te /
translated: The four social practices attract sentient beings,

original: theg pa chen po la bkod na bsdu ba'i dngos po de dag mchog ces bya'o //üîΩbsdu ba phal cher stongs mi stongs //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la bkod na bsdu ba'i dngos po de dag mchog ces bya'o // bsdu ba phal cher stongs mi stongs //
translated: and if they are established in the Great Vehicle, those four social practices are called supreme.üîΩThe social practices are mostly empty, not empty,

original: rnam kun mi stongs shes par bya //
analyzed: rnam kun mi stongs shes par bya //
translated: and not empty in every way.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is what should be understood.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can bsdus shing smin par byed pa ni phal cher smin par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can bsdus shing smin par byed pa ni phal cher smin par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Bodhisattvas on the stage of action in faith, by means of the four social practices, attract and mature sentient beings, but for the most part they do not mature.

original: chung shas shig smin par 'gyur bas phal cher stongs pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chung shas shig smin par 'gyur bas phal cher stongs pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: A few are matured, so it is called for the most part empty.

original: chos kyi de kho na ma mthong ba dang sems can gyi bsam pa mi shes pas na phal cher don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi de kho na ma mthong ba dang sems can gyi bsam pa mi shes pas na phal cher don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since they do not see the reality of dharmas and do not understand the thoughts of sentient beings, for the most part they are ineffective.

original: sa dang po nas sa bdun man chad kyi byang chub sems dpas bsdus pa'i dngos po bzhis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa ni phal cher smin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sa dang po nas sa bdun man chad kyi byang chub sems dpas bsdus pa'i dngos po bzhis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa ni phal cher smin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Bodhisattvas from the first stage up to the seventh stage, by means of the four social practices, bring sentient beings to full maturity, and for the most part they mature.

original: cung zad tsam smin par mi 'gyur bas na phal cher mi stongs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: cung zad tsam smin par mi 'gyur bas na phal cher mi stongs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Only a few do not mature, so it is called for the most part not empty.

original: phal cher don yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phal cher don yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means for the most part they are effective.

original: sa brgyad dang / dgu dang / bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dag gis bsdu pa'i dngos po bzhis sems can bsdu zhing smin par byas pa rnams ji ltar smin par byas pa de bzhin du thams cad smin par 'gyur gte /
analyzed: sa brgyad dang / dgu dang / bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dag gis bsdu pa'i dngos po bzhis sems can bsdu zhing smin par byas pa rnams ji ltar smin par byas pa de bzhin du thams cad smin par 'gyur gte /
translated: The bodhisattvas on the eighth, ninth, and tenth levels gather beings by means of the four social practices and bring them to maturity. And all those whom they bring to maturity will in fact be brought to maturity, just as they are brought to maturity by the bodhisattvas.

original: gcig kyang chud mi za bas rnam pa kun du mi stongs pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gcig kyang chud mi za bas rnam pa kun du mi stongs pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: And not a single one of them will be lost.

original: 'khor sdud pa la zhugs pa rnams //
analyzed: 'khor sdud pa la zhugs pa rnams //
translated: Those who are engaged in gathering a retinue

original: tshul 'di nyid la gnas pas na//
analyzed: tshul 'di nyid la gnas pas na//
translated: By abiding in this very method

original: @46a * // thams cad don ni 'grub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: @46a * // thams cad don ni 'grub pa'i phyir //
translated: Will accomplish all their goals

original: kun du thabs su 'di bsngags so //
analyzed: kun du thabs su 'di bsngags so //
translated: And this is praised as the universal means.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi sems can smin par byed pa'i thabs su gyur par ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi sems can smin par byed pa'i thabs su gyur par ston to //
translated: This verse shows that the four social practices are the means for bringing sentient beings to maturity.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'khor rnam pa bzhi bsdu zhing smin par byed pa rnams kyang bsdu ba'i dngos po'i tshul 'di nyid la gnas shing thabs 'di nyid kyis sems can yongs su smin par byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'khor rnam pa bzhi bsdu zhing smin par byed pa rnams kyang bsdu ba'i dngos po'i tshul 'di nyid la gnas shing thabs 'di nyid kyis sems can yongs su smin par byed de /
translated: The bodhisattvas who gather the four kinds of retinue and bring them to maturity also abide in this very method of the means of gathering and bring beings to maturity by this very method.

original: sems can smin par bya ba'i thabs 'di las ma gtogs par gzhan med do //
analyzed: sems can smin par bya ba'i thabs 'di las ma gtogs par gzhan med do //
translated: There is no other method for bringing beings to maturity apart from this.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis ni sems can thams cad kyi don 'grub par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis ni sems can thams cad kyi don 'grub par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the aims of all beings are accomplished by the four means of gathering.

original: de bas na sems can gyi don grub par byed pa'i thabs sla ba ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi yin par de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bsngags shing bshad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na sems can gyi don grub par byed pa'i thabs sla ba ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi yin par de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bsngags shing bshad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the means of accomplishing the aims of beings is the four means of gathering, which are praised and explained by the Tathagatas as being easy. This is the meaning.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di nyid kyis don gsal bar bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di nyid kyis don gsal bar bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify the meaning of this very verse,üîΩThe past, future, and presentüîΩgatherers, the gatherers to come,

original: bsdus pa dag dang sdud 'gyur dang // da ltar sdud par byed pa dang // thams cad de bzhin de bas na //
analyzed: bsdus pa dag dang sdud 'gyur dang // da ltar sdud par byed pa dang // thams cad de bzhin de bas na //
translated: and all of them in the same way.

original: sems can smin phyir de la ma mo //
analyzed: sems can smin phyir de la ma mo //
translated: In order to mature sentient beings, he is the mother.

original: zhes smos te /üîΩ'das pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can thams cad bsdus pa yang bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po 'di nyid la gnas nas bsdus shing smin par byas pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can thams cad bsdu zhing smin par bya ba yang /üîΩbsdu ba'i dngos po 'di nyid la gnas nas bsdus shing smin par byed par 'gyur ba dang / da ltar gyi sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can sdud cing smin par byed pa yang /
analyzed: zhes smos te / 'das pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can thams cad bsdus pa yang bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po 'di nyid la gnas nas bsdus shing smin par byas pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can thams cad bsdu zhing smin par bya ba yang / bsdu ba'i dngos po 'di nyid la gnas nas bsdus shing smin par byed par 'gyur ba dang / da ltar gyi sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can sdud cing smin par byed pa yang /
translated: For the sake of maturing sentient beings, they are mothers.üîΩThe past buddhas and bodhisattvas gathered all sentient beings by means of these four ways of gathering and matured them.üîΩThe future buddhas and bodhisattvas will gather and mature all sentient beings by means of these four ways of gathering.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po 'di nyid la gnas nas sems can bsdus shing smin par byed de /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po 'di nyid la gnas nas sems can bsdus shing smin par byed de /
translated: The present buddhas and bodhisattvas gather and mature sentient beings by means of these four ways of gathering.

original: de bas na bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po 'di dag ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i lam gcig pu theg pa gcig pu ste /
analyzed: de bas na bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po 'di dag ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i lam gcig pu theg pa gcig pu ste /
translated: Thus, these four means of gathering are the sole path for bringing beings to maturity, the sole vehicle.

original: 'di las sems can bsgral bar bya ba'i las gzhan med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di las sems can bsgral bar bya ba'i las gzhan med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no other activity for liberating beings than this.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi bshad pa'i don mjug bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir de ltar longs spyod la rtag tu mi chags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa smos so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi bshad pa'i don mjug bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir de ltar longs spyod la rtag tu mi chags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa smos so //
translated: In order to teach a summary of the meaning of the explanation of the six perfections and the four means of gathering, he states the verse: ‚ÄúThus, he is always free from attachment to enjoyments. ‚Äù

original: @46b de ltar zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa de ltar na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: @46b de ltar zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa de ltar na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù means ‚Äúin the above manner. ‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pas na longs spyod la rtag tu mi chags pa'i blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pas na longs spyod la rtag tu mi chags pa'i blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva, endowed with the perfection of generosity, is said to be ‚Äúendowed with a mind that is always free from attachment to enjoyments. ‚Äù

original: longs spyod gang la yang chags pa'i sems mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: longs spyod gang la yang chags pa'i sems mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he does not generate a mind that is attached to any enjoyments.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pas na zhi ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pas na zhi ba zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called peace because it is endowed with the perfection of morality,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i lam zhi bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i lam zhi bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not create the path of killing, etc. which arises from the cause of passion, etc.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pas sdom pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pas sdom pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called restraint because it is endowed with the perfection of patience,

original: zhe sdang gis sems mi 'khrugs par bsdams pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbrtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pas /
analyzed: zhe sdang gis sems mi 'khrugs par bsdams pa'i phyir ro // brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pas /
translated: because it restrains the mind from being disturbed by hatred.

original: brtson pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: brtson pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called the perfection of effort because it is endowed with the perfection of effort,

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pas bsgrub pa mthar phyin pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pas bsgrub pa mthar phyin pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of the accomplishment of the perfection of effort.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pas gnas nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pas gnas nyid ces bya ste /
translated: It is called the very abode because it is endowed with the perfection of meditation,

original: sems phyi rol du mi g-yeng zhing sems rtse gcig tu gnas pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems phyi rol du mi g-yeng zhing sems rtse gcig tu gnas pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of the attainment of the one-pointed mind which does not scatter externally.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pas srid pa'i yul la mchan mar rnam par mi rtog ces bya ste //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pas srid pa'i yul la mchan mar rnam par mi rtog ces bya ste //
translated: Because of possessing the perfection of wisdom, he does not conceive of the objects of existence as signs.

original: srid pa ni nang gi dngos po phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: srid pa ni nang gi dngos po phung po lnga'o //
translated: Existence is the internal things, the five aggregates.

original: yul ni phyi'i dngos po gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yul ni phyi'i dngos po gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: Objects are the external things, form, etc.

original: mtshan ma ni phyi nang gnyi ga'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma ni phyi nang gnyi ga'i dngos po'o //
translated: Signs are the internal and external things.

original: bdag gi rgyud las ma gtogs pa'i sems can gzhan te de dag la yod par mi rtog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag gi rgyud las ma gtogs pa'i sems can gzhan te de dag la yod par mi rtog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He does not conceive of sentient beings as existing apart from his own continuum. This is the meaning.

original: de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa las bdag yongs su smin par 'gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can gzhan yang yongs su smin par byed /
analyzed: de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa las bdag yongs su smin par 'gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can gzhan yang yongs su smin par byed /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who has matured himself by accomplishing the six perfections also matures other sentient beings by means of the four social practices.

original: de bas na des ni sems can tshogs rnams bsdus pa yin ;üîΩ/ zhes smos te //
analyzed: de bas na des ni sems can tshogs rnams bsdus pa yin ;üîΩ/ zhes smos te //
translated: Therefore, he gathers a group of sentient beings.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa dang / de ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dang / de ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The perfections and the four social practices are the means of bringing beings to maturity.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i skabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i skabs rdzogs so /
translated: The chapter on the perfections is concluded.

original: // / sangs rgyas la mchod pa'i rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bdun te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / sangs rgyas la mchod pa'i rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bdun te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Seven verses on the analysis of worship of the Buddha.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa dang bsdu ba'i dngos po'i rjes la sangs rgyas la mchod pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi la 'jug pa 'chad de /üîΩde la pha rol tu phyin pa dang bsdu ba'i dngos po'i rjes la sangs rgyas la mchod pa dang / dge ba'i bshes @47a * //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dang bsdu ba'i dngos po'i rjes la sangs rgyas la mchod pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi la 'jug pa 'chad de / de la pha rol tu phyin pa dang bsdu ba'i dngos po'i rjes la sangs rgyas la mchod pa dang / dge ba'i bshes @47a * //
translated: After the perfections and the social practices, worship of the Buddha, reliance on the spiritual master, and engagement in the four immeasurables are explained.

original: gnyen la brten pa dang / tshad med pa la 'jug pa'i skabs 'chad par 'brel pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gnyen la brten pa dang / tshad med pa la 'jug pa'i skabs 'chad par 'brel pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the connection between the chapter on the perfections and the chapter on worship of the Buddha, etc.?

original: sngar bdag la phan pa bsgrub pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa rnams bstan te /
analyzed: sngar bdag la phan pa bsgrub pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa rnams bstan te /
translated: Previously, the perfections were taught in order to accomplish benefit for oneself.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub sa pas ni bdag phun sum tshogs pa thams cad dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub sa pas ni bdag phun sum tshogs pa thams cad dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: By accomplishing the perfections, one will come to possess all the excellences for oneself.

original: sems can gzhan la phan par bya ba'i phyir ni /
analyzed: sems can gzhan la phan par bya ba'i phyir ni /
translated: For the sake of benefiting other sentient beings,

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bshad de bsdu ba'i dngos pos ni sems can la phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bshad de bsdu ba'i dngos pos ni sems can la phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: the means of gathering are explained, by which one benefits sentient beings.

original: de la bdag la phan pa phun sum tshogs shing bdag gi 'byor pa la chags par gyur na tshogs kyi bar du gcod de /
analyzed: de la bdag la phan pa phun sum tshogs shing bdag gi 'byor pa la chags par gyur na tshogs kyi bar du gcod de /
translated: Therein, attachment to one's own excellence and wealth is an obstacle to the accumulations.

original: de bas na bdag la chags pa bsal bar bya ba'i gnyen por sangs rgyas la mchod pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na bdag la chags pa bsal bar bya ba'i gnyen por sangs rgyas la mchod pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, as an antidote to eliminate attachment to oneself, one should make offerings to the Buddhas and rely on spiritual friends.

original: sangs rgyas la chos gos dang lhung bzed la sogs pa phyi'i dngos po gtong ba la goms na longs spyod la chags pa'i bsam pa mi skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la chos gos dang lhung bzed la sogs pa phyi'i dngos po gtong ba la goms na longs spyod la chags pa'i bsam pa mi skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By becoming accustomed to giving external things such as Dharma robes and alms bowls to the Buddhas, the thought of attachment to wealth will not arise.

original: lus dang srog la yang mi phangs par dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten te /
analyzed: lus dang srog la yang mi phangs par dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten te /
translated: Without being attached to body and life, one should rely on the spiritual friend.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen mgu bar byas na bdag gi lus dang srog la yod pa'i bde ba'i longs spyod la chags par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen mgu bar byas na bdag gi lus dang srog la yod pa'i bde ba'i longs spyod la chags par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one delights the spiritual friend, one will not be attached to the enjoyments of happiness that exist in one's body and life.

original: de bas na chags pa rnam pa gnyis spang bar bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas la mchod pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na chags pa rnam pa gnyis spang bar bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas la mchod pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in order to abandon the two kinds of attachment, one should worship the Buddha and rely on the spiritual friend.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis gzhan gyi don du zhugs pa na yang sems can gyi log par spyod pa dang / 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dag byung na byang chub sems dpa' tshad med pa bzhi dang mi ldan pa dang sems can rnams la btang snyoms su 'dor zhing sems can 'dul bar mi byed de /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis gzhan gyi don du zhugs pa na yang sems can gyi log par spyod pa dang / 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dag byung na byang chub sems dpa' tshad med pa bzhi dang mi ldan pa dang sems can rnams la btang snyoms su 'dor zhing sems can 'dul bar mi byed de /
translated: When one is engaged in the welfare of others by means of the four right efforts, if the wrong behavior of sentient beings and the suffering of cyclic existence occur, the bodhisattva is not endowed with the four immeasurables and abandons sentient beings with equanimity, not disciplining sentient beings.

original: de bas na de'i gnyen por tshad med pa rnams bshad de /
analyzed: de bas na de'i gnyen por tshad med pa rnams bshad de /
translated: Therefore, the immeasurables are explained as their antidote.

original: tshad med pa bzhis yongs su zin cing tshad med pa bzhi la goms par byas na gnas skabs thams cad du yang byang chub sems dpa' sems can yongs su mi gtong ste /
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhis yongs su zin cing tshad med pa bzhi la goms par byas na gnas skabs thams cad du yang byang chub sems dpa' sems can yongs su mi gtong ste /
translated: If one is fully engaged in the four immeasurables and is habituated to the four immeasurables, then in all situations one does not abandon sentient beings.

original: de bas na pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po bshad pa'i rjes la /üîΩsangs rgyas la mchod pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa dang / tshad med pa bshad pa'i skabs bshad pa'i phyir 'brel to //
analyzed: de bas na pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po bshad pa'i rjes la / sangs rgyas la mchod pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa dang / tshad med pa bshad pa'i skabs bshad pa'i phyir 'brel to //
translated: Therefore, after the perfections and the means of gathering disciples have been explained,üîΩthe worship of the buddhas, reliance on spiritual friends, and the immeasurables are explained in this chapter, because they are related to the chapter on the perfections and the means of gathering disciples.

original: de la sangs rgyas la mchod pa phye na du yod pa'i mchod pa'i rab tu dbye ba tshigs su bcad pa bdun zhig gis je ston to //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas la mchod pa phye na du yod pa'i mchod pa'i rab tu dbye ba tshigs su bcad pa bdun zhig gis je ston to //
translated: The classification of worship of the buddhas is shown by seven verses.

original: mngon sum lkog nas mchod @47b pa ni ;
analyzed: mngon sum lkog nas mchod @47b pa ni ;
translated: Worship is direct or indirect.
