analyzed: tshigs bcad rkang pa sbyar ba la mi bde bas ni smon lam gyi tshig brten par btags nas tshigs su bcad pa'i nang du brten pa'i tshig bcug go //
translated: Since it is uncomfortable to join the lines of the verse, the words of the aspiration are written in dependence, and the words of dependence are placed inside the verse.

original: sems can rnams la snying brtse ba dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems can rnams la snying brtse ba dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: With compassion for sentient beings.

original: sems can sdug bsngal ba mthong na snying rje skye zhing de dag gi sdug bsngal bsal bar 'dod pa ni snying brtse ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can sdug bsngal ba mthong na snying rje skye zhing de dag gi sdug bsngal bsal bar 'dod pa ni snying brtse ba zhes bya ste /
translated: When one sees suffering sentient beings, compassion arises, and the desire to remove their suffering is called compassion.

original: snying brtse ba'i sems des kyang sangs rgyas rnams la mchod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snying brtse ba'i sems des kyang sangs rgyas rnams la mchod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By that compassionate mind, one also makes offerings to the Buddhas. This is the meaning.

original: bdag dang sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir grang ba dang tsha ba dang bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su len pa la ni dka' bar spyod pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su len pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bdag dang sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir grang ba dang tsha ba dang bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su len pa la ni dka' bar spyod pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su len pa zhes bya ste /
translated: For the sake of ripening oneself and sentient beings, enduring the sufferings of cold, heat, hunger, thirst, and so on is called enduring the suffering of difficult conduct.

original: des kyang sangs rgyas la mchod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des kyang sangs rgyas la mchod par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, one also makes offerings to the Buddhas.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par spyod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par spyod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The practice of the six perfections from generosity to wisdom is called the practice of the perfections.

original: des kyang sangs rgyas la mchod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des kyang sangs rgyas la mchod par 'gyur ro //
translated: And that is also an offering to the Buddha.

original: tshul bzhin du chos yid la byed pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du chos yid la byed pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Correct mental attention to the Dharma, etc.

original: chos rnams la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang bdag med pa @49b tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa la dngos por spyod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos rnams la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang bdag med pa @49b tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa la dngos por spyod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Correct mental attention to the impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness of phenomena is called the practice of entities.

original: dngos po spyod pa la ci'i phying tshul bzhin zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po spyod pa la ci'i phying tshul bzhin zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the practice of entities called correct mental attention?

original: des chos thams cad mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du phyin ci ma log par shes par byas pas na /
analyzed: des chos thams cad mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du phyin ci ma log par shes par byas pas na /
translated: Because it causes one to understand without error that all phenomena are characterized by impermanence, suffering, etc.

original: dngos po spyod pa la tshul bzhin yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po spyod pa la tshul bzhin yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the practice of entities is called correct mental attention.

original: mthong ba'i lam la yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the path of seeing, there is the so-called correct view and so on.

original: sa dang po thob nas mthong ba'i lam skyes ba na bdag med pa gnyis khong du chud pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba skyes pa la dngos po chud pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa dang po thob nas mthong ba'i lam skyes ba na bdag med pa gnyis khong du chud pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba skyes pa la dngos po chud pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When one has attained the first ground and the path of seeing has arisen, the correct view that comprehends the two selflessnesses has arisen and is called the attainment of the thing.

original: ci'i phyir yang dag pa'i lta ba de la dngos po chud pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yang dag pa'i lta ba de la dngos po chud pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is that correct view called the attainment of the thing?

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba des gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa'i don phyin ci ma log par chud pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba des gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa'i don phyin ci ma log par chud pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because that correct view unmistakenly comprehends the meaning of the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of phenomena.

original: de ltar yang dag pa'i lta ba skyes pa des kyang de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang dag pa'i lta ba skyes pa des kyang de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that way, that arising of the correct view also becomes an offering to the Tathagata.

original: nyan thos rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i las rnam par grol bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i las rnam par grol bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The listeners are liberated from the karma of the afflictions and so on.

original: nyan thos rnams kyis shes bya'i sgrib pa ma spangs nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs nas mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa la rnam par thar pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyis shes bya'i sgrib pa ma spangs nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs nas mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa la rnam par thar pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The attainment of nirvana by the sravakas, who have eliminated the afflictive obstructions but not the obstructions to omniscience, is called liberation.

original: des kyang nyan thos rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa byas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des kyang nyan thos rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa byas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they also make offerings to the Tathagata.

original: byang chub chen po thob pa'i phyir yang dag pa nyid kyis te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub chen po thob pa'i phyir yang dag pa nyid kyis te zhes bya ba la /
translated: And by attaining great enlightenment, they are in reality.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang pha rol tu phyin pa rim gyis bsgrubs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa byas pa'i rim pas bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa ni yang dag pa nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang pha rol tu phyin pa rim gyis bsgrubs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa byas pa'i rim pas bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa ni yang dag pa nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The attainment of unsurpassed enlightenment by the bodhisattvas through the stages of practicing the perfections and making offerings to the Tathagatas is called reality.

original: byang chub chen po thob pa des kyang phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa byas pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub chen po thob pa des kyang phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa byas pa yin no //
translated: By attaining great enlightenment, they also make offerings to the Tathagatas of the ten directions.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa'i rab tu dbye ba rnam pa gcig bshad zin to //
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa'i rab tu dbye ba rnam pa gcig bshad zin to //
translated: Thus, one type of classification of worship of the Tathagata has been explained.

original: yang 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar dang / nang dang phyi dang / rags pa dang / phra ba dang / bzang po dang / ngan pa dang / nye ba dang / ring ba'i dbye ba'am /
analyzed: yang 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar dang / nang dang phyi dang / rags pa dang / phra ba dang / bzang po dang / ngan pa dang / nye ba dang / ring ba'i dbye ba'am /
translated: Moreover, it is past, future, and present; internal and external; gross and subtle; good and bad; near and far.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa'i rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩrgyu dang 'bras bu de bzhin te //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa'i rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir / rgyu dang 'bras bu de bzhin te //
translated: In order to demonstrate the classification of worship of the Tathagata,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚Äúthe cause and effect are just the same,‚Äù and so on.

original: de la 'das pa'i dus na mchod pa byas pa ni rgyu /üîΩde ltar gyi dus na mchod @50a * //üîΩpa byas pa ni 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: de la 'das pa'i dus na mchod pa byas pa ni rgyu / de ltar gyi dus na mchod @50a * // pa byas pa ni 'bras bu ste /
translated: Therein, worship in the past is the cause;üîΩworship in the present is the effect.

original: sngon mchod pa byas pa'i sa bon yod pas da ltar gyi dus na mchod pa byed pa ni rgyu /
analyzed: sngon mchod pa byas pa'i sa bon yod pas da ltar gyi dus na mchod pa byed pa ni rgyu /
translated: Worship in the present is the cause;

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na mchod pa byed pa ni 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na mchod pa byed pa ni 'bras bu ste /
translated: worship in the future is the effect.

original: da ltar gyi dus na mchod pa byas pa'i rgyus ma 'ongs pa na mchod pa byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus na mchod pa byas pa'i rgyus ma 'ongs pa na mchod pa byed par 'gyur te /
translated: Because of the cause of making offerings in the present, one will make offerings in the future.

original: de ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul gyis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i mchod pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul gyis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i mchod pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, the offerings of the past, present, and future are established by the principle of cause and effect.

original: bdag nyid byed dang gzhan gyis kyang //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag nyid byed dang gzhan gyis kyang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: One does it oneself and also through others.

original: bdag nyid kyi lus dang yan lag 'bul ba dang / nyan pa dang sems pa la sogs pa byed pa ni bdag nyid kyi zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi lus dang yan lag 'bul ba dang / nyan pa dang sems pa la sogs pa byed pa ni bdag nyid kyi zhes bya ste /
translated: One does it oneself by offering one's own body and limbs, and by listening, reflecting, and so on.

original: de ni nang gi mchod pa'o //
analyzed: de ni nang gi mchod pa'o //
translated: That is inner offering.

original: mdza' bo dang nye du gnyen bshes la sogs pa gzhan dag mchod pa byed du bcug pa dang / chos gos la sogs pa 'bul ba ni gzhan gyi zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mdza' bo dang nye du gnyen bshes la sogs pa gzhan dag mchod pa byed du bcug pa dang / chos gos la sogs pa 'bul ba ni gzhan gyi zhes bya ste /
translated: One does it through others by having friends, relatives, kinsmen, and so on make offerings, and by offering Dharma robes and so on.

original: de ni phyi'i mchod pa'o //
analyzed: de ni phyi'i mchod pa'o //
translated: That is outer offering.

original: rnyed pa dang ni bkur stis kyang //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang ni bkur stis kyang //
translated: One also accomplishes it through gain and honor.

original: bsgrub pa de yang rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: bsgrub pa de yang rnam pa gnyis //
translated: That accomplishment is also twofold.

original: mchod pa chung ngu chen po ste ;üîΩ/ zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mchod pa chung ngu chen po ste ;üîΩ/ zhes bya ba la /
translated: The offering is small or great.

original: gzhan yang mchod pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang mchod pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Furthermore, there are two kinds of worship:

original: mchod pa chung ngu dang chen po'o //
analyzed: mchod pa chung ngu dang chen po'o //
translated: inferior and superior.

original: de la rnyed pa ni chos gos dang mal cha la sogs pa 'bul ba'o //
analyzed: de la rnyed pa ni chos gos dang mal cha la sogs pa 'bul ba'o //
translated: Therein, material worship is the offering of robes, bedding, etc.üîΩRespectful worship is the performance of prostration, placing one's palms together in reverence, saluting, and praise.

original: bkur sti ni phyag bya ba dang / thal mo sbyor ba dang / bsdu ba dang / bstod pa byed pa la sogs pa ste de ni mchod pa chung ngu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bkur sti ni phyag bya ba dang / thal mo sbyor ba dang / bsdu ba dang / bstod pa byed pa la sogs pa ste de ni mchod pa chung ngu zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called inferior worship.

original: sgrub pa ni dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / sems pa dang / bsgom pa la sogs pa byed pa ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa ni dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / sems pa dang / bsgom pa la sogs pa byed pa ste /
translated: Accomplishment worship is the performance of listening to the holy Dharma, reflection, and meditation, etc.

original: de ni mchod pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni mchod pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called superior worship.

original: yang na rnyed pa dang bkur stis mchod pa ni chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na rnyed pa dang bkur stis mchod pa ni chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, worship with material things and respect is called inferior.

original: sgrub pas mchod pa ni phra mo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub pas mchod pa ni phra mo zhes bya'o //
translated: Worship by accomplishment is called superior.

original: ngar bcas nga med pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ngar bcas nga med pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Worship with pride and without pride

original: 'dis ni tha ma dang mchog gi mchod pa ston te /
analyzed: 'dis ni tha ma dang mchog gi mchod pa ston te /
translated: This shows inferior and superior worship.

original: mchod pa byed pa bdag nyid dang // mchod par bya ba'i sangs rgyas dang // mchod pa chos gos la sogs pa gsum char yod par dmigs pa ni ngar bcas pa zhes bya ste de ni tha ma'o //
analyzed: mchod pa byed pa bdag nyid dang // mchod par bya ba'i sangs rgyas dang // mchod pa chos gos la sogs pa gsum char yod par dmigs pa ni ngar bcas pa zhes bya ste de ni tha ma'o //
translated: The worship that is accompanied by pride is the lowest.

original: ci'i phyir tha ma zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tha ma zhe na /
translated: Why is it the lowest?

original: dngos por dmigs shing rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir tha ma'o //
analyzed: dngos por dmigs shing rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir tha ma'o //
translated: Because it is accompanied by the conceptualization of the existence of the three, the worshipper, the worshipped, and the worship.üîΩThe worship that is free from pride is the highest.üîΩWhy is it the highest?üîΩBecause it is free from the conceptualization of the existence of the three, the worshipper, the worshipped, and the worship.

original: mchod par byed pa bdag nyid dang // mchod par bya ba'i sangs rgyas dang // mchod pa'i rdzas gsum yod par mi rtog pas mchod pa ni nga med pa zhes bya ste de ni mchog go //
analyzed: mchod par byed pa bdag nyid dang // mchod par bya ba'i sangs rgyas dang // mchod pa'i rdzas gsum yod par mi rtog pas mchod pa ni nga med pa zhes bya ste de ni mchog go //
translated: The worship that is free from conceptualization is the highest.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it the highest?

original: dngos po la rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po la rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is free from the conceptualization of the three, the worshipper, the worshipped, and the worship.

original: sbyor ba dang ni zhes bya @50b ba la ;üîΩsbyor bas mchod pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sbyor ba dang ni zhes bya @50b ba la ; sbyor bas mchod pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The worship that is free from conceptualization is the highest.üîΩThe worship that is free from conceptualization is the highest.üîΩThe worship that is free from conceptualization is the highest.üîΩThe worship that is free from conceptualization is the highest.üîΩThe worship that is free from conceptualization is the highest.üîΩThe worship that is free from conceptualization is the highest.üîΩThe worship that is free from conceptualization is the highest.üîΩThe worship that is free from conceptualization is the highest.üîΩThe worship that is free from conceptualization is the highest.üîΩThe worship that is free from conceptualization is the highest.üîΩThe worship that is free from conceptualization is the highest.üîΩThe worship that is free from conceptualization is the highest.üîΩThe worship that is free from conceptualization is the highest.üîΩThe worship that is free from conceptualization is the highest.üîΩThe worship that is free from conceptualization is the highest.üîΩThe worship that is free from conceptualization is the highest.üîΩThe worship that is free from conceptualization is the highest.üîΩThe worship that is free from conceptualization is the highest.üîΩThe worship that is free from conceptualization is the highest.üîΩThe worship that is free from conceptualization is the highest.üîΩThe worship that is free from conceptualization is the highest.üîΩThe worship that is free from conceptualization is the highest.üîΩThe worship that is free from conceptualization is the highest.üîΩThe worship that is free from conceptualization is the highest.üîΩThe worship that is free from conceptualization is the highest.üîΩThe worship that is free from conceptualization is the highest.üîΩThe worship that is free from conceptualization is the highest.üîΩThe worship that is free from conceptualization is the highest.

original: dus gzhan du mchod par sbyor ba dang / de'i tshe mchod par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: dus gzhan du mchod par sbyor ba dang / de'i tshe mchod par sbyor ba'o //
translated: The worship that is free from conceptualization is the highest.

original: de la dus gzhan du mchod par sbyor ba ni lo dang zla ba dag gis bcad nas phyis mchod par sbyor te de ni thag ring zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la dus gzhan du mchod par sbyor ba ni lo dang zla ba dag gis bcad nas phyis mchod par sbyor te de ni thag ring zhes bya'o //
translated: Worship that is distant in time is that which is performed later, after a long time, having been interrupted for years or months.üîΩWorship that is near in time is that which is performed at the very time one has thought of it.

original: de'i tshe mchod par sbyor ba ni gang gi tshe na mchod par bsams pa de nyid kyi tshe na mchod par byed pa ste de ni nye ba'o //üîΩ'gro de bzhin zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: de'i tshe mchod par sbyor ba ni gang gi tshe na mchod par bsams pa de nyid kyi tshe na mchod par byed pa ste de ni nye ba'o // 'gro de bzhin zhes bya ba la //
translated: Worship is like that.

original: 'gro bas mchod pa yang de gnyis te //üîΩ'gro ba chad nas mchod pa dang / de ma thag tu mchod pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro bas mchod pa yang de gnyis te // 'gro ba chad nas mchod pa dang / de ma thag tu mchod pa'o //
translated: Worship by going is also of two kinds.üîΩWorship by going after an interval is that which is performed after an interval of time.

original: de la 'gro ba chad nas mchod pa ni //
analyzed: de la 'gro ba chad nas mchod pa ni //
translated: Worship by going immediately is that which is performed without delay.üîΩWorship by going after an interval is that which is performed after an interval of two, three, one hundred, or one thousand lifetimes.

original: tshe rabs gnyis sam gsum mam brgya'am stong dag gis bar du ma mchod nas des phyis mchod pa byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshe rabs gnyis sam gsum mam brgya'am stong dag gis bar du ma mchod nas des phyis mchod pa byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one does not worship for a long time, but worships later.

original: de de la byang chub sems dpa' gcig gis sems can yongs su smin par byas nas der zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyis smin par byas pa yin pas bya ba thams cad 'dres pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de de la byang chub sems dpa' gcig gis sems can yongs su smin par byas nas der zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyis smin par byas pa yin pas bya ba thams cad 'dres pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In that, one bodhisattva matures beings, and another bodhisattva who has entered there matures them.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gcig gis de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa byas nas der zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis kyang mchod pa byas pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gcig gis de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa byas nas der zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis kyang mchod pa byas pa yin te /
translated: One bodhisattva makes offerings to the Tathagata, and all the bodhisattvas who have entered there make offerings.

original: de bas na nye bar 'dres pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na nye bar 'dres pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúmixed.‚Äù

original: bsten pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa rnam pa bdun te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsten pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa rnam pa bdun te zhes bya ba la /
translated: There are seven verses on the analysis of reliance.

original: phyi'i dngos po la chags pa spang ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa bya ba bstan nas /
analyzed: phyi'i dngos po la chags pa spang ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa bya ba bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the worship of the Tathagata in order to abandon attachment to external things,

original: da ni bdag gi lus la chags pa spang ba'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa bstan te /
analyzed: da ni bdag gi lus la chags pa spang ba'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa bstan te /
translated: now, in order to abandon attachment to one‚Äôs own body, reliance on the spiritual friend is taught.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa yang rnam pa dus bstan pa phye ste tshigs su bcad pa bdun gyis bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩde la tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang lngas ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa yang rnam pa dus bstan pa phye ste tshigs su bcad pa bdun gyis bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to // de la tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang lngas ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The reliance on the spiritual master is also shown in seven verses, distinguishing the aspects and times.üîΩThe meaning is that it is shown in seven verses.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa rnam pa bdun gyis bstan to zhes glengs pa las tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang lngas ni brten pa'i gzhi la sogs pa don rnam pa brgyad bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa rnam pa bdun gyis bstan to zhes glengs pa las tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang lngas ni brten pa'i gzhi la sogs pa don rnam pa brgyad bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In the introduction, it is said that the reliance on the spiritual master is shown in seven verses, distinguishing the aspects. The meaning is that it is shown in seven and a half verses.

original: bshes gnyen dul ba zhi ba nyer zhi ba /
analyzed: bshes gnyen dul ba zhi ba nyer zhi ba /
translated: The spiritual master is disciplined, peaceful, and tranquil,

original: yon tan lhag pa brtson 'grus lung dang ldan //üîΩde nyid rab tu rtogs pa'i tshig dang ldan //
analyzed: yon tan lhag pa brtson 'grus lung dang ldan // de nyid rab tu rtogs pa'i tshig dang ldan //
translated: superior in qualities, diligent, and learned.

original: snying rje yod dang skyo ba rnam par spangs //üîΩzhes bya ba'i @51a * //
analyzed: snying rje yod dang skyo ba rnam par spangs //üîΩzhes bya ba'i @51a * //
translated: He is skilled in explaining the truth, has a sense of compassion, and is free of discouragement.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis yon tan ji lta bu dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa'i gzhi dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi mtshan nyid ston to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis yon tan ji lta bu dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa'i gzhi dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi mtshan nyid ston to //
translated: This verse shows the characteristics of the spiritual teacher as the basis for relying on the spiritual teacher who has such qualities.

original: de la lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa dang ldan pas chags par 'gyur ba'i dngos po rnams mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing dpe byad du mi 'dzin pas /üîΩmig la sogs pa'i dbang po drug yul la mi 'jug par sbas pa dang ldan pas dul ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa dang ldan pas chags par 'gyur ba'i dngos po rnams mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing dpe byad du mi 'dzin pas / mig la sogs pa'i dbang po drug yul la mi 'jug par sbas pa dang ldan pas dul ba zhes bya'o //
translated: He is disciplined because he does not grasp the signs of things that might cause attachment, and he does not grasp their secondary marks, because he possesses the training in superior morality.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pas na gang gi tshe sems phyi rol du g-yengs bar gyur pa na yang zhi gnas bsgoms pas sems mi 'phro bas nang du sdud par byed de /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pas na gang gi tshe sems phyi rol du g-yengs bar gyur pa na yang zhi gnas bsgoms pas sems mi 'phro bas nang du sdud par byed de /
translated: He is restrained because he possesses the meditative absorption by which, when his mind is distracted outward, he draws it back inward and fixes it in samƒÅdhi, through the cultivation of ≈õamatha.

original: de bas na zhib zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bas na zhib zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore he is called ‚Äútranquil.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang ldan pa ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang ldan pa ston to //
translated: This shows that he possesses the training in superior mind.

original: gang gi tshe nyan pa dang sems pa la sogs pa'i tshe dge ba la zhugs pa na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nyan pa dang sems pa la sogs pa'i tshe dge ba la zhugs pa na /
translated: When he is engaged in virtue, whether listening, reflecting, or meditating,

original: rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis sems phyi rol tu g-yengs nas 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa zhig skyes par gyur na shes rab kyis myur bar shes par byas nas de'i gnyen po mi gtsang ba dang byams pa la sogs pa bsgoms nas zhi
analyzed: rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis sems phyi rol tu g-yengs nas 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa zhig skyes par gyur na shes rab kyis myur bar shes par byas nas de'i gnyen po mi gtsang ba dang byams pa la sogs pa bsgoms nas zhi
translated: pacify it by cultivating its antidote, such as contemplation of the impurities or loving-kindness.

original: bar byed pas na nye bar zhi ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bar byed pas na nye bar zhi ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus it is called ‚Äútranquility.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni lhag pa'i shes rab dang ldan par ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni lhag pa'i shes rab dang ldan par ston to //
translated: This shows that he is endowed with superior wisdom.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen de yang tshul khrims la sogs pa'i yon tan dang mang du thos pa la sogs pa bdag dang mnyam pa'am /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen de yang tshul khrims la sogs pa'i yon tan dang mang du thos pa la sogs pa bdag dang mnyam pa'am /
translated: Moreover, that spiritual friend is not equal to oneself in the virtues of morality, etc., or in learning, etc.,

original: bdag pas chung ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag pas chung ba ma yin gyi /
translated: or inferior.

original: tshul khrims la sogs pa'i yon tan dang / thos pa la sogs pa bdag pas 'phags pa la brten te /
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pa'i yon tan dang / thos pa la sogs pa bdag pas 'phags pa la brten te /
translated: One should rely on someone who is superior to oneself in the virtues of morality, etc., and in learning, etc.

original: de bas na yon tan lhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na yon tan lhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus it is called ‚Äúsuperiority of virtue.‚Äù

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen de yang slob ma'i don dang ; gzhan gyi don bya ba la btang snyoms su 'dor zhing g-yeng bar byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen de yang slob ma'i don dang ; gzhan gyi don bya ba la btang snyoms su 'dor zhing g-yeng bar byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: That spiritual teacher is not indifferent to the disciple's welfare and to the welfare of others, nor is he distracted.

original: gcig tu gzhan gyi don bya ba la sems spro zhing 'bad pa la brten te /
analyzed: gcig tu gzhan gyi don bya ba la sems spro zhing 'bad pa la brten te /
translated: He is intent on the welfare of others, and he is dedicated to that.

original: de bas na brtson 'grus dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na brtson 'grus dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is called the one who is energetic.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen de yang thos pa chung ba ma yin gyi bshad par bya ba'i gsung rab kyi chos mang du thos pa dang ldan pa la brten par bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen de yang thos pa chung ba ma yin gyi bshad par bya ba'i gsung rab kyi chos mang du thos pa dang ldan pa la brten par bya ste /
translated: That spiritual teacher is not one who has studied little, but one who has studied much the scriptures that are to be explained.

original: de bas na lung dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //üîΩdge ba'i bshes gnyen de 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum mam /
analyzed: de bas na lung dang ldan pa zhes bya'o // dge ba'i bshes gnyen de 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum mam /
translated: Therefore, he is called the one who has the scriptures.üîΩThat spiritual teacher has realized the three doors to deliverance, which are the four noble truths, or he has realized some other doctrine, such as impermanence, suffering, etc.

original: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i chos 'ga' rtogs pa yod @51b pas na de nyid rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i chos 'ga' rtogs pa yod @51b pas na de nyid rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, he is called the one who has realization.

original: de lta bu la brten par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bu la brten par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should rely on such a person.

original: gang la brten par bya ba'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen de tshig 'brel cing smra mkhas la tshig 'jebs ba smra ba la brten par bya ste /
analyzed: gang la brten par bya ba'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen de tshig 'brel cing smra mkhas la tshig 'jebs ba smra ba la brten par bya ste /
translated: The spiritual master on whom one relies is eloquent, skilled in speech, and has a pleasing voice.

original: de bas na tshig dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na tshig dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is called ‚Äúeloquent.‚Äù

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen de slob ma la chos ston pa yang rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i phyir ston pa ma yin gyi //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen de slob ma la chos ston pa yang rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i phyir ston pa ma yin gyi //
translated: The spiritual master teaches the Dharma to his disciples not for the sake of gain or honor,

original: gang la chos bstan par bya ba'i slob ma rnams kyi nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston te /
analyzed: gang la chos bstan par bya ba'i slob ma rnams kyi nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston te /
translated: but in order to eliminate the mental afflictions of those disciples who are to be taught the Dharma.

original: de bas na snying rje yod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na snying rje yod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is called ‚Äúcompassionate.‚Äù

original: chos ston pa na ma gus pa dang brnyas pa'i tshul du ston pa dang / res 'ga' ston res 'ga' mi ston pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: chos ston pa na ma gus pa dang brnyas pa'i tshul du ston pa dang / res 'ga' ston res 'ga' mi ston pa ma yin gyi /
translated: When he teaches the Dharma, he does not do so with a disrespectful or contemptuous manner, or by teaching sometimes and not teaching at other times.

original: gus par byas nas rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par ston par byed de /
analyzed: gus par byas nas rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par ston par byed de /
translated: Rather, he teaches with respect, and he teaches all the time without interruption.

original: de bas na skyo ba rnam par spangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na skyo ba rnam par spangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is called ‚Äúfree of weariness.‚Äù

original: bkur sti rnyed dang rim gro byed pa dang / sgrub par byed pas bshes gnyen bsten par bya //
analyzed: bkur sti rnyed dang rim gro byed pa dang / sgrub par byed pas bshes gnyen bsten par bya //
translated: One should attend on the spiritual teacher with respect, service, acquisition, and practice.

original: zhes bya bas /
analyzed: zhes bya bas /
translated: Thus,

original: bsten pa'i dngos po bstan to //
analyzed: bsten pa'i dngos po bstan to //
translated: the means of attending are shown.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten na dngos po gang gis bsten zhe na /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten na dngos po gang gis bsten zhe na /
translated: If one attends on the spiritual teacher, by what means does one attend?

original: bkur sti'i dngos po dang / rim gro byed pa'i dngos po dang / sgrub par byed pa'i dngos pos bsten to //
analyzed: bkur sti'i dngos po dang / rim gro byed pa'i dngos po dang / sgrub par byed pa'i dngos pos bsten to //
translated: One attends with the means of respect, the means of service, and the means of practice.

original: de la dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi yon tan bsgrags pa dang / bsdu ba dang / bskyal ba dang / phyag 'tshal ba dang / thal mo sbyor ba la sogs pa byed pa ni bkur sti'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi yon tan bsgrags pa dang / bsdu ba dang / bskyal ba dang / phyag 'tshal ba dang / thal mo sbyor ba la sogs pa byed pa ni bkur sti'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therein, the means of respect is the proclamation of the spiritual teacher's virtues, the act of collecting and bringing, the act of bowing down, the act of placing one's palms together in reverence, and so forth.

original: chos gos dang bsod snyoms la sogs pa 'bul ba ni rnyed pa'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos gos dang bsod snyoms la sogs pa 'bul ba ni rnyed pa'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
translated: The means of acquisition is the offering of Dharma robes, alms, and so forth.

original: mnye ba dang bkru ba la sogs pa las su bya ba thams cad byed pa ni rim gro byed pa'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mnye ba dang bkru ba la sogs pa las su bya ba thams cad byed pa ni rim gro byed pa'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
translated: The means of service is the performance of all actions such as massaging, bathing, and so forth.

original: 'di dag gis ni phyi'i dngos pos bsten pa bstan to dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis ji ltar bstan cing bsgo ba dang / ji ltar bshad pa bzhin du nyams su len cing nyan pa dang sems pa dang bsgom pa la sogs pa byed pa ni sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni phyi'i dngos pos bsten pa bstan to dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis ji ltar bstan cing bsgo ba dang / ji ltar bshad pa bzhin du nyams su len cing nyan pa dang sems pa dang bsgom pa la sogs pa byed pa ni sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po zhes bya ste /
translated: These lines indicate the reliance on external things.

original: 'dis ni nang gi dngos pos bsten pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni nang gi dngos pos bsten pa bstan to //
translated: The reliance on internal things is indicated by the line:üîΩThe wise one, having understood and contemplated the teaching in that way,

original: blo can chos la de bzhin shes bsam dang / bshes gnyen drung du dus su 'dud par 'gro //üîΩzhes bya ba 'dis //
analyzed: blo can chos la de bzhin shes bsam dang / bshes gnyen drung du dus su 'dud par 'gro // zhes bya ba 'dis //
translated: approaches the spiritual master at the proper time.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa'i mtshan ma bstan te /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa'i mtshan ma bstan te /
translated: This line indicates the sign of reliance on the spiritual master.

original: mtshan ma yang rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: mtshan ma yang rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The sign is threefold.

original: de la blo can ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rten par byed pa'i gang zag go //üîΩchos @52a * //
analyzed: de la blo can ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rten par byed pa'i gang zag go // chos @52a * //
translated: The wise one refers to the person who relies on the spiritual master.

original: la de bzhin shes bsam dang // zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma gcig ste /
analyzed: la de bzhin shes bsam dang // zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma gcig ste /
translated: Having understood and contemplated the teaching in that way refers to the first sign.

original: chos dang chos smra ba'i gang zag la brnyas pa'i bsam pa'am chos rku ba'i bsam pa'am /
analyzed: chos dang chos smra ba'i gang zag la brnyas pa'i bsam pa'am chos rku ba'i bsam pa'am /
translated: It is to have contempt for the Dharma and for the person who teaches it, or to have the intention to steal the Dharma.

original: klan ka btsal ba'i bsam pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen btsal bar mi bya'i /
analyzed: klan ka btsal ba'i bsam pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen btsal bar mi bya'i /
translated: One should not seek a spiritual teacher with the intention of despising the teaching and the person who teaches it, or with the intention of stealing the teaching, or with the intention of finding fault.

original: bdag nyid kyis chos kyi don rtogs shing shes par bya ba'i bsam pas shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis chos kyi don rtogs shing shes par bya ba'i bsam pas shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should seek a spiritual teacher with the intention of understanding the meaning of the teaching by oneself.

original: dus dus su 'gro ba ni mtshan ma gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: dus dus su 'gro ba ni mtshan ma gnyis pa ste /
translated: From time to time means the second sign.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung du 'gro na yang bsam gtan byed pa dang / zas za ba la sogs pa skabs su ma bab pa'i tshe 'gro bar mi bya'i /üîΩskabs su bab par byas nas 'gro bar byed de /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung du 'gro na yang bsam gtan byed pa dang / zas za ba la sogs pa skabs su ma bab pa'i tshe 'gro bar mi bya'i / skabs su bab par byas nas 'gro bar byed de /
translated: Even when one goes to the spiritual teacher, one should not go at an inappropriate time, such as when he is meditating or eating, butüîΩone should go at an appropriate time.

original: skabs su bab pa'i tshe bsten cing 'gro bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skabs su bab pa'i tshe bsten cing 'gro bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should serve and go to him at an appropriate time.

original: 'dud pas 'gro ba'i mtshan ma gsum ste /
analyzed: 'dud pas 'gro ba'i mtshan ma gsum ste /
translated: With humility means the third sign.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gan du 'gro ba yang lus dang sems dul bar byas shing gus pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyis 'gro bar bya'i /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gan du 'gro ba yang lus dang sems dul bar byas shing gus pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyis 'gro bar bya'i /
translated: Moreover, when you go to the spiritual teacher, you should go with a mind of respect, having disciplined your body and mind.

original: lus dang sems ma dul ba dang / ma gus pa dang / nga rgyal gyi spyod lam gyis ni 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lus dang sems ma dul ba dang / ma gus pa dang / nga rgyal gyi spyod lam gyis ni 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that you should not go with undisciplined body and mind, with disrespect, or with a demeanor of pride.

original: de ni bkur sti rnyed la 'dod pa med //
analyzed: de ni bkur sti rnyed la 'dod pa med //
translated: He does not desire gain or honor.

original: bsgrub par bya phyir de ni sngo bar byed //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya phyir de ni sngo bar byed //
translated: He dedicates it to the practice.

original: ces bya ba 'dis bsngo ba bstan te /
analyzed: ces bya ba 'dis bsngo ba bstan te /
translated: This shows the dedication.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa de yang khe dang bkur sti dang rnyed pa 'dod pa'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten zhing sngo bar byed pa ma yin gyi //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa de yang khe dang bkur sti dang rnyed pa 'dod pa'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten zhing sngo bar byed pa ma yin gyi //
translated: He does not dedicate the reliance on the spiritual teacher to the acquisition of gain, honor, and reverence.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i phyir sngo bar byed do //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i phyir sngo bar byed do //
translated: He dedicates it to the practice.

original: ji ltar bsngo zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bsngo zhe na /
translated: How does he dedicate it?

original: bdag gis dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa 'dis rnyed pa dang bkur sti thob par gyur cig ces ni mi bsngo'o //
analyzed: bdag gis dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa 'dis rnyed pa dang bkur sti thob par gyur cig ces ni mi bsngo'o //
translated: He does not dedicate it with the thought, ‚ÄúBy this reliance on the spiritual teacher, may I obtain gain and honor.‚Äù

original: bdag gis dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pas nam zhig na bdag thos pa dang / sems pa dang / bsgom pa'i shes rab gsum gyi sgo nas 'phags pa'i lam sgrub cing chos nyid kyi don rtogs par gyur cig ces sngo bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gis dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pas nam zhig na bdag thos pa dang / sems pa dang / bsgom pa'i shes rab gsum gyi sgo nas 'phags pa'i lam sgrub cing chos nyid kyi don rtogs par gyur cig ces sngo bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One dedicates the merit, thinking, When shall I, by relying on the spiritual master, practice the noble path by means of the three wisdoms of listening, reflection, and meditation, and realize the meaning of reality?

original: ji ltar bstan nas sgrub par byed pas na //
analyzed: ji ltar bstan nas sgrub par byed pas na //
translated: How does one practice by relying on the spiritual master?

original: blo can de bas de'i sems mgu bar byed //
analyzed: blo can de bas de'i sems mgu bar byed //
translated: The wise one, therefore, delights the mind of the spiritual master.

original: ces bya bas rgyu bstan te /
analyzed: ces bya bas rgyu bstan te /
translated: This verse shows the cause.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten par bya ba'i rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten par bya ba'i rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of relying on the spiritual master?

original: gang gis dge ba'i bshes gnyen de'i sems mgu ba dang dga' bar byed pa de ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: gang gis dge ba'i bshes gnyen de'i sems mgu ba dang dga' bar byed pa de ni rgyu'o //
translated: The cause is that by which one delights and pleases the mind of the spiritual master.

original: ji ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi sems mgu bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi sems mgu bar bya zhe na /
translated: How does one delight the mind of the spiritual master?

original: dge ba'i bshes @52b gnyen gyis ji lta ji ltar bstan cing bsgo ba dang / bshad cing gdams pa de lta de ltar nyams su len cing sgrub par byed pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi sems mgu bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes @52b gnyen gyis ji lta ji ltar bstan cing bsgo ba dang / bshad cing gdams pa de lta de ltar nyams su len cing sgrub par byed pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi sems mgu bar 'gyur te /
translated: In whatever way the spiritual master teaches, instructs, explains, and advises, in just that way he practices and accomplishes it.

original: de ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi sems mgu na /
analyzed: de ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi sems mgu na /
translated: Thus, the spiritual master's mind is pleased.üîΩSince he instructs and teaches him in that way, the spiritual master's mind is pleased.

original: bdag la 'doms pa dang ston par byed pas na dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi sems mgu ba ni bsten pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: bdag la 'doms pa dang ston par byed pas na dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi sems mgu ba ni bsten pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of reliance is the spiritual master's mind being pleased.

original: theg pa gsum la mkhas par blo chung nas //
analyzed: theg pa gsum la mkhas par blo chung nas //
translated: Having become wise in the three vehicles,

original: nang gi theg pa bsgrub phyir 'bad par byed //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: nang gi theg pa bsgrub phyir 'bad par byed // ces bya ba la /
translated: he strives to accomplish the inner vehicle.

original: blo ldan shes rab kyis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang theg pa chen po'i mtshan nyid khong du chud nas theg pa gsum la mkhas pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: blo ldan shes rab kyis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang theg pa chen po'i mtshan nyid khong du chud nas theg pa gsum la mkhas pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa'i ye shes so //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa mi sgrub kyi /

analyzed: sems can dpag med smin par bya phyir dang // zhing dag par yang sbyang bar bya ba'i phyir //

original: zhes bya bas /

analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa'i zhing bstan te /

analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa'i zhing rnam pa gnyis so //

analyzed: gang zhe na / sems can gyi zhing dang / snod kyi 'jig rten gyi khams so //

analyzed: de la sems can gyi zhing ni yongs su smin par byas te /
translated: Among them, the field of sentient beings is to be ripened.

analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa rnams dge ba tshad med pa spyod du bcug nas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten to //
translated: He has caused countless sentient beings to practice immeasurable virtue, and he has relied on spiritual benefactors in order to bring sentient beings to full maturity.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten gyi zhing ni yongs su dag cing sbyang bar bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten to //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten gyi zhing ni yongs su dag cing sbyang bar bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten to //
translated: He has relied on spiritual benefactors in order to purify the world-realms which are the vessels of the Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gser dang bee d'u rya la sogs pa'i sa gzhi dang / dpag bsam gyi shing la sogs pa'i rgyan phun sum tshogs pa rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten to zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: chos kyi bgo skal yon tan ldan pa de /

analyzed: 'di ltar pha ma'i nor lta bu dang / phu nu dang spyi nor lta bu @53a * //
translated: Thus, it is like the wealth of one's parents, or like the wealth of one's brothers and the community.

original: ji dgar spyod du dbang ba la bgo skal zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ji dgar spyod du dbang ba la bgo skal zhes bya ste /
translated: One is said to have a share in that over which one has control in one's enjoyment.

original: 'di'i skabs su bgo skal gyi don ni lhur len pa la bya ste /
analyzed: 'di'i skabs su bgo skal gyi don ni lhur len pa la bya ste /

original: chos lhur len cing chos bdag gir byed pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa la gnas nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten par bya'i //
analyzed: chos lhur len cing chos bdag gir byed pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa la gnas nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten par bya'i //
translated: One should rely upon the spiritual master while abiding in the virtues of being intent upon the Dharma and making the Dharma one's own.

original: zang zing lhur len cing zang zing bdag gir byed pa la gnas nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten par bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zang zing lhur len cing zang zing bdag gir byed pa la gnas nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten par bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should not rely upon the spiritual master while abiding in the intentness upon material things and making material things one's own. This is the meaning.

original: 'di man chad tshigs bcad phyed dang gsum gyis bsten pa'i rnam par dbye bar rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di man chad tshigs bcad phyed dang gsum gyis bsten pa'i rnam par dbye bar rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: From here on, the text for the next three and a half verses should be understood as the analysis of reliance.

original: tshigs su bcad pa bdun gyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa'i rab tu dbye ba bshad do zhes glengs pa la /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa bdun gyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa'i rab tu dbye ba bshad do zhes glengs pa la /

original: tshigs bcad phyed dang lngas gnas dang dngos po la sogs pa'i don brgyad dang sbyar nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa'i rab tu dbye ba bstan te /

original: da tshigs bcad gsum gyis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba'i sgo nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: da tshigs bcad gsum gyis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba'i sgo nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa'i 'bras bu'o //

original: da ltar gyi dus la rab tu dbye ba tshul de 'dra ba ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus la rab tu dbye ba tshul de 'dra ba ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the present time is taught in a similar manner, that is, by way of classification.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni 'das pa la sogs pa phye ste snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni 'das pa la sogs pa phye ste snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba la /

original: 'di ltar tshe rabs snga mar dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa ni rgyu yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshe rabs snga mar dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa ni rgyu yin la /
translated: Thus, reliance on the spiritual master in former lives is the cause.

original: da ltar gyi dus na dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus na dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa ni 'bras bu'o //

original: da ltar gyi dus na dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa ni rgyu yin la /
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus na dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa ni rgyu yin la /

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten par 'gyur ba ni 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten par 'gyur ba ni 'bras bu ste /

original: de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul gyis na dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa yang 'das pa dang da ltar dang / ma 'ongs pa dang rnam pa gsum gzhag ste /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul gyis na dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa yang 'das pa dang da ltar dang / ma 'ongs pa dang rnam pa gsum gzhag ste /

original: snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don ni de lta bu'o //üîΩchos kyi sgo ni rjes rtogs pas //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don ni de lta bu'o // chos kyi sgo ni rjes rtogs pas //
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúas before‚Äù is this.üîΩThe wise rely on a spiritual master even externally,

original: blo can phyi rol gyis kyang bshes gnyen bsten //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: blo can phyi rol gyis kyang bshes gnyen bsten // zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: phyi'i bsten pa dang / nang gi bsten pa bstan te /

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa'i sgo nas chos kyi sgo'i ting nge 'dzin rtogs te ji ltar rtogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin de nyid la yang nas yang du goms par byas pas kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten par 'gyur te 'di ni nang gi bsten pa'o
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa'i sgo nas chos kyi sgo'i ting nge 'dzin rtogs te ji ltar rtogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin de nyid la yang nas yang du goms par byas pas kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten par 'gyur te 'di ni nang gi bsten pa'o
translated: Through reliance on a spiritual master, one understands the door of the Dharma, the meditative absorption. And by repeatedly cultivating that very meditative absorption that one has understood, one relies on a spiritual master. This is internal reliance.

original: // chos gos dang bsod snyoms la sogs pa 'bul ba ni @53b phyi rol gyi bsten pa ste /
analyzed: // chos gos dang bsod snyoms la sogs pa 'bul ba ni @53b phyi rol gyi bsten pa ste /

original: des phyi'i bsten pa bstan to //
analyzed: des phyi'i bsten pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the external service.

original: chos la nyan pa sems kyi rnal 'byor ni //
analyzed: chos la nyan pa sems kyi rnal 'byor ni //
translated: The mental yoga is listening to the Dharma.

original: zhes bya bas /
analyzed: zhes bya bas /
translated: This shows

analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rtsing bas brten pa dang phra bas brten pa bstan te /

analyzed: de la dge ba'i bshes gnyen la nyan pa'i sgo nas bsten pa ni rtsing ba zhes bya ste /

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

analyzed: gzhan gyi sgra tsam la brten nas sems phyi rol du rgyug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mind runs outside, relying on mere external sound.

analyzed: sems pa dang sgom pa'i sgo nas bsten pa ni phra ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The service through reflection and meditation is called subtle,

analyzed: sems nang du lta ba'i phyir ro //

original: de nyid sems kyi rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: de nyid sems kyi rnal 'byor ro //
translated: That is the mental yoga.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

analyzed: ngar bcas pa dang nga med yid ldan ni //

analyzed: tha ma dang ni mchog gi rnam pa'o //
translated: The inferior and superior types are those who have pride and those who are without pride.

analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis dge ba'i bshes gnyen la tha mas bsten pa dang / mchog gis bsten pa ste / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / bdag dang chos gos la sogs pa bsten par bya ba'i dngos po yod par mthong nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen 'di la dngos po 'di dag gis bsten to zhes lta ba ni dar bcas pa'i yid dang ldan pa ste tha ma'o //
translated: This shows the inferior and superior types of reliance on the spiritual master.üîΩThe inferior type is the one who has pride, who thinks, ‚ÄúI rely on this spiritual master with these things.‚Äù The superior type is the one who is without pride, who does not think, ‚ÄúI rely on this spiritual master with these things.‚Äù

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bdag dang bsten par bya ba'i dngos po gsum char ma mthong bas dge ba'i bshes gnyen 'di la dngos po 'dis bdag gis brten to zhes mi lta ba ni nga med pa'i yid dang ldan pa ste mchog go //üîΩ'gro bar sbyor dang smon lam dag gis kyang //

analyzed: blo ldan dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa'o //
translated: The wise rely on the spiritual master through application and through aspirational prayers.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: This shows

analyzed: thag nye bar bsten pa dang / thag ring bar bsten pa ston to //
translated: the near and the distant.üîΩThe distant is that which is practiced after worship over many lives,

analyzed: tshe rabs du mas mchod nas 'gro ba mang po zhig gi lus blangs te bsten pa ni thag ring ba'o //

analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten par gyur cig ces smon lam 'debs shing tshe 'di nyid la sten par byed pa ni thag nye ba'o //

analyzed: @54a * // bsten pa'i mchog gang zhe na /
translated: What is the best kind of reliance?

analyzed: bsten pa bla na med pa gang yin pa de tshigs su bcad pa bdun pas bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: dam pa'i bshes gnyen bsten pa ni //

original: rang gi sems kyis mchog yin te /

analyzed: chos la mos pa dang / bsam pa dang ni 'byor ba'o //

original: btang snyoms kyis ni tshor ba bde ba dang phrad ba dang / mdza' ba la sogs pa dang phrad nas 'dod chags skye ba dang / tshor ba sdug bsngal ba dang dgra la sogs pa dang phrad nas zhes sdang bar 'gyur bas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'i sems can rnams la dmigs te /

translated: equanimity is the objective mental orientation toward sentient beings who are afflicted by the afflictions that arise from contact with pleasant feelings and friends, etc., and from contact with painful feelings and enemies, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: btang snyoms ni tshor ba de rnams la sems nyon mongs pa med pa'i sbyor ba'i rnam pa yin te /
analyzed: btang snyoms ni tshor ba de rnams la sems nyon mongs pa med pa'i sbyor ba'i rnam pa yin te /
translated: Equanimity is the aspect of the mental orientation that is free from the afflictions with regard to those feelings.

original: de bas na tshor ba bde ba dang / mdza' ba la @56a * //
analyzed: de bas na tshor ba bde ba dang / mdza' ba la @56a * //
translated: Therefore, one thinks, ‚ÄúMay sentient beings who are happy and who have friends not be separated from happiness and friends.‚Äù

original: sogs pa dang phrad na yang 'dod chags skye bar ma gyur cig / tshor ba sdug bsngal ba dang dgra la sogs pa dang phrad na yang zhe sdang bar ma gyur cig ces dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sogs pa dang phrad na yang 'dod chags skye bar ma gyur cig / tshor ba sdug bsngal ba dang dgra la sogs pa dang phrad na yang zhe sdang bar ma gyur cig ces dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: When I encounter painful feelings and enemies and so on, may aversion not arise.

original: de dag gis tshad med pa gang gis sems can gyi tshogs gang la dmigs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis tshad med pa gang gis sems can gyi tshogs gang la dmigs pa bstan to //
translated: Thus they indicate the object of the immeasurables and the assembly of sentient beings.

original: de bstan chos zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: de bstan chos zhes bya ba la //
translated: The teaching of that is the Dharma.

original: de'i sgras ni tshad med pa bzhi la bya ste /
analyzed: de'i sgras ni tshad med pa bzhi la bya ste /
translated: The word that refers to the four immeasurables.

original: chos la dmigs pa'i byams pas ni tshad med pa bzhi ston pa'i theg pa chen po'i mdo sde la dmigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos la dmigs pa'i byams pas ni tshad med pa bzhi ston pa'i theg pa chen po'i mdo sde la dmigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that loving kindness that focuses on the Dharma focuses on the Mahayana sutras that teach the four immeasurables.

original: de'i de nyid la ni brten pa rnams 'jug go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i de nyid la ni brten pa rnams 'jug go zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those who rely on that enter.

original: de'i zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bde ba 'dod pa dang / sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba dang / bde ba dang ldan pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i sems can rnams dang / tshad med pa bzhi ston pa'i mdo sde la snyegs te /
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bde ba 'dod pa dang / sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba dang / bde ba dang ldan pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i sems can rnams dang / tshad med pa bzhi ston pa'i mdo sde la snyegs te /
translated: The word ‚Äútheir‚Äù refers to those who desire pleasure, those who are oppressed by suffering, those who are happy, and those sentient beings with afflicted minds, and it refers to the sutra that teaches the four immeasurables.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni sems can rnam pa bzhi'i stong pa nyid dang / theg pa chen po'i chos kyi stong pa nyid la bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni sems can rnam pa bzhi'i stong pa nyid dang / theg pa chen po'i chos kyi stong pa nyid la bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the emptiness of the four kinds of sentient beings and the emptiness of the teachings of the Great Vehicle.

original: mi dmigs pa'i byams pas ni /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i byams pas ni /
translated: Through nonapprehending love,

original: de dag gi stong pa nyid la dmigs kyi sems can so so dang chos la ni dmigs par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag gi stong pa nyid la dmigs kyi sems can so so dang chos la ni dmigs par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: one focuses on their emptiness, but one does not focus on individual sentient beings or on the teachings. This is the meaning.

original: mi dmigs pa ni de'i de bzhin nyid la ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni de'i de bzhin nyid la ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúNonapprehension is its suchness‚Äù and so on.

original: mi dmigs pa'i byams pas ni sems can dang chos kyi stong pa nyid la dmigs te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i byams pas ni sems can dang chos kyi stong pa nyid la dmigs te /
translated: Through nonapprehending love, one focuses on the emptiness of sentient beings and of the teachings.

original: de'i tshe sems can dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs rnams ci la yang mi rtog pa'i mtshan nyid du ro gcig par gnas pas sems can tha dad pa dang / chos tha dad pa byed pa med pas na mi dmigs pa'i byams pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe sems can dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs rnams ci la yang mi rtog pa'i mtshan nyid du ro gcig par gnas pas sems can tha dad pa dang / chos tha dad pa byed pa med pas na mi dmigs pa'i byams pa zhes bya'o //
translated: At that time, the collection of sentient beings and mental factors abide as a single taste in the characteristic of non-conceptuality. Since there is no differentiation of sentient beings and no differentiation of phenomena, it is called ‚Äúnon-apprehending love.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang zhes bya bas /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya bas /
translated: Moreover,

original: dmigs su med pa'i byams pa'i rab tu dbye ba ston to //
analyzed: dmigs su med pa'i byams pa'i rab tu dbye ba ston to //
translated: it shows the divisions of non-apprehending love.

original: dmigs su med pa'i byams pa la phye na rnam pa bzhi yod par 'dod do //
analyzed: dmigs su med pa'i byams pa la phye na rnam pa bzhi yod par 'dod do //
translated: When non-apprehending love is divided, it is asserted to be of four types.

original: de yang de bzhin nyid kyi phyir //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin nyid kyi phyir //
translated: That is also because of suchness.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis rnam pa gcig bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis rnam pa gcig bstan te /
translated: This teaches the first type.

original: sems can rnams dang chos rnams kyi stong pa nyid la dmigs pa'i byams pa la mi dmigs pa'i byams pa zhes bya ste /üîΩbdag dang chos su dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: sems can rnams dang chos rnams kyi stong pa nyid la dmigs pa'i byams pa la mi dmigs pa'i byams pa zhes bya ste / bdag dang chos su dmigs pa'am /
translated: Love that observes the emptiness of sentient beings and phenomena is called ‚Äúnon-apprehending love‚ÄùüîΩbecause it does not apprehend a self or phenomena,

original: phyi dang nang du dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi dang nang du dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or external or internal objects.

original: bzod pa thob pas rnam par dag / ces bya bas /
analyzed: bzod pa thob pas rnam par dag / ces bya bas /
translated: It is completely pure by attaining acceptance.

original: rnam pa gnyis pa bstan te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis pa bstan te /
translated: This teaches the second type.

original: sa brgyad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pas /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pas /
translated: Because the bodhisattvas on the eighth level have acquired patient acceptance of the fact that phenomena are not produced,

original: byams pa la @56b sogs pa tshad med pa'i sa bon brtas pa'i phyir tshad med pa rnam par dag ste /
analyzed: byams pa la @56b sogs pa tshad med pa'i sa bon brtas pa'i phyir tshad med pa rnam par dag ste /
translated: their boundless attitudes of loving kindness and so forth are enhanced and so they are completely pure.

original: rnam par dag ces bya ba ni brtsal 'bad dang rtog dpyod med par tshad med pa bzhi lhun gyis grub ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag ces bya ba ni brtsal 'bad dang rtog dpyod med par tshad med pa bzhi lhun gyis grub ste /
translated: Complete purity refers to the spontaneous accomplishment of the four boundless attitudes without any effort or exertion and without any conceptualization.

original: de bas na sa brgyad kyi dus kyi tshad med pa bzhi ni mi dmigs par gzhag go //
analyzed: de bas na sa brgyad kyi dus kyi tshad med pa bzhi ni mi dmigs par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, the four boundless attitudes of the eighth level are referred to as being nonconceptual.

original: las gnyis zhes bya bas rnam pa gsum pa bstan te /
analyzed: las gnyis zhes bya bas rnam pa gsum pa bstan te /
translated: The third aspect is indicated by the words two kinds of action.

original: byams pa'i rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'i lus kyi las brdeg 'tshog la sogs pa mi byed pa dang / dag gi las tshig rtsub mo la sogs pa mi 'byin pa la yang mi dmigs pa'i byams pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byams pa'i rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'i lus kyi las brdeg 'tshog la sogs pa mi byed pa dang / dag gi las tshig rtsub mo la sogs pa mi 'byin pa la yang mi dmigs pa'i byams pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The physical action that occurs in accordance with loving kindness is not to strike or beat and the verbal action is not to speak harshly. These are also referred to as loving kindness that is nonconceptual.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la ni mi dmigs pa dang rtog pa yod na lus dang ngag gnyis ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa gzugs kyi phung por gtogs pas rtog pa med pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i byams par gzhag go //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la ni mi dmigs pa dang rtog pa yod na lus dang ngag gnyis ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa gzugs kyi phung por gtogs pas rtog pa med pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i byams par gzhag go //
translated: Love that is nonapprehending and nonconceptual is established for the body and speech, because the body and speech are included in the form aggregate, which is derived from the four great elements, and therefore they are nonconceptual.

original: byams pa ni sems kyi chos yin yang lus dang ngag gnyis byams pa'i sems las byung ba dang / brdeg 'tshog la sogs pa'i gnod pas sems can la gnod par mi byed pas na mi dmigs pa'i byams par btags so //
analyzed: byams pa ni sems kyi chos yin yang lus dang ngag gnyis byams pa'i sems las byung ba dang / brdeg 'tshog la sogs pa'i gnod pas sems can la gnod par mi byed pas na mi dmigs pa'i byams par btags so //
translated: Love is a mental factor, but the body and speech are derived from the mind of love, and they do not harm sentient beings by beating and striking them, so they are designated as nonapprehending love.

original: nyon mongs zad pas kyang zhes bya bas rnam pa bzhi pa bstan to //
analyzed: nyon mongs zad pas kyang zhes bya bas rnam pa bzhi pa bstan to //
translated: The fourth type is indicated by the words ‚Äúand by the extinction of the afflictions.‚Äù

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa nyon mongs pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa nyon mongs pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i dmigs pa yin la /
translated: The afflictions such as attachment and hostility are the objects of apprehension of the mind and mental factors.

original: nyon mongs pa spangs te zad na sems kyis dmigs par bya ba'i yul med pas nyon mongs pa zad pa rnams kyi 'phags pa byams pa yang mi dmigs pa'i byams pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs te zad na sems kyis dmigs par bya ba'i yul med pas nyon mongs pa zad pa rnams kyi 'phags pa byams pa yang mi dmigs pa'i byams pa zhes bya'o //
translated: If the afflictions are abandoned and exhausted, then since there is no object for the mind to observe, the love of the noble ones whose afflictions are exhausted is called ‚Äúnon-apprehending love.‚Äù

original: sa brgyad pa la mi skye ba'i bzod pa thob pa'i phyir khams rgyas pas de rnam par dag pa dar zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la mi skye ba'i bzod pa thob pa'i phyir khams rgyas pas de rnam par dag pa dar zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because on the eighth ground, the ground of Immovability, the seeds of the afflictions are completely pacified, it is called ‚Äúpure.‚Äù

original: sa brgyad pa'i dus na byang chub sems dpa' rnams mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pas dkar po'i chos 'phel zhing mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pas khams rgyas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa'i dus na byang chub sems dpa' rnams mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pas dkar po'i chos 'phel zhing mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pas khams rgyas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because on the eighth ground, the bodhisattvas attain the acceptance of the non-arising of phenomena, the white dharmas increase and the opposing factors are abandoned, so it is called ‚Äúthe ground of the increase of the element.‚Äù

original: byams pa la sogs pa'i sa bon brtas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa'i sa bon brtas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that the seeds of love and so on are strengthened.

original: de ltar sa bon brtas pas na sa brgyad pa la sogs pa'i dus na byams pa la sogs pas rnam par dag ste /
analyzed: de ltar sa bon brtas pas na sa brgyad pa la sogs pa'i dus na byams pa la sogs pas rnam par dag ste /
translated: Since the seeds are strengthened in that way, on the eighth ground and so on, love and so on are purified.

original: rnam par dag ces bya ba'i don ni /
analyzed: rnam par dag ces bya ba'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúpurified‚Äù is as follows.

original: brtsal 'bad med par lhun gyis grub par 'byung //
analyzed: brtsal 'bad med par lhun gyis grub par 'byung //
translated: They arise spontaneously without effort or exertion.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de bas na dmigs su med pa'i byams par gzhag go //üîΩrgyu mthun pa zhes @57a * //
analyzed: de bas na dmigs su med pa'i byams par gzhag go // rgyu mthun pa zhes @57a * //
translated: Therefore, one should be established in non-apprehending love.üîΩAs for the ‚Äúnatural outcome,‚Äù

original: bya ba la /
analyzed: bya ba la /
translated: it is as follows.

original: byams pa'i sems kyis rgyu byas nas lus dang ngag gi las skyed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byams pa'i sems kyis rgyu byas nas lus dang ngag gi las skyed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having made love the cause, one generates the karma of body and speech. This is the meaning.

original: de la nyon mongs pa ni dmigs par gsungs te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa ni dmigs par gsungs te zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this regard, it is said that the afflictions are the object.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni sems kyis dmigs par bya ba'i yul du bshad la /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni sems kyis dmigs par bya ba'i yul du bshad la /
translated: The afflictions such as attachment and aversion are explained as the objects that the mind apprehends.

original: nyon mongs pa zad na yul dmigs su med pas na mi dmigs pa'i byams par bshad do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zad na yul dmigs su med pas na mi dmigs pa'i byams par bshad do //
translated: Since the object is not apprehended when the afflictions are exhausted, it is explained as non-apprehending love.

original: nyon mongs pa la dmigs pa zhes bya bar yang ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la dmigs pa zhes bya bar yang ci mngon zhe na /
translated: How is it known that the afflictions are the object?

original: de'i phyir / sems kyi mdud pa spangs pa'i phyir dmigs pa chad do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / sems kyi mdud pa spangs pa'i phyir dmigs pa chad do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that ‚Äúthe object is cut off because the knots of the mind are abandoned.‚Äù

original: mdo las kyang /
analyzed: mdo las kyang /
translated: For it is said in the sutra:

original: sems la yod pa'i 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas sems kyi dmigs pa med do zhes gsungs pas na nyon mongs pa la dmigs pa zhes bya bar mngon no //
analyzed: sems la yod pa'i 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas sems kyi dmigs pa med do zhes gsungs pas na nyon mongs pa la dmigs pa zhes bya bar mngon no //
translated: Since it is said that the mind has no object when it is free from the afflictions of desire, hatred, etc. that exist in the mind, it is clear that the afflictions are called objects.üîΩIt is known to be wavering and unwavering,

original: de ni g-yo dang / mi g-yo dang // chags pas myong dang mi myong shes //
analyzed: de ni g-yo dang / mi g-yo dang // chags pas myong dang mi myong shes //
translated: experienced through attachment and not experienced through attachment.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis tshangs pa'i gnas kyi rab tu dbye ba rnam pa bzhi ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis tshangs pa'i gnas kyi rab tu dbye ba rnam pa bzhi ston te /
translated: This shows the fourfold classification of the Brahma abodes.

original: rnam pa bzhi ni 'bri ba'i cha can dang / gnas pa dang khyad par gyi cha can dang / nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi ni 'bri ba'i cha can dang / gnas pa dang khyad par gyi cha can dang / nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: The four types are: those that are partial, those that are complete, those that are associated with affliction, and those that are free from affliction.

original: de la 'bri ba'i cha can gyi tshad med pa bzhi la ni g-yo ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'bri ba'i cha can gyi tshad med pa bzhi la ni g-yo ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The four boundless states that are partial are called ‚Äúwavering.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: phyis nyams shing med par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyis nyams shing med par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they later diminish and disappear.

original: gnas pa dang khyad par du 'gyur ba'i cha can gyi tshad med pa bzhi la ni mi g-yo ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gnas pa dang khyad par du 'gyur ba'i cha can gyi tshad med pa bzhi la ni mi g-yo ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The four boundless states that are complete are called ‚Äúunwavering.‚Äù

original: nyams pa med cing khyad par du 'phags kyi nyams pa dang med par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams pa med cing khyad par du 'phags kyi nyams pa dang med par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not degenerate, and they are superior, not inferior.

original: tshad med pa bzhi'i ting nge 'dzin thob nas ting nge 'dzin gyi rol chags pa'i 'dod chags kyis ting nge 'dzin gyi ro myang ba'i bde bar byed pa rnams la ni nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi'i ting nge 'dzin thob nas ting nge 'dzin gyi rol chags pa'i 'dod chags kyis ting nge 'dzin gyi ro myang ba'i bde bar byed pa rnams la ni nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who, having attained the concentrations of the four immeasurables, enjoy the pleasure of savoring the taste of concentration through attachment to the enjoyment of concentration are called ‚Äúthose with afflictions.‚Äù
