analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi'i bsam gtan thob kyang de'i bde ba'i ro la myong bar mi byed pa ni /
translated: Those who, having attained the concentrations of the four immeasurables, do not savor the taste of their pleasure

original: nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: are called ‚Äúthose without afflictions.‚Äù

original: chags pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba la zhen pa dang / sems rgya chung ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chags pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba la zhen pa dang / sems rgya chung ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúAttachment‚Äù means clinging to pleasure and having a narrow mind.

original: chags pa'i don 'chad de byams pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba la chags shing zhen par gyur na gong nas gong du yon tan rgya chen po la sems mi 'jug pas na chags pas ro myang ba ni nyon mongs pa @57b can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chags pa'i don 'chad de byams pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba la chags shing zhen par gyur na gong nas gong du yon tan rgya chen po la sems mi 'jug pas na chags pas ro myang ba ni nyon mongs pa @57b can zhes bya'o //
translated: The meaning of attachment is explained: if one is attached to and fixated on the bliss of the concentration of love, then the mind does not engage in the ever-increasing vast qualities. Therefore, relishing through attachment is called defiled.

original: bsam gtan gyi bde ba cung zad tsam gyis tshog par 'dzin cing gong nas gong du yon tan rgya chen po mi tshol ba yang nyon mongs pa can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi bde ba cung zad tsam gyis tshog par 'dzin cing gong nas gong du yon tan rgya chen po mi tshol ba yang nyon mongs pa can zhes bya'o //
translated: Also, if one is satisfied with just a little of the bliss of concentration and does not seek the ever-increasing vast qualities, that is also called defiled.

original: de rnams kyang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de rnams kyang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those means

original: tshad med pa bzhi la phye na 'bri ba'i cha can dang / gnas shing khyad par du 'gro ba'i cha can dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa med pa ste rnam pa bzhi yod pa las /
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi la phye na 'bri ba'i cha can dang / gnas shing khyad par du 'gro ba'i cha can dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa med pa ste rnam pa bzhi yod pa las /
translated: when the four immeasurables are distinguished, there are four types: those with the aspect of decrease, those with the aspect of abiding and progressing, those with afflictions, and those without afflictions.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams gang la gnas shing sgom par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams gang la gnas shing sgom par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Among those, which do the bodhisattvas abide in and cultivate? is the meaning.

original: de'i phyir / byang chub sems dpa' mi g-yo ba //
analyzed: de'i phyir / byang chub sems dpa' mi g-yo ba //
translated: Therefore, it says, The bodhisattvas are unshakable.

original: chags pa med pa gnas pa ni //
analyzed: chags pa med pa gnas pa ni //
translated: Abiding without attachment is

original: g-yo la ma yin ro myang ba la min //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: g-yo la ma yin ro myang ba la min // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: not in fluctuation, nor in relishing.

original: de ltar tshangs pa'i gnas la rnam pa bzhi bstan pa las /
analyzed: de ltar tshangs pa'i gnas la rnam pa bzhi bstan pa las /
translated: Thus, having taught the four kinds of stations of Brahma,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gnas pa dang khyad par gyi cha can la gnas pas na mi g-yo ba la gnas pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa la gnas pas na chag pa med pa la gnas kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gnas pa dang khyad par gyi cha can la gnas pas na mi g-yo ba la gnas pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa la gnas pas na chag pa med pa la gnas kyi /
translated: the bodhisattvas abide in the station of nonfluctuation because they abide in the stage of certain destiny and the stage of certain release. They abide in the station without attachment because they abide in the stage of no training.

original: g-yo bas de 'bri ba'i cha can la mi gnas /
analyzed: g-yo bas de 'bri ba'i cha can la mi gnas /
translated: They do not abide in the stage of decrease, which is the stage of fluctuation.

original: ro myang ba ste nyon mongs pa can ro myang ba la gnas pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩtshad med pa bzhi chung ngu dang chen po'i rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ro myang ba ste nyon mongs pa can ro myang ba la gnas pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // tshad med pa bzhi chung ngu dang chen po'i rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: They do not abide in the stage of relishing, which is the defiled stage of relishing.üîΩTwo verses on the analysis of the immeasurables as small, etc.üîΩThe immeasurables are small, middling,

original: mnyam par ma bzhag rang bzhin dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis smos so //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag rang bzhin dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis smos so //
translated: great, and exceeding great.

original: de la mnyam par bzhag pa ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa ste 'dod pa'i khams la bya'o //
analyzed: de la mnyam par bzhag pa ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa ste 'dod pa'i khams la bya'o //
translated: The realm of desire is called the stage of non-concentration, because it is not concentrated.

original: de la mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i tshad med pa bzhi ni thams cad kyang chung ngur rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de la mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i tshad med pa bzhi ni thams cad kyang chung ngur rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The four immeasurables of the stage of non-concentration are all established as small.

original: 'di ni chung ngu rnam pa gcig go //
analyzed: 'di ni chung ngu rnam pa gcig go //
translated: This is the first type of small.

original: chung ngu bar ma zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chung ngu bar ma zhes bya ba la /
translated: The middle type of small is called

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa zhes bya ste /
translated: the realm of form and the formless realm, which are called the stage of concentration.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i tshad med pa la yang /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i tshad med pa la yang /
translated: The immeasurables of the stage of concentration also

original: chung ngu dang / bar ma dang / chen po ste rnam pa gsum yod do //
analyzed: chung ngu dang / bar ma dang / chen po ste rnam pa gsum yod do //
translated: have three types: small, middle, and great.

original: de la gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi la /
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi la /
translated: Among them, the four concentrations of the realm of form

original: tshangs ris dang / tshangs lha nye phan dang / tshangs chen te sa gsum mo //
analyzed: tshangs ris dang / tshangs lha nye phan dang / tshangs chen te sa gsum mo //
translated: are the three stages of Brahma's group, Brahma's ministers, and great Brahma.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa la yangs gsum /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa la yangs gsum /
translated: Similarly, the second concentration has three stages,

original: gsum pa la yang sa gsum /
analyzed: gsum pa la yang sa gsum /
translated: and the third also has three stages.

original: bzhi pa la sa brgyad do //
analyzed: bzhi pa la sa brgyad do //
translated: The fourth has eight stages.

original: de la tshangs ris kyi tshad med pa bzhi ni chung ngu'o //
analyzed: de la tshangs ris kyi tshad med pa bzhi ni chung ngu'o //
translated: The four immeasurables of Brahmakayika are small.

original: tshangs lha nye phan gyi tshad med pa bzhi ni 'bring po'o //
analyzed: tshangs lha nye phan gyi tshad med pa bzhi ni 'bring po'o //
translated: The four immeasurables of Brahmapurohita are medium.

original: tshangs chen gyi tshad med pa bzhi ni chen @58a * //
analyzed: tshangs chen gyi tshad med pa bzhi ni chen @58a * //
translated: The four immeasurables of Mahabrahma are great.

original: po'o ; / de ltar mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa la tshad med pa che chung rnam pa gsum du zhugs pa las mnyam par gzhag pa tshad med pa chung ngu dang / bar ma gnyis kyang chung ngu'i nang du bsdu'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: po'o ; / de ltar mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa la tshad med pa che chung rnam pa gsum du zhugs pa las mnyam par gzhag pa tshad med pa chung ngu dang / bar ma gnyis kyang chung ngu'i nang du bsdu'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, from entering the three types of small, medium, and great immeasurables on the level of meditative equipoise, the small and medium immeasurables of meditative equipoise are included in the small.

original: 'og ma'i sa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'og ma'i sa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The lower level is as follows:

original: sa dang po la ltos nas mos pas spyod pa'i sa 'og ma yin la /
analyzed: sa dang po la ltos nas mos pas spyod pa'i sa 'og ma yin la /
translated: In relation to the first level, the level of devoted conduct is lower.

original: sa gnyis pa la ltos nas dang po yang sa 'og ma yin te /
analyzed: sa gnyis pa la ltos nas dang po yang sa 'og ma yin te /
translated: In relation to the second level, the first level is also lower.

original: de bas na sa dang po las ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa 'og ma yin pas mos pas spyod pa'i tshad med pa ni chung ngu'i nang du bsdus te /
analyzed: de bas na sa dang po las ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa 'og ma yin pas mos pas spyod pa'i tshad med pa ni chung ngu'i nang du bsdus te /
translated: Therefore, since the level of devoted conduct is lower than the first level, the immeasurables of devoted conduct are included in the small.

original: de bzhin du sa gnyis pa dang / gsum pa la sogs pa yang gong ma la ltos nas sa 'og ma rnams chung ngur gzhag go //üîΩbsam pa tha ma zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du sa gnyis pa dang / gsum pa la sogs pa yang gong ma la ltos nas sa 'og ma rnams chung ngur gzhag go // bsam pa tha ma zhes bya ba la /
translated: Likewise, the second and third stages, etc., are posited as lesser in relation to the higher stages.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sems ni bsam ba chung ngu yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sems ni bsam ba chung ngu yin te /
translated: The last thought is the thought of the Disciples and Solitary Buddhas, which is a lesser thought.

original: de dag gi tshad med pa yang chung ngur gzhag go zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩdar bcas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag gi tshad med pa yang chung ngur gzhag go zhes bya ba'i don to // dar bcas zhes bya ba la /
translated: The immeasurables of those are posited as lesser.

original: sa dang po yan chad /
analyzed: sa dang po yan chad /
translated: The immeasurables of the first stage and above,

original: sa bdun pa man chad kyi tshad med pa ni brtsal 'bad dang bcas pas na dar bcas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa bdun pa man chad kyi tshad med pa ni brtsal 'bad dang bcas pas na dar bcas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: up to the seventh stage, are called with exertion because they are accompanied by effort.

original: de dag kyang chung ngur gzhag go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag kyang chung ngur gzhag go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: They are also posited as lesser.

original: de dag tha ma gzhan mchog go //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag tha ma gzhan mchog go // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The last of those is the highest.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa thams cad dang / mnyam par bzhag pa'i chung ngu dang / bar ma dang / sa 'og ma dang / bsam pa tha ma dang / ngar bcas pa ste /
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa thams cad dang / mnyam par bzhag pa'i chung ngu dang / bar ma dang / sa 'og ma dang / bsam pa tha ma dang / ngar bcas pa ste /
translated: All the non-concentrated, the lesser, middling, and lower concentrations, the immeasurables of the lower stages, the last thought, and those with exertion,

original: de drug tha mar bzhag na de las bzlog pa thams cad mchog tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de drug tha mar bzhag na de las bzlog pa thams cad mchog tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If these six are placed last, then all the others are supreme.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa tha mar gzhag pa dang / bsam par gzhag pa thams cad mchog dang chen por gzhag go //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa tha mar gzhag pa dang / bsam par gzhag pa thams cad mchog dang chen por gzhag go //
translated: The stage of non-equipoise is placed last, and all the intentions are placed as supreme and great.

original: mnyam par gzhag par yang chung ngu dang dang 'bring dang tha mar gzhag dang chen po rnams mchog tu gzhag go //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag par yang chung ngu dang dang 'bring dang tha mar gzhag dang chen po rnams mchog tu gzhag go //
translated: The equipoise is placed as small, middling, and great, and the supreme is placed.

original: sa 'og ma tha mar gzhag dang / sa 'og ma rnams mchog tu gzhag go //
analyzed: sa 'og ma tha mar gzhag dang / sa 'og ma rnams mchog tu gzhag go //
translated: The lower stages are placed last, and the lower stages are placed as supreme.

original: bsam pa tha ma tha mar gzhag dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dgongs pa chen po'i tshad med pa rnams mchog tu gzhag go //
analyzed: bsam pa tha ma tha mar gzhag dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dgongs pa chen po'i tshad med pa rnams mchog tu gzhag go //
translated: The inferior intention is placed last, and the immeasurable great intentions of the bodhisattvas and tathagatas are placed as supreme.

original: sa bdun pa ngar bcas pas chung ngur gzhag dang / sa brgyad pa yan chad mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa rnams kyi tshad med pa mchog tu gzhag go //
analyzed: sa bdun pa ngar bcas pas chung ngur gzhag dang / sa brgyad pa yan chad mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa rnams kyi tshad med pa mchog tu gzhag go //
translated: The immeasurables of those on the seventh stage with pride are placed as small, and the immeasurables of those on the eighth stage and above who have attained forbearance regarding unborn dharmas are placed as supreme.

original: da ni tshigs su bcad pa gnyis shig gis @58b tshad med pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu dang mtshan ma'i rnam pa gsum ston to //
analyzed: da ni tshigs su bcad pa gnyis shig gis @58b tshad med pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu dang mtshan ma'i rnam pa gsum ston to //
translated: Now, two verses show the three aspects of cause, effect, and sign of the immeasurables.

original: tshangs pa'i gnas pas gnas nas su //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gnas pas gnas nas su //
translated: Dwelling in the Brahma abodes,

original: zhes bya bas rgyu bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas rgyu bstan te /
translated: he shows the cause.

original: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms te tshad med pa bzhi la gnas shing bsgoms na 'bras bu rnam pa lnga 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms te tshad med pa bzhi la gnas shing bsgoms na 'bras bu rnam pa lnga 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that, dwelling in and cultivating the four immeasurables of love, compassion, joy, and impartiality, one attains five kinds of effects.

original: 'bras bu rnam pa lnga ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang / dbang byed pa'i 'bras bu dang / skyes bu'i rtsal gyi 'bras bu dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang / bral ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam pa lnga ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang / dbang byed pa'i 'bras bu dang / skyes bu'i rtsal gyi 'bras bu dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang / bral ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The five kinds of effects are: the effect of evolutionary impetus, the effect of dominance, the effect of human action, the effect of natural development, and the effect of disjunction.

original: mkhas pa 'dod pa'i gnas su skye //
analyzed: mkhas pa 'dod pa'i gnas su skye //
translated: The wise are born in the Brahma worlds.

original: zhes bya ba la tshad med pa bzhi la bsgoms na gzugs kyi khams su skye ba yin pa las /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la tshad med pa bzhi la bsgoms na gzugs kyi khams su skye ba yin pa las /
translated: The meaning is that, cultivating the four immeasurables, one is born in the world of form.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pas sems can rnams kyi don dang ched du 'dod pa'i khams su skye bar byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pas sems can rnams kyi don dang ched du 'dod pa'i khams su skye bar byed de /
translated: Because bodhisattvas possess inconceivable concentration, they take birth in the desire realm for the sake of sentient beings and for the sake of their own wishes.

original: de ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: This is the ripened result.üîΩThey complete the accumulations

original: des ni tshogs rnams rdzogs pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: des ni tshogs rnams rdzogs pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: By that, the accumulations are perfected.üîΩ

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshad med pa bzhi bsgoms na de'i dbang gis bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshad med pa bzhi bsgoms na de'i dbang gis bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: When bodhisattvas cultivate the four boundless attitudes, as a result of that they complete the accumulation of merit and the accumulation of wisdom.

original: de ni dbang byed pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de ni dbang byed pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: This is the governing result.üîΩThey bring sentient beings to full maturity

original: sems can rnam par smin byed ces bya ba la /
analyzed: sems can rnam par smin byed ces bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúIt ripens sentient beings‚Äù meansüîΩ

original: tshad med pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can bstan pa 'di la ma zhugs pa dag bstan pa la gzhug pa dang / bstan pa la zhugs pa rnams rim par bkod nas yongs su smin par byed de /
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can bstan pa 'di la ma zhugs pa dag bstan pa la gzhug pa dang / bstan pa la zhugs pa rnams rim par bkod nas yongs su smin par byed de /
translated: Bodhisattvas who possess the four boundless attitudes introduce sentient beings who have not yet entered the teaching to the teaching and they bring to full maturity those who have entered the teaching by establishing them in the stages.

original: 'di ni skyes bu'i rtsal gyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni skyes bu'i rtsal gyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: This is the result of human effort.

original: skyes bu'i rtsal ni brtson 'grus kyi khyad par med par mi 'byung la /
analyzed: skyes bu'i rtsal ni brtson 'grus kyi khyad par med par mi 'byung la /
translated: Human effort does not occur without the distinction of striving.

original: brtson 'grus kyi khyad par gyis sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi khyad par gyis sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur bas na /
translated: And by the distinction of striving, sentient beings are brought to full maturity.

original: skyes bu'i rtsal gyi 'bras bur gzhag go //
analyzed: skyes bu'i rtsal gyi 'bras bur gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, it is posited as the result of human effort.

original: tshangs dang ma bral thams cad du //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshangs dang ma bral thams cad du // zhes bya ba la /
translated: In all lives, one is not separated from the four immeasurables.

original: tshe 'dir byang chub sems dpa' tshad med pa bzhi bsgoms na /
analyzed: tshe 'dir byang chub sems dpa' tshad med pa bzhi bsgoms na /
translated: In this life, if a bodhisattva cultivates the four immeasurables,

original: tshe rabs gar skyes gar skyes kyang tshad med pa bzhi dang ldan zhing dus thams cad du tshad med pa bzhi dang mi 'bras bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshe rabs gar skyes gar skyes kyang tshad med pa bzhi dang ldan zhing dus thams cad du tshad med pa bzhi dang mi 'bras bar 'gyur te /
translated: in whatever life one is born, one possesses the four immeasurables and at all times one is not separated from the four immeasurables.

original: de ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: This is the result of natural outcome.

original: de la rgyu mthun pa zhes bya ba'i don yang rgyu ci 'dra ba btab pa 'bras bu'ang de 'dra bar skye ste /
analyzed: de la rgyu mthun pa zhes bya ba'i don yang rgyu ci 'dra ba btab pa 'bras bu'ang de 'dra bar skye ste /
translated: The meaning of natural outcome is that whatever kind of cause is planted, the result that arises is similar to that.

original: dper na tshe 'dir sbyin pa byas na tshe rabs gzhan du yang sbyin pa la dga' bar 'gyur ba'o//
analyzed: dper na tshe 'dir sbyin pa byas na tshe rabs gzhan du yang sbyin pa la dga' bar 'gyur ba'o//
translated: For example, if one practices generosity in this life, one will delight in generosity in other lives as well.üîΩAbandoning their opposing factors

original: @59a * // de yi mi mthun phyogs spangs pa //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: @59a * // de yi mi mthun phyogs spangs pa // zhes bya ba la /
translated: And the avoidance of their opposites.üîΩüîΩ

original: tshad med pa bzhi'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni gnod sems dang / 'tshe ba dang / mi dga' ba med pa dang / 'dod chags dang khong khro ba ste /
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni gnod sems dang / 'tshe ba dang / mi dga' ba med pa dang / 'dod chags dang khong khro ba ste /
translated: The opposing factors of the four immeasurables are malice, violence, lack of delight and attachment and anger.

original: tshad med pa bzhi dang ldan na de bzhi med par 'gyur bas na mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi dang ldan na de bzhi med par 'gyur bas na mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When one possesses the four immeasurables, those four do not exist, so they are called abandoning their opposing factors.

original: de ni bral ba'i 'bras bu'o //üîΩbag med de yi rkyen drag gis //
analyzed: de ni bral ba'i 'bras bu'o // bag med de yi rkyen drag gis //
translated: This is the effect of separation.

original: rnam par 'gyur par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They do not change due to the powerful conditions of carelessness.

original: zhes bya bas mtshan ma bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas mtshan ma bstan te /
translated: This teaches the sign.

original: bag med pa zhes bya ba ni tshad med pa rnams kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnod sems la sogs pa'i gnyen po byams pa la sogs pa mngon sum du ma byas pa ni bag med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bag med pa zhes bya ba ni tshad med pa rnams kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnod sems la sogs pa'i gnyen po byams pa la sogs pa mngon sum du ma byas pa ni bag med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Carelessness is not actualizing love and so on, which are the antidotes to malice and so on, the opposing factors of the immeasurables. This is called carelessness.

original: gnyen po mngon sum du ma byas kyang /
analyzed: gnyen po mngon sum du ma byas kyang /
translated: Even without directly realizing the antidote,

original: gnod sems dang 'tshe ba la sogs pa skye ba'i rkyen drag po mngon sum du 'ongs kyang yul gyi dbang du mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gnod sems dang 'tshe ba la sogs pa skye ba'i rkyen drag po mngon sum du 'ongs kyang yul gyi dbang du mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: when the powerful conditions for giving rise to malice, harm, and so on, directly appear, one is not overpowered by the object,üîΩand malice, harm, and so on, do not arise.

original: gnod sems dang 'tshe ba la sogs pa mi 'byung na chad med pa thob pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gnod sems dang 'tshe ba la sogs pa mi 'byung na chad med pa thob pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: One should know that one has attained irreversibility.

original: rnam par 'gyur par mi 'gyur ba ni tshad med pa thob pa'i mtshan ma dang rtags yin no //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur par mi 'gyur ba ni tshad med pa thob pa'i mtshan ma dang rtags yin no //
translated: Not changing is the sign and mark of attaining the immeasurables.

original: tshigs su bcad pa bzhi po gzhan dag gis ni nyes pa dang yon tan gyi rnam pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa bzhi po gzhan dag gis ni nyes pa dang yon tan gyi rnam pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the other four verses, the aspects of faults and qualities.

original: 'di man chad tshigs su bcad pa bdun zhig gis tshad med pa bzhi'i nyes pa dang skyon gang yin pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi'i yon tan gang yin pa de ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di man chad tshigs su bcad pa bdun zhig gis tshad med pa bzhi'i nyes pa dang skyon gang yin pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi'i yon tan gang yin pa de ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: From here on, in seven verses, it shows the faults and problems of the four immeasurables and the qualities of the four immeasurables.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gnod sems 'tshe ba gnyis //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gnod sems 'tshe ba gnyis //
translated: The bodhisattvas' malice and harm

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis tshad med pa bzhi'i nyes pa dang skyon dag ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis tshad med pa bzhi'i nyes pa dang skyon dag ston te /
translated: One verse showing the faults and problems of the four immeasurables.

original: sems can la bsad pa dang brdeg pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa bya bar sems pa'i gnod sems ni byams pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: sems can la bsad pa dang brdeg pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa bya bar sems pa'i gnod sems ni byams pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: Malice is the adversary of love, since it is the intention to harm sentient beings by killing, beating, and so on.

original: lus kyi sgo nas bsad pa dang brdeg pa la sogs pa'i 'tshe ba byed pa ni snying rje'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //üîΩmi dga' zhes bya ba la /üîΩsems can rnams bde ba dang ldan par mthong nas sems can phrag dog cing /
analyzed: lus kyi sgo nas bsad pa dang brdeg pa la sogs pa'i 'tshe ba byed pa ni snying rje'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so // mi dga' zhes bya ba la / sems can rnams bde ba dang ldan par mthong nas sems can phrag dog cing /
translated: Harm is the adversary of compassion, since it is the action of killing, beating, and so on, by means of the body.

original: ma mos mi dga' ba ni dga' ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: ma mos mi dga' ba ni dga' ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: Displeasure is the adversary of joy, since it is the lack of delight and joy of sentient beings who have attained happiness, due to one‚Äôs jealousy of them.

original: gnod sems 'dod pa'i 'dod chags zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnod sems 'dod pa'i 'dod chags zhes bya ba la /
translated: Desire for malice is the adversary of equanimity, since it is the desire for malice toward sentient beings who are neither happy nor free from suffering.

original: tshor ba sdug bsngal ba dang dgra la sogs pa mthong nas gnod sems skye ba dang tshor ba bde ba dang mdza' ba la sogs pa mthong nas 'dod @59b chags skye ba ni btang snyoms kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: tshor ba sdug bsngal ba dang dgra la sogs pa mthong nas gnod sems skye ba dang tshor ba bde ba dang mdza' ba la sogs pa mthong nas 'dod @59b chags skye ba ni btang snyoms kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: Malice arises when one sees suffering and enemies, etc. Attachment arises when one sees pleasure and friends, etc.

original: ldan pas nyes pa rnam mang myong //
analyzed: ldan pas nyes pa rnam mang myong //
translated: One experiences many faults through association.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of this is:

original: tshad med pa bzhi'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang ldan na lus dang sems la gnod pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang ldan na lus dang sems la gnod pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When one is associated with the opponents of the four immeasurables, various kinds of suffering arise which afflict the body and mind.

original: nyes pa rnam pa mang po ji ltar myong zhe na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyes pa rnam pa mang po ji ltar myong zhe na zhes bya ba la /
translated: How does one experience many faults?

original: tshad med pa bzhi'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bzhi dang ldan na nyes pa rnam pa mang po myong ngo zhes bya ba la nyes pa gang dang gang myong zhe na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bzhi dang ldan na nyes pa rnam pa mang po myong ngo zhes bya ba la nyes pa gang dang gang myong zhe na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this is: When one is associated with the four opponents of the four immeasurables, one experiences many faults. What are the faults that one experiences?

original: nyon mongs pas ni bdag nyid bcom //
analyzed: nyon mongs pas ni bdag nyid bcom //
translated: One is destroyed by the afflictions.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of this is:

original: gnod sems dang 'tshe ba la sogs pa tshad med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi nyon mongs pa rnams kyis srog gcod pa dang ma byin par len pa la sogs pa byas na /
analyzed: gnod sems dang 'tshe ba la sogs pa tshad med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi nyon mongs pa rnams kyis srog gcod pa dang ma byin par len pa la sogs pa byas na /
translated: If one commits killing, stealing, etc. through the immeasurable afflictions that are adverse elements such as malice and violence,

original: bdag nyid bcom pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid bcom pa zhes bya ste /
translated: one is said to be ‚Äúdestroyed oneself.‚Äù

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de'i rkyen gyis tshe 'di la yang bsad pa dang bcing ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa 'byung la /
analyzed: de'i rkyen gyis tshe 'di la yang bsad pa dang bcing ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa 'byung la /
translated: Because of that, one is harmed in this life by being killed, bound, etc.

original: tshe rabs gzhan du yang sems can dmyal ba la sogs par skye ba'i gnod pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan du yang sems can dmyal ba la sogs par skye ba'i gnod pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And one is harmed in other lives by being born in the hells, etc.

original: sems can bcom zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems can bcom zhes bya ba la /
translated: One is said to ‚Äúdestroy sentient beings‚Äù

original: de ltar tshul khrims 'khrugs pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa byed pas na sems can bcom pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa byed pas na sems can bcom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar tshul khrims 'khrugs pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa byed pas na sems can bcom pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa byed pas na sems can bcom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: because one harms sentient beings by such things as violating morality.

original: tshul khrims bcom zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshul khrims bcom zhes bya ba la /
translated: One is said to ‚Äúdestroy morality‚Äù

original: de ltar srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par blangs pas /
analyzed: de ltar srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par blangs pas /
translated: because one commits killing and stealing, etc.

original: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa rnams nyams par 'gyur bas tshul khrims bcom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa rnams nyams par 'gyur bas tshul khrims bcom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the precepts that have been taken are violated, it is called the destruction of morality.

original: 'gyod bcas zhes bya ba la /üîΩde ltar tshul khrims nyams pa'i gang zag de 'di snyam du sems par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gyod bcas zhes bya ba la / de ltar tshul khrims nyams pa'i gang zag de 'di snyam du sems par 'gyur te /
translated: With remorse means

original: 'di ltar bdag gis ni 'phags pa rnams kyis bstod pa'i lam mtho ris su skye ba ni bor la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gis ni 'phags pa rnams kyis bstod pa'i lam mtho ris su skye ba ni bor la /
translated: the following. The person whose morality has been violated thinks, I have abandoned the path praised by the noble ones, which leads to birth in the higher realms,

original: so so'i skye bo sdig can gyis bsten pa'i lam ngan song gi lam du zhugs pas bdag ni brlag pa yin no snyam nas sems la gdung ba skye ste /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo sdig can gyis bsten pa'i lam ngan song gi lam du zhugs pas bdag ni brlag pa yin no snyam nas sems la gdung ba skye ste /
translated: and have entered the path of the sinful ordinary beings, which leads to the lower realms. I am ruined! and his mind is tormented.

original: de bas na 'gyod pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'gyod pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called with remorse.üîΩSeparated from gain means

original: rnyed dang bral zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnyed dang bral zhes bya ba la /
translated: the following.

original: tshul khrims nyams pa de sngon sbyin bdag gis chos gos dang lhung bzed la sogs pa 'bul ba de yang de phan chad gang zag 'di ni sdig pa byed pa yin pas sbyin gnas ma yin no zhes ci yang 'bul bar mi byed de /üîΩde bas na @60a * //
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams pa de sngon sbyin bdag gis chos gos dang lhung bzed la sogs pa 'bul ba de yang de phan chad gang zag 'di ni sdig pa byed pa yin pas sbyin gnas ma yin no zhes ci yang 'bul bar mi byed de / de bas na @60a * //
translated: And that one who has violated morality, previously the recipient of robes, alms-food, bowls, bedding, seats, necessary medicine, and utensils given by benefactors, from then on is not at all given anything, because that person is a sinner and not a recipient of gifts.

original: rnyed pa dang bral ba zhes bya'o //üîΩsrung ba bral dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bral ba zhes bya'o // srung ba bral dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúhe is deprived of gain.‚Äù

original: sngon tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i dus na lha la sogs pas srung bar byed pa yang de phan chad srung bar mi byed de /
analyzed: sngon tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i dus na lha la sogs pas srung bar byed pa yang de phan chad srung bar mi byed de /
translated: ‚ÄúHe is deprived of protection‚Äù means that previously, when he was endowed with morality, gods and so on protected him, but from then on they do not protect him.

original: de bas na srung ba dang bral ba zhes bya'o //üîΩde bzhin ston zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bas na srung ba dang bral ba zhes bya'o // de bzhin ston zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúhe is deprived of protection.‚Äù

original: ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gang zag de de phan chad gtong bar byed de /
analyzed: ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gang zag de de phan chad gtong bar byed de /
translated: ‚ÄúHe is abandoned by the Teacher‚Äù means that the Teacher, the Lord Buddha, from then on abandons that person.

original: gang zag 'di ni tshul khrims nyams pas shi ba'i ro dang 'dra'o zhes rnam pa du mar smod par mdzad do //
analyzed: gang zag 'di ni tshul khrims nyams pas shi ba'i ro dang 'dra'o zhes rnam pa du mar smod par mdzad do //
translated: He censures him in many ways, saying, ‚ÄúThis person, having violated morality, is like a dead corpse.‚Äù

original: rtsod pa'i gzhi bcas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhi bcas zhes bya ba la /
translated: The basis of dispute is established.

original: tshul khrims nyams pa de tshangs pa dang mtshungs pa rnams kyis chos nyid kyis rtsod par byed de chad pas gcod pa dang / skrod pa la sogs pa'i las byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams pa de tshangs pa dang mtshungs pa rnams kyis chos nyid kyis rtsod par byed de chad pas gcod pa dang / skrod pa la sogs pa'i las byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The basis of dispute is established by the BrahmakƒÅyika gods, by the natural law, because they inflict punishment and expel the one who has violated morality.

original: grags ldan med ces bya ba la /
analyzed: grags ldan med ces bya ba la /
translated: He is not famous.

original: tshul khrims nyams pa'i gang zag de gang zag che ge mo zhig gis bslab pa nyams shing sdig pa'i chos byed pa'o zhes phyogs kun du mi snyan par grags par 'gyur bas na grags ldan med ces bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams pa'i gang zag de gang zag che ge mo zhig gis bslab pa nyams shing sdig pa'i chos byed pa'o zhes phyogs kun du mi snyan par grags par 'gyur bas na grags ldan med ces bya'o //
translated: The person who has violated morality is not famous, because he is notorious in all directions, being said to be one who has violated the precepts and is a sinner.

original: de yang gzhan du mi khom skyes //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de yang gzhan du mi khom skyes // zhes bya ba la /
translated: And he is born in the unfortunate realms.

original: tshe 'dir sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs myong bar 'gyur bar ma zad kyi /
analyzed: tshe 'dir sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs myong bar 'gyur bar ma zad kyi /
translated: The meaning is that not only does he experience various sufferings in this life,

original: tshe rabs gzhan du'ang sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i gnas su skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan du'ang sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i gnas su skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: but he is also born in the realms of hell beings and so on in other lives.

original: thob dang ma thob rnam par spangs //
analyzed: thob dang ma thob rnam par spangs //
translated: He abandons what has been obtained and what has not been obtained.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: is stated.

original: tshul khrims nyams na tshe 'dir tshad med pa rnam pa bzhi yang med par 'gyur bas thob pa las nyams pa dang / tshe rabs gzhan du tshad med pa bzhi thob par 'gyur ba yang mi thob par 'ongs bas na ma thob pa las nyams pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams na tshe 'dir tshad med pa rnam pa bzhi yang med par 'gyur bas thob pa las nyams pa dang / tshe rabs gzhan du tshad med pa bzhi thob par 'gyur ba yang mi thob par 'ongs bas na ma thob pa las nyams pa'o //
translated: If one's morality is impaired, one loses what has been obtained, because the four immeasurables do not exist in this life, and one loses what has not been obtained, because one will not obtain the four immeasurables in other lives.

original: sems las sdug bsngal chen po thob //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: sems las sdug bsngal chen po thob // ces bya ba la /
translated: One obtains great suffering in the mind.

original: gzhan yang bslab pa nyams na sems la sdug bsngal chen pos kyang gzir bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang bslab pa nyams na sems la sdug bsngal chen pos kyang gzir bar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if one's training is impaired, one is also oppressed by great suffering in the mind.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'di snyam du sems te bdag gis ni bslab pa dral zhing khrims nyams par byas pas bdag ni mi rigs par byed pa'o snyam nas sems la gdung ba chen po skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems te bdag gis ni bslab pa dral zhing khrims nyams par byas pas bdag ni mi rigs par byed pa'o snyam nas sems la gdung ba chen po skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One thinks, I have violated the training and impaired morality. I have done what is improper. Thus, great torment arises in the mind.

original: de la tshig thog ma gsum gyis ni bdag la gnod pa dang / pha rol la gnod pa dang / gnyi ga la gnod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la tshig thog ma gsum gyis ni bdag la gnod pa dang / pha rol la gnod pa dang / gnyi ga la gnod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In that regard, the first three lines state that one is harmed by oneself, one harms others, and one harms both, as stated.

original: bdag nyid bcom pa dang / sems can bcom pa dang / tshul khrims bcom pa dang @60b gsum gyis bdag la gnod pa dang / pha rol la gnod pa dang / gnyi ga la gnod par 'gyur bas nyes dmigs su 'gyur ba ston to //
analyzed: bdag nyid bcom pa dang / sems can bcom pa dang / tshul khrims bcom pa dang @60b gsum gyis bdag la gnod pa dang / pha rol la gnod pa dang / gnyi ga la gnod par 'gyur bas nyes dmigs su 'gyur ba ston to //
translated: The three ways of harming oneself, harming others, and harming both oneself and others show the disadvantages of anger, malice, and so on.

original: de la gnod sems dang 'tshe ba la sogs pa la gnas pa rnams ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs mthu che zhing /
analyzed: de la gnod sems dang 'tshe ba la sogs pa la gnas pa rnams ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs mthu che zhing /
translated: Those who dwell in anger, malice, and so on have a powerful unwholesome side and a weak wholesome side.

original: gnyen po'i stobs chung bas gnod sems dang 'tshe ba la sogs pa spyad pas tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa de mi dge ba'i chos la zhugs pas tshul khrims nyams te /
analyzed: gnyen po'i stobs chung bas gnod sems dang 'tshe ba la sogs pa spyad pas tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa de mi dge ba'i chos la zhugs pas tshul khrims nyams te /
translated: Because they practice anger, malice, and so on, they violate the morality they have undertaken, since they have engaged in unwholesome dharmas.

original: de bas na tshul khrims bcom mo //
analyzed: de bas na tshul khrims bcom mo //
translated: Therefore, their morality is destroyed.

original: bdag bcom bas ni bdag la gnod par ston to //
analyzed: bdag bcom bas ni bdag la gnod par ston to //
translated: The teaching that they harm themselves shows that they harm themselves.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa la sogs pa byas pa de'i rkyen gyis tshe 'dir yang bsad pa dang / bcing ba la sogs pa gnod pa rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa la sogs pa byas pa de'i rkyen gyis tshe 'dir yang bsad pa dang / bcing ba la sogs pa gnod pa rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: Because of the condition of having committed killing, stealing, and so on, in this life one experiences various harms such as being killed, imprisoned, and so on.

original: tshe rab gzhan du yang ngan songs gsum la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal myong bas bdag la gnod do //
analyzed: tshe rab gzhan du yang ngan songs gsum la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal myong bas bdag la gnod do //
translated: And in other lives, one experiences the suffering of the three miserable realms and so on. Thus, one harms oneself.

original: sems can bcom pas gzhan la gnod par ston te /
analyzed: sems can bcom pas gzhan la gnod par ston te /
translated: By destroying sentient beings, one harms others.

original: tshul khrims 'khrugs par gyur na ni sdig pa'i las la 'dzem pa med par 'jug ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'khrugs par gyur na ni sdig pa'i las la 'dzem pa med par 'jug ste /
translated: When one's morality is disturbed, one engages in sinful actions without restraint.

original: gzhan gyi srog gcod pa dang / nor las ma byin par len pas na gzhan la gnod do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi srog gcod pa dang / nor las ma byin par len pas na gzhan la gnod do //
translated: By killing others and stealing their wealth, one harms others.

original: de ltar bdag la yang sdug bsngal bskyed /
analyzed: de ltar bdag la yang sdug bsngal bskyed /
translated: Thus, one generates suffering for oneself.

original: gzhan la yang sdug bsngal bskyed pas na /
analyzed: gzhan la yang sdug bsngal bskyed pas na /
translated: And because one generates suffering for others,

original: gnyi ga la gnod do ;
analyzed: gnyi ga la gnod do ;
translated: one harms both.

original: /'dod pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa tshig rnam pa drug gis so zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: /'dod pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa tshig rnam pa drug gis so zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The six types of persons who are associated with desire and so on are as follows.

original: 'gyod pa dang bcas pa dang / rnyed pa dang bral ba dang / bsrung ba dang bral ba dang / ston pas smad pa dang / rtsod pa'i gzhir bcas pa dang / grags ldan med pa dang drug gis tshe 'di la kha na ma thob 'phel bar 'gyur ba ston te /
analyzed: 'gyod pa dang bcas pa dang / rnyed pa dang bral ba dang / bsrung ba dang bral ba dang / ston pas smad pa dang / rtsod pa'i gzhir bcas pa dang / grags ldan med pa dang drug gis tshe 'di la kha na ma thob 'phel bar 'gyur ba ston te /
translated: The six, regret, lack of gain, lack of protection, contempt by the teacher, the basis of dispute, and lack of fame, show the increase of this life's misfortune.

original: ji ltar 'phel bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phel bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does it increase?

original: de'i phyir ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
translated: Therefore, how does it arise?

original: de bdag dang pha rol rnams lha dang ston pa yang slu 'phya bar byed ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bdag dang pha rol rnams lha dang ston pa yang slu 'phya bar byed ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, He deceives himself and others, the gods and the teacher, and is scorned, etc.

original: 'gyod pa dang bcas pas ni bdag gis bdag bslus pa dang / bdag la bdag smod par byed pa ston te /
analyzed: 'gyod pa dang bcas pas ni bdag gis bdag bslus pa dang / bdag la bdag smod par byed pa ston te /
translated: Regret shows that one deceives oneself and one scorns oneself.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: sdig pa mi dge ba byas pa'i gang zag de ni 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba byas pa'i gang zag de ni 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: The person who has done evil and nonvirtue thinks this:

original: bsod nams byed pa'i gang zag dag ni thar pa'i lam du zhugs pa yin la /
analyzed: bsod nams byed pa'i gang zag dag ni thar pa'i lam du zhugs pa yin la /
translated: The person who does merit has entered the path of liberation,

original: 'phags bdag ni 'jigs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phags bdag ni 'jigs pa med pa yin no //
translated: but I, a noble one, am fearless.

original: sdig pa byed pa dag ni ngan song gi @61a * //
analyzed: sdig pa byed pa dag ni ngan song gi @61a * //
translated: Those who commit evil deeds go to the lower realms.üîΩ

original: lam du zhugs pa yin la /
analyzed: lam du zhugs pa yin la /
translated: Those who commit negative actions have entered the path to the lower realms.

original: sdig pa byed pa'i gang zag dag ni 'jigs pa dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: sdig pa byed pa'i gang zag dag ni 'jigs pa dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: Those who commit negative actions are fearful

original: bdag gis kyang sdig pa byas pa yin pas /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang sdig pa byas pa yin pas /
translated: because they have committed negative actions.

original: ngan song gi lam du zhugs pa 'jigs pa dang bcas pa yin pas bdag ni brlag pa'o chud zos pa'o zhes bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid kyi lus dang sems la smod par byed do //
analyzed: ngan song gi lam du zhugs pa 'jigs pa dang bcas pa yin pas bdag ni brlag pa'o chud zos pa'o zhes bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid kyi lus dang sems la smod par byed do //
translated: They reproach themselves, saying, ‚ÄúI have entered the path to the lower realms. I am fearful. I am lost. I am ruined.‚Äù

original: rnyed pa dang bral ba zhes bya bas /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bral ba zhes bya bas /
translated: The line ‚ÄúThey are bereft of gain‚Äù

original: pha rol slu zhing pha rol gyis smod par byed pa bstan te /
analyzed: pha rol slu zhing pha rol gyis smod par byed pa bstan te /
translated: shows how others deceive them and how others criticize them.üîΩIn this way, the benefactors say to those who commit negative actions,

original: 'di ltar sdig pa byed pa'i gang zag de la sbyin pa'i bdag po rnams kyang 'di skad du zer te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sdig pa byed pa'i gang zag de la sbyin pa'i bdag po rnams kyang 'di skad du zer te /
translated: ‚ÄúYou are not a suitable recipient for this gift.

analyzed: dgra dbang song zhes bya ba la /

translated: To them, the bodhisattva generates great compassion, thinking, Alas! These sentient beings are under the power of Mara, and so they are not in control.

original: sdug bsngal gzir dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzir dang zhes bya ba la /

translated: They have compassion for those who are suffering, who are overwhelmed by the feelings of suffering, but not for those who have feelings of pleasure or those who have feelings that are neither pleasure nor pain.üîΩBodhisattvas, on the other hand, know that whatever feelings of pleasure are experienced, whatever feelings of pain are experienced, and whatever feelings that are neither pleasure nor pain are experienced, all of them are suffering.

analyzed: zad par mi 'gyur bas na rtag pa ste /

original: dper na so so'i skye bo dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na so so'i skye bo dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas lta bu'o //
translated: For example, this is like ordinary beings, sravakas, and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de la so so'i skye bo dag ni kha cig la snying rje yod kyang de nyid la bar 'ga' zhe sdang 'byung ba dang / mdza' ba la snying rje yod kyang dgra la zhe sdang yod do //
analyzed: de la so so'i skye bo dag ni kha cig la snying rje yod kyang de nyid la bar 'ga' zhe sdang 'byung ba dang / mdza' ba la snying rje yod kyang dgra la zhe sdang yod do //
translated: Among them, ordinary beings have compassion for some, but sometimes hatred arises for those very beings, and they have compassion for friends but hatred for enemies.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la zhe sdang dngos su mi 'byung yang zhe sdang gi bag la nyal phra mo ma spangs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la zhe sdang dngos su mi 'byung yang zhe sdang gi bag la nyal phra mo ma spangs so //
translated: Although hatred does not actually arise for sravakas and pratyekabuddhas, they have not abandoned the subtle latent tendency to hatred.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni 'tshe ba dang zhe sdang gi bag la nyal mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad spangs pas 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni 'tshe ba dang zhe sdang gi bag la nyal mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad spangs pas 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
translated: But the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas are free from attachment, because they have abandoned all the counteragents, violence and the latent tendency to hatred.

original: de'i phyir snying rje chen por gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir snying rje chen por gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, it is established as great compassion.

original: mi dmigs ma yin dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi dmigs ma yin dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Not non-apprehending, and so on.

original: gang la dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang / brtsal 'bad dang bcas pa de dag snying rje can ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang / brtsal 'bad dang bcas pa de dag snying rje can ma yin no //
translated: Those who apprehend and strive are not compassionate.

original: sa brgyad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pas rnam par mi rtog pa lhun gyis grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pas rnam par mi rtog pa lhun gyis grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The bodhisattvas on the eighth stage, having attained the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas, are non-conceptual and spontaneous.

original: bdag dang gzhan du dmigs pa dang // brtsal dang 'bad pa med par lhun gyis grub pa'i bdag nyid du snying rje 'byung bas na snying rje chen por gzhag go //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan du dmigs pa dang // brtsal dang 'bad pa med par lhun gyis grub pa'i bdag nyid du snying rje 'byung bas na snying rje chen por gzhag go //
translated: Compassion arises spontaneously, without the apprehension of self and other, without striving and exertion. Therefore, it is established as great compassion.

original: de bzhin gang la snying rje med pa byang chub min //
analyzed: de bzhin gang la snying rje med pa byang chub min //
translated: And likewise, where there is no compassion, there is no enlightenment.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: gong du bshad pa lta bu'i mnyam pa med pas na /
analyzed: gong du bshad pa lta bu'i mnyam pa med pas na /
translated: since there is no equality as explained above,

original: mi dmigs pa ma yin pa'i bar dag gi snying rje med pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ma yin pa'i bar dag gi snying rje med pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: those who do not have compassion, up to those who do not have non-apprehending compassion, are not bodhisattvas. This is the meaning.

original: shing ljon ba lta bur snying rje bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa lnga ste zhes bya ba la /üîΩ'di man chad tshigs su bcad pa lngas shing ljon pa la dpe blangs nas /
analyzed: shing ljon ba lta bur snying rje bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa lnga ste zhes bya ba la / 'di man chad tshigs su bcad pa lngas shing ljon pa la dpe blangs nas /
translated: Five verses on the teaching of compassion as a treeüîΩ.

original: snying rje'i shing dang 'dra bar ston te /
analyzed: snying rje'i shing dang 'dra bar ston te /
translated: From here on, in five verses, the teaching of compassion as a tree is shown by way of an analogy with a tree.

original: shing ljon pa la rtsa ba dang / sdong po dang / yal ga dang / 'dab ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu yod pa bzhin du /
analyzed: shing ljon pa la rtsa ba dang / sdong po dang / yal ga dang / 'dab ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu yod pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as a tree has roots, a trunk, branches, leaves, flowers, and fruits,

original: snying rje'i shing gi rtsa ba dang / sdong po dang / yal ga dang / lo ma dang 'dab ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu gang yin pa ston to //
analyzed: snying rje'i shing gi rtsa ba dang / sdong po dang / yal ga dang / lo ma dang 'dab ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu gang yin pa ston to //
translated: so the tree of compassion has roots, a trunk, branches, leaves, flowers, and fruits.üîΩCompassion, patience, thoughtfulness,

original: snying rje bzod pa sems pa dang / smon lam skye ba sems can smin //
analyzed: snying rje bzod pa sems pa dang / smon lam skye ba sems can smin //
translated: prayer, birth, and the evolution of beings.

original: 'di ni snying rje'i shing yin te //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ni snying rje'i shing yin te // zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is the tree of compassion.

original: snying rje'i shing gi rtsa ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po'o //
analyzed: snying rje'i shing gi rtsa ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po'o //
translated: Here, the root of the tree of compassion is the bodhisattvas great compassion.

original: sdong po ni bzod @66b pa'o ;
analyzed: sdong po ni bzod @66b pa'o ;
translated: The trunk is patience.

original: / yal ga ni sems can gyi don la sems pa'o //
analyzed: / yal ga ni sems can gyi don la sems pa'o //
translated: The branches are the thoughts of the benefit of sentient beings.

original: lo ma ni smon lam mo //
analyzed: lo ma ni smon lam mo //
translated: The leaves are the prayers.

original: skye ba ni me tog go //
analyzed: skye ba ni me tog go //
translated: The flowers are the births.

original: sems can smin par byed pa ni 'bras bu'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can smin par byed pa ni 'bras bu'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The fruit is the ripening of sentient beings.

original: rtsa ba che sogs 'bras bu chen po'i mchog / ces bya ba la /üîΩsnying rje'i shing la snying rje nyid rtsa ba yin pas na rtsa ba che'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba che sogs 'bras bu chen po'i mchog / ces bya ba la / snying rje'i shing la snying rje nyid rtsa ba yin pas na rtsa ba che'o //
translated: The root is great, etc. The fruit is the supreme.üîΩIn the tree of compassion, compassion itself is the root, so it is great.

original: sogs pa'i nang du ni bzod pa sdong por gyur pas na sdong po chen po zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar te /
analyzed: sogs pa'i nang du ni bzod pa sdong por gyur pas na sdong po chen po zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar te /
translated: The great trunk, etc. are included in the great trunk, etc.

original: tha mar yang sems can yongs su smin par byed pas na 'bras bu mchog yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tha mar yang sems can yongs su smin par byed pas na 'bras bu mchog yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In the end, the supreme fruit is the ripening of sentient beings.

original: de ni rtsa ba dang sdong po dang yal ga lo ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu'i gnas te zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: de ni rtsa ba dang sdong po dang yal ga lo ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu'i gnas te zhes bya ba la ;
translated: That is the root, trunk, branches, leaves, flowers, and fruit.

original: dper na shing ljon pa'i rtsa ba bzang po las sdong po 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dper na shing ljon pa'i rtsa ba bzang po las sdong po 'byung ngo //
translated: For example, from a good root of a tree, a trunk arises.

original: sdong po las yal ga 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sdong po las yal ga 'byung ngo //
translated: From the trunk, branches arise.

original: yal ga las lo ma 'byung ngo //üîΩlo ma las me tog 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yal ga las lo ma 'byung ngo // lo ma las me tog 'byung ngo //
translated: Leaves grow from the branches.üîΩFlowers grow from the leaves.

original: me tog las 'bras bu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: me tog las 'bras bu 'byung ngo //
translated: Fruits grow from the flowers.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po'i shing la yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po'i shing la yang /
translated: In the same way, in the tree of the bodhisattva‚Äôs great compassion,

original: snying rje chen po nyid ni rtsa ba'i gnas su gzhag ste /
analyzed: snying rje chen po nyid ni rtsa ba'i gnas su gzhag ste /
translated: great compassion is the root,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan thams cad kyi rtsa ba snying rje chen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan thams cad kyi rtsa ba snying rje chen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the root of all the bodhisattva‚Äôs virtues.

original: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang //
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang //
translated: Therefore, the noble Aksayamatinirdesa says,

original: gzhan yang btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po yang mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po yang mi zad pa ste /
translated: Moreover, Venerable Sariputra, the great compassion of the bodhisattva is inexhaustible.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the forerunner.

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di lta ste /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di lta ste /
translated: Venerable Sariputra, it is like this:

original: dper na dbugs phyir 'bud ba dang rngub pa ni skyes bu'i srog gi dbang po'i sngon du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: dper na dbugs phyir 'bud ba dang rngub pa ni skyes bu'i srog gi dbang po'i sngon du 'gro ba'o //
translated: Exhaling and inhaling are the forerunner of a person‚Äôs life faculty.

original: de bzhin du theg pa chen po yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du theg pa chen po yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: Likewise, in order to accomplish the Great Vehicle,üîΩ

original: byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Likewise, the Great Vehicle is preceded by the great compassion of the bodhisattva in order to accomplish the Great Vehicle.

original: 'phags pa ga ya'i rtse mo'i mdo las kyang byang chub sems dpa'/
analyzed: 'phags pa ga ya'i rtse mo'i mdo las kyang byang chub sems dpa'/
translated: And the noble Gayasirsha scripture also explains:

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi rtsa ba ni snying rje chen po'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi rtsa ba ni snying rje chen po'o //
translated: The root of the bodhisattva is great compassion.

original: sems can ni dmigs pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sems can ni dmigs pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Sentient beings are its object.

original: gang la snying rje yod pa de dag sems can gyi don du sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs bzod kyi /
analyzed: gang la snying rje yod pa de dag sems can gyi don du sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs bzod kyi /
translated: Those who have compassion endure various sufferings for the sake of sentient beings.

original: su la snying rje med pa de dag ni sems can gyi don du sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs bzod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: su la snying rje med pa de dag ni sems can gyi don du sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs bzod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: But those who have no compassion do not endure various sufferings for the sake of sentient beings.

original: de bas na snying rje las sems can gyi don du grang ba dang / tsha ba la sogs pa bzod par 'byung ste /üîΩbzod pa ni sdong po'i gnas lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bas na snying rje las sems can gyi don du grang ba dang / tsha ba la sogs pa bzod par 'byung ste / bzod pa ni sdong po'i gnas lta bu'o //
translated: Therefore, from compassion there arises the endurance of cold, heat, and so on for the sake of sentient beings.üîΩEndurance is like the trunk of the tree.

original: de ltar bzod pa sdong po lta bu'i shugs @67a * //
analyzed: de ltar bzod pa sdong po lta bu'i shugs @67a * //
translated: Thus, endurance is like the trunk of the tree.

original: kyis sems can rnams bsgral bar bya ba'i bsam pas rnam pa sna tshogs la sems pa'i bsam pa 'byung ste bsam pa de ni yal ga'i gnas lta bu'o //
analyzed: kyis sems can rnams bsgral bar bya ba'i bsam pas rnam pa sna tshogs la sems pa'i bsam pa 'byung ste bsam pa de ni yal ga'i gnas lta bu'o //
translated: The thought of various kinds of benefit for sentient beings arises in the bodhisattva, and that thought is like the branches.

original: de ltar sems can gyi don la sems pa'i bsam pa de las tshe rabs gar skyes gar skyes kyang sems can rnams la phan thogs par 'gyur ba'i lus dang longs spyod dang 'khor dang gnas phun sum tshogs par skye bar gyur cig ces smon lam 'debs pa 'byung
analyzed: de ltar sems can gyi don la sems pa'i bsam pa de las tshe rabs gar skyes gar skyes kyang sems can rnams la phan thogs par 'gyur ba'i lus dang longs spyod dang 'khor dang gnas phun sum tshogs par skye bar gyur cig ces smon lam 'debs pa 'byung
translated: From that thought of benefit for sentient beings, the bodhisattva makes the aspiration: ‚ÄúWherever I am born in my future lives, may I be born with a perfect body, resources, retinue, and abode, in order to benefit sentient beings.‚Äù

original: ste / smon lam ni lo ma'i gnas lta bu'o //
analyzed: ste / smon lam ni lo ma'i gnas lta bu'o //
translated: That aspiration is like the leaves.

original: de ltar smon lam lo ma lta bu'i shugs kyis tshe rabs gar skyes gar skyes kyang bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs par 'gyur ba'i gnas bzang por skye ste /
analyzed: de ltar smon lam lo ma lta bu'i shugs kyis tshe rabs gar skyes gar skyes kyang bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs par 'gyur ba'i gnas bzang por skye ste /
translated: By the force of the leaves of aspiration, wherever the bodhisattva is born in his future lives, he is born in a good place, in order to benefit himself and others.

original: skye ba bzang po len pa ni me tog gi gnas lta bu'o //
analyzed: skye ba bzang po len pa ni me tog gi gnas lta bu'o //
translated: Taking a good birth is like the flowers.

original: de ltar skye ba bzang po blangs pa las sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar skye ba bzang po blangs pa las sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, from taking a good rebirth, there arises the ripening of sentient beings.

original: de ni 'bras bu'i gnas lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu'i gnas lta bu'o //
translated: This is like the basis of the fruit.

original: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis snying rje yod na snying rje las bzod pa la sogs pa'i chos 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis snying rje yod na snying rje las bzod pa la sogs pa'i chos 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, with one verse, it is shown that if there is compassion, from compassion there arises the Dharma of patience, etc.

original: rjes su 'jug pa bstan nas /
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the following,

original: da ni snying rje med na bzod pa la sogs pa phyi ma mi 'byung ste ldog par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni snying rje med na bzod pa la sogs pa phyi ma mi 'byung ste ldog par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach that if there is no compassion, patience, etc. do not arise and are stopped,üîΩhe says,

original: rtsa ba snying rje med gyur na //
analyzed: rtsa ba snying rje med gyur na //
translated: If there is no compassion as the root,

original: dka' bar spyod pa bzod pa med //üîΩces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dka' bar spyod pa bzod pa med // ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: there is no patience with the difficult practices.

original: dper na shing gi rtsa ba med na sdong po med par 'gyur ro //üîΩsdong po med na yal ga med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na shing gi rtsa ba med na sdong po med par 'gyur ro // sdong po med na yal ga med par 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, if a tree has no root, there is no trunk.üîΩIf there is no trunk, there are no branches.

original: yal ga med na 'dab ma med par 'gyur ro //üîΩ'dab ma med na me tog med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yal ga med na 'dab ma med par 'gyur ro // 'dab ma med na me tog med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there are no branches, there are no leaves.üîΩIf there are no leaves, there are no flowers.

original: me tog med na 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me tog med na 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there are no flowers, there is no fruit.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje'i shing la yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje'i shing la yang /
translated: Likewise, in the tree of a bodhisattva's compassion,

original: snying rje rtsa bar gyur ba med na sems can gyi don phyi nang gi sdug bsngal dka' bar spyod pa thams cad bzod pa'i bzod pa sdong po lta bur gyur pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snying rje rtsa bar gyur ba med na sems can gyi don phyi nang gi sdug bsngal dka' bar spyod pa thams cad bzod pa'i bzod pa sdong po lta bur gyur pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: if there is no root of compassion, there is no trunklike patience that endures all the sufferings of self and others and all the hardships for the sake of sentient beings.

original: blo ldan sdug bsngal mi bzod na //üîΩsems can don zhig ga la sems //
analyzed: blo ldan sdug bsngal mi bzod na // sems can don zhig ga la sems //
translated: If the wise cannot endure suffering,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: how can they think of the welfare of sentient beings?

original: de ltar bzod pa sdong por gyur pa lta bur med de sdug bsngal ba la mi bzod na sems can gyi don la sems pa'i bsam pa yal ga lta bur gyur pa ga la zhig yod de /
analyzed: de ltar bzod pa sdong por gyur pa lta bur med de sdug bsngal ba la mi bzod na sems can gyi don la sems pa'i bsam pa yal ga lta bur gyur pa ga la zhig yod de /
translated: If they cannot endure suffering, how can they have the branches of the attitude that thinks of the welfare of sentient beings?

original: bsam pa de yang med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsam pa de yang med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that such an attitude would be absent.

original: bsam pa rnam par spangs pa'i blo //
analyzed: bsam pa rnam par spangs pa'i blo //
translated: An attitude that is devoid of such an intention

original: tshe rabs bzang por smin mi byed //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: tshe rabs bzang por smin mi byed //üîΩces bya ba la /
translated: will not ripen into a good rebirth.

translated: Thus, if one abandons the intention to benefit sentient beings, one does not make the aspiration prayer: ‚ÄúMay I be born in such and such good rebirths for the sake of sentient beings.‚Äù

analyzed: de bas na tshe rabs bzang por skye ba me tog lta bu mi 'byung ngo //

analyzed: sems can yongs su smin byed med //

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /

analyzed: de bas na sems can yongs su smin par byed pa 'bras bu lta bur gyur pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: 'di ltar shing ljon pa'i rtsa ba chus brlan na /
analyzed: 'di ltar shing ljon pa'i rtsa ba chus brlan na /
translated: Just as when the roots of a tree are moistened with water,

analyzed: rtsa ba brtan pa dang rgyas par gyur bas de'i zhor gyis sdong po la sogs pa yang 'phel bar 'gyur ba bzhin du 'dir yang tshigs su bcad pa gnyis shig gis snying rje chen po rtsa bar gyur pa la /
