original: de brlan zhing brtas par byed pa'i chu gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de brlan zhing brtas par byed pa'i chu gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, in order to show what the water is that moistens and nourishes the root of great compassion,üîΩ[the root of the tree of enlightenment],

original: snying rje'i chu ni byams pa ste //
analyzed: snying rje'i chu ni byams pa ste //
translated: the root of compassion is moistened with the water of love,

original: sdug bsngal bde ba rgya cher rgyas //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bde ba rgya cher rgyas // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: and suffering and happiness grow vast.

original: dper na shing gi rtsa ba la chus brlan na 'phel zhing rgyas pa bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na shing gi rtsa ba la chus brlan na 'phel zhing rgyas pa bzhin du /
translated: For example, just as when the roots of a tree are moistened with water, they grow and expand,

original: snying rje'i rtsa bar gyur pa la byams pa'i chus brlan na /
analyzed: snying rje'i rtsa bar gyur pa la byams pa'i chus brlan na /
translated: in the same way, when the root of compassion is moistened with the water of love,

original: snying rje'i rtsa bar gyur pa brtas shing 'phel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: snying rje'i rtsa bar gyur pa brtas shing 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: the root of compassion becomes firm and grows.

original: de las bzod pa sdong po lta bur gyur pa la sogs pa yang brtas shing 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las bzod pa sdong po lta bur gyur pa la sogs pa yang brtas shing 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And from that, patience becomes like a trunk, and so on, and it grows and increases. This is the meaning.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: byams pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni byams pa'i sems chu dang 'dra ba snying rjes brlan na /
analyzed: byams pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni byams pa'i sems chu dang 'dra ba snying rjes brlan na /
translated: When bodhisattvas who are full of loving kindness are moistened by the water of loving kindness and compassion,

original: snying rje 'phel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: snying rje 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: compassion increases.

original: snying rje 'phel dang byang chub sems dpa' pha rol gyi sdug bsngal mthong nas bdag nyid sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snying rje 'phel dang byang chub sems dpa' pha rol gyi sdug bsngal mthong nas bdag nyid sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And when compassion increases, the bodhisattva feels pain when he sees the suffering of others.

original: de ltar na sems can gyi don du zhugs pa las sdug bsngal 'byung ba de nyid sdug bsngal ma yin gyi bde ba rgya chen po yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na sems can gyi don du zhugs pa las sdug bsngal 'byung ba de nyid sdug bsngal ma yin gyi bde ba rgya chen po yin te /
translated: Thus, the suffering that arises from engaging in the welfare of sentient beings is not suffering at all, but rather a great happiness.

original: de bas na ci la yang mi bzod pa med pas na /
analyzed: de bas na ci la yang mi bzod pa med pas na /
translated: Therefore, since there is no impatience with regard to anything,

original: bzod pa sdong po lta bu dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bzod pa sdong po lta bu dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: patience becomes like a trunk.

original: rgyas bzhes bya ba ni 'di'i skabs su bzod pa la bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas bzhes bya ba ni 'di'i skabs su bzod pa la bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúincreases‚Äù should be understood as referring to patience in this context.

original: yal ga 'phel zhing gyes pa ni //
analyzed: yal ga 'phel zhing gyes pa ni //
translated: The branches grow and spread.

original: tshul bzhin yid byed shes par bya //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid byed shes par bya // zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should know that the branches are the four kinds of thorough search.üîΩThe trunk is the root of the tree, and the trunk of the tree is the root of the branches.üîΩThe trunk of the tree of enlightenment is the will to enlightenment, which is the root of the branches.üîΩThe branches are the four kinds of thorough search.üîΩThe four kinds of thorough search are the thorough search for (1) the object, (2) the reality, (3) the method, and (4) the attainment.

original: theg pa chen po'i don gang @68a * //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i don gang @68a * //
translated: The thorough search for the object is the search for the three vehicles.üîΩThe thorough search for reality is the search for the two kinds of selflessness.üîΩThe thorough search for the method is the search for the perfections.

original: zag dang chos la bdag med pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi don bya ba la sems pa ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa zhes bya ba de bas na sems pa ni yal ga lta bur 'phel zhing gyes par blta'o //
analyzed: zag dang chos la bdag med pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi don bya ba la sems pa ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa zhes bya ba de bas na sems pa ni yal ga lta bur 'phel zhing gyes par blta'o //
translated: The thorough search for attainment is the search for the ten stages.üîΩThe leaves are the thirty-seven accessories of enlightenment.

original: smon lam rgyun ni ma chad pas //
analyzed: smon lam rgyun ni ma chad pas //
translated: The leaves of the tree are the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment.üîΩThe thirty-seven aids to enlightenment are the four forms of thorough application, the four supports for miraculous action, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path.üîΩThe fruits are the two kinds of enlightenment.

original: 'dab ma dag ni lhags shing skye //üîΩzhes bya ba la /üîΩdper na shing ljon pa yang 'dab ma rnyings pa dag ni 'dor zhing 'dab ma gsar pa dag skye zhing 'dzin pa dang 'dra bar /
analyzed: 'dab ma dag ni lhags shing skye // zhes bya ba la / dper na shing ljon pa yang 'dab ma rnyings pa dag ni 'dor zhing 'dab ma gsar pa dag skye zhing 'dzin pa dang 'dra bar /
translated: The fruits of the tree are the two kinds of enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sngar btab pa'i smon lam rgya chung ngu dang skye ba rgya chung ngu rnams ni bor nas /üîΩphyis smon lam rgya chen po dang skye ba rgya chen po dag rgyun du len cing 'dzin par byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sngar btab pa'i smon lam rgya chung ngu dang skye ba rgya chung ngu rnams ni bor nas /üîΩphyis smon lam rgya chen po dang skye ba rgya chen po dag rgyun du len cing 'dzin par byed de /
translated: The two kinds of enlightenment are the enlightenment of the solitary sage and the supreme enlightenment.

original: de ltar smon lam snga ma 'dor zhing phyi ma len pa'i rgyun mi gcod pa ni 'dab ma snga ma lhags shing phyi ma skye ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de ltar smon lam snga ma 'dor zhing phyi ma len pa'i rgyun mi gcod pa ni 'dab ma snga ma lhags shing phyi ma skye ba bzhin no //
translated: Thus, the continuity of the bodhisattva's compassion is unbroken, like the continuity of a tree's leaves, as the former leaves fall and the latter leaves grow.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyis rkyen grub phyir //üîΩme tog mi stongs de las 'bras //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyis rkyen grub phyir // me tog mi stongs de las 'bras //
translated: The tree is established by two conditions,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: and the flower is not wasted, because of its fruit.

original: 'di ltar shing ljon pa yang rkyen rnam pa gnyis kyis grub ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar shing ljon pa yang rkyen rnam pa gnyis kyis grub ste /
translated: The tree is established by two conditions:

original: nang gi rkyen gyis grub pa dang / phyi'i rkyen gyis grub pa'o //üîΩde la nang gi rkyen gyis grub pa ni rtsa ba las sdong po grub /
analyzed: nang gi rkyen gyis grub pa dang / phyi'i rkyen gyis grub pa'o // de la nang gi rkyen gyis grub pa ni rtsa ba las sdong po grub /
translated: by an internal condition and by an external condition.

original: sdong po las yal ga grub pa la sogs pa'o /
analyzed: sdong po las yal ga grub pa la sogs pa'o /
translated: The internal condition is the establishment of the trunk from the root, the establishment of the branches from the trunk, and so on.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje'i shing la nang gi rkyen smon lam yongs su grub pas rang gi skye ba bzang por yongs su smin pa'i phyir me tog lta bu'i skye ba yang ma stong te /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje'i shing la nang gi rkyen smon lam yongs su grub pas rang gi skye ba bzang por yongs su smin pa'i phyir me tog lta bu'i skye ba yang ma stong te /
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva's tree of compassion is not wasted in its flower-like births, because of the ripening of his good births by the establishment of his internal condition, his vow.

original: skye ba don med par ma gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skye ba don med par ma gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that his births are not fruitless.

original: dper na shing ljon pa las chu me rlung la sogs pa phyi rol gyi rkyen gyis grogs byas na me tog las 'bras bu skye ba bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na shing ljon pa las chu me rlung la sogs pa phyi rol gyi rkyen gyis grogs byas na me tog las 'bras bu skye ba bzhin du /
translated: are helpful, then from the flower the fruit is produced.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje'i shing la yang phyi rol gyi rkyen du grub ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje'i shing la yang phyi rol gyi rkyen du grub ste /
translated: In the same way, in the Bodhisattva's tree of compassion, the external conditions are established.

original: tshe rabs gang nas gang du skyes par yongs su smin par byed pa'i 'bras bu grub pas na 'bras bu yongs su ma stongs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshe rabs gang nas gang du skyes par yongs su smin par byed pa'i 'bras bu grub pas na 'bras bu yongs su ma stongs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since the fruit of bringing to maturity is produced in whatever birth he is born in, the fruit is not exhausted. This is the meaning.

original: snying rje'i bsngags pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snying rje'i bsngags pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The verse on the praise of compassion.

original: da ni tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis snying rje'i legs pa dang / yon tan ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: da ni tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis snying rje'i legs pa dang / yon tan ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Now, in one verse, the excellence and the virtue of compassion are taught.

original: snying rje chen po'i yon tan byed pa yi //
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i yon tan byed pa yi //
translated: The virtue of great compassion

original: sems can rnams ni snying rjes su mi byed //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni snying rjes su mi byed //
translated: is not to be compassionate to sentient beings.

original: ces bya ba la snying rje chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs kyi rgyud la mnga' ba'i thugs rje la bya'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la snying rje chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs kyi rgyud la mnga' ba'i thugs rje la bya'o //
translated: Great compassion is the compassion that exists in the mind of the Tathagata.

original: 'di ltar stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la @68b sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan yin pa bzhin du /
analyzed: 'di ltar stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la @68b sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan yin pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as the powers, fearlessnesses, etc. are qualities of the Tathagata,

original: thugs rje chen po yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan no //
translated: so also is great compassion.

original: thugs rje chen po'i yon tan de yang sems can thams cad la dmigs na 'dod pa thob par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: thugs rje chen po'i yon tan de yang sems can thams cad la dmigs na 'dod pa thob par 'gyur bas na /
translated: And that quality of great compassion is obtained by all sentient beings, since they are the object of the compassion.

original: sems can rnams ni snying rje chen po'i yon tan byed pa zhes bya ste ;
analyzed: sems can rnams ni snying rje chen po'i yon tan byed pa zhes bya ste ;
translated: Therefore, sentient beings are said to be the field of the quality of great compassion.

original: de lta bur snying rje chen po yon tan thob par byed pa'i sems can rnams la snying rje bar su zhig mi byed de kun gyis kyang snying rje bar bya ba'i rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bur snying rje chen po yon tan thob par byed pa'i sems can rnams la snying rje bar su zhig mi byed de kun gyis kyang snying rje bar bya ba'i rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Who would not have compassion for sentient beings, who are the field of the quality of great compassion? The meaning is that everyone should have compassion.

original: da ni tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyis snying rje'i yon tan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyis snying rje'i yon tan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach just the quality of compassion, he says:

original: snying rje skyed pa gang yin de dag ni //
analyzed: snying rje skyed pa gang yin de dag ni //
translated: Those who generate compassion

original: sdug bsngal na yang mtshungs med bde bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sdug bsngal na yang mtshungs med bde bar 'gyur //
translated: are not even comparable to those who are happy in suffering.

original: zhes bya ba smos te //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te //
translated: This is what is said.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa mang po gang yin pa de dag sdug bsngal bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa mang po gang yin pa de dag sdug bsngal bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: The many kinds of suffering that arise from the great compassion of the bodhisattva do not become suffering.

original: lha dang mi la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i bde ba dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba las kyang 'das shing 'phags pa'i bde bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lha dang mi la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i bde ba dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba las kyang 'das shing 'phags pa'i bde bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: They become the happiness of the noble ones, which is superior to the happiness of the mundane and supramundane worlds of gods, humans, etc., and to the happiness of the sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, etc. This is the meaning.

original: mdo sde rgyan bam po lnga'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: mdo sde rgyan bam po lnga'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the fifth chapter of the Ornament of the Mahayana Sutras is complete.üîΩA verse on compassion without attachment

original: // / snying rje chags pa med pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ste //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / snying rje chags pa med pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ste // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The verse on compassion without attachment.üîΩüîΩ

original: snying rjes zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams //
analyzed: snying rjes zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams //
translated: The bodhisattvas who are seized by compassion

original: so so'i skye bo bzhin 'khor ba la yang ma chags mi gnas /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo bzhin 'khor ba la yang ma chags mi gnas /
translated: are not attached to cyclic life like ordinary people, nor do they stay in it.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa yang ma chags mi gnas par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa yang ma chags mi gnas par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that he is not attached to nirvana, like the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas,

original: tshigs su bcad pa gcig rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gcig rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: he composes one verse.

original: snying rjes brlan pa'i snying rje can //
analyzed: snying rjes brlan pa'i snying rje can //
translated: The compassionate one, his heart moistened with compassion,

original: zhi ba la yang mi gnas na //üîΩ'jig rten bde dang rang srog la //
analyzed: zhi ba la yang mi gnas na // 'jig rten bde dang rang srog la //
translated: does not even abide in peace,

original: chags par 'gyur ba smos ci dgos //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chags par 'gyur ba smos ci dgos // zhes bya ba la /
translated: how much less in the pleasures of the world and in self-interest?

original: 'jig rten pa dag ni 'jig rten pa'i 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan gyi bde ba la chags pa dang / rang gi srog dang lus la chags te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dag ni 'jig rten pa'i 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan gyi bde ba la chags pa dang / rang gi srog dang lus la chags te /
translated: Worldly people are attached to the pleasures of the five sense objects and to their own lives and bodies.

original: de bas na 'khor ba la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'khor ba la gnas pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they abide in cyclic existence.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams 'jig rten gyi bde ba dang srog la chags pa med kyang sdug bsngal thams cad spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la chags pas mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams 'jig rten gyi bde ba dang srog la chags pa med kyang sdug bsngal thams cad spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la chags pas mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: The noble Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas, though not attached to worldly pleasures and life, abide in nirvana because of their attachment to the nirvana that is the abandonment of all suffering.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thugs rje can rnams thugs rjes byin gyis brlabs @69a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thugs rje can rnams thugs rjes byin gyis brlabs @69a * //
translated: The compassionate bodhisattvas bless them with compassion.üîΩ

original: shing thugs rje'i dbang du gyur la thugs rjes zin pa rnams ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi zhi ba phyogs gcig pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'jig rten gyi bya ba thams cad kyi phul du phyin pa de la yang ma chags mi gnas te
analyzed: shing thugs rje'i dbang du gyur la thugs rjes zin pa rnams ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi zhi ba phyogs gcig pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'jig rten gyi bya ba thams cad kyi phul du phyin pa de la yang ma chags mi gnas te
translated: The compassionate bodhisattvas, who are blessed by compassion, who are governed by compassion, and who are sustained by compassion, do not even become attached to or dwell in the nirvana of the disciples and hermit buddhas, which is a one-sided peace, the culmination of all mundane activities.

original: / 'dis ni mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa bstan to //
analyzed: / 'dis ni mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa bstan to //
translated: This shows that they do not dwell in nirvana.

original: de lta bu la yang ma chags na 'jig rten pa'i 'dod pa lnga'i bde ba dang lus dang srog la chags par 'gyur ba lta ci smos te /
analyzed: de lta bu la yang ma chags na 'jig rten pa'i 'dod pa lnga'i bde ba dang lus dang srog la chags par 'gyur ba lta ci smos te /
translated: If they are not attached even to that, what need is there to speak of their not being attached to the pleasures of the five senses of the world or to their bodies and lives?

original: ma chags ches so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma chags ches so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are very much unattached.

original: 'dis ni 'khor ba na mi gnas par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'khor ba na mi gnas par bstan to //
translated: This shows that they do not dwell in cyclic existence.

original: snying rjes sdug pa'i khyad par la tshigs su bcad pa gsum mo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snying rjes sdug pa'i khyad par la tshigs su bcad pa gsum mo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Three verses on the distinctive excellence of compassion

original: ji ltar 'jig rten pa dag pha ma bu tsha gnyen bshes la sdug pa yod pa dang / 'phags pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams la sdug pa yod mod kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten pa dag pha ma bu tsha gnyen bshes la sdug pa yod pa dang / 'phags pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams la sdug pa yod mod kyi /
translated: the noble Listeners and the Self-realized Buddhas have affection for suffering sentient beings,

original: de bas kyang byang chub sems dpa' thugs rje'i rgyus sems can thams cad la sdug par byed pa sdug pa gzhan dang khyad zhugs par bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de bas kyang byang chub sems dpa' thugs rje'i rgyus sems can thams cad la sdug par byed pa sdug pa gzhan dang khyad zhugs par bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: in order to show that the bodhisattvas' affection due to their compassion for all sentient beings is superior to other kinds of affection,üîΩthree verses are begun.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gsum rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩkha na ma tho med pa yi //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gsum rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to // kha na ma tho med pa yi //
translated: The meaning is that.üîΩThere is no affection without fault

original: sdug pa med de 'jig rten min //
analyzed: sdug pa med de 'jig rten min //
translated: in the world.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: 'jig rten pha ma la sogs pa bu tsha la sdug pa yod kyang 'jig rten pa'i sdug pa thams cad ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i sdug pa gang yang med de 'jig rten pa'i sdug pa thams cad kha na ma tho ba dang bcas shing sdig
analyzed: 'jig rten pha ma la sogs pa bu tsha la sdug pa yod kyang 'jig rten pa'i sdug pa thams cad ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i sdug pa gang yang med de 'jig rten pa'i sdug pa thams cad kha na ma tho ba dang bcas shing sdig
translated: although worldly people have affection for their parents and so on, all worldly affection is not without fault. All worldly affection is faulty and sinful.

original: pa dang skyon dang bcas pa sha stag go //
analyzed: pa dang skyon dang bcas pa sha stag go //
translated: and they are all defective.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: ma byin par len pa dang / srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i las la 'dzud pas sdug bsngal gyi chu bo chen po la 'jog pa dang / mi shes pa'i chu bo chen pos non pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa dang / srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i las la 'dzud pas sdug bsngal gyi chu bo chen po la 'jog pa dang / mi shes pa'i chu bo chen pos non pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they cause one to enter into actions such as taking what is not given and killing, and they cause one to be placed in the great river of suffering and to be overwhelmed by the great river of nescience.

original: thams cad kyang kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa sha stag go /
analyzed: thams cad kyang kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa sha stag go /

analyzed: bde ba de ni bde ba thams cad kyi mchog dang phul yin pas bde ba de 'jig rten gyi lha dang mi la sogs pa'i bde ba thams cad zil gyis gnon te bde ba thams cad pas lhag go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since that bliss is the best and most excellent of all blisses, that bliss surpasses all the blisses of mundane gods, humans, and so on. It means that it is superior to all blisses.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sdug bsngal nyid bde ba'i mchog tu gyur pa 'di ngo mtshar du bya ba yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sdug bsngal nyid bde ba'i mchog tu gyur pa 'di ngo mtshar du bya ba yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that this very suffering of the bodhisattva becomes the most excellent bliss, which is amazing,üîΩhe says,

original: don byas pa yang de dang bral ba yin pas na //
analyzed: don byas pa yang de dang bral ba yin pas na //
translated: Since he has accomplished his purpose and is free from that,

original: de las ngo mtshar che ba gzhan ci smos //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de las ngo mtshar che ba gzhan ci smos // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: what more can be said about his amazement?

original: 'di ltar 'phags pa dgra bcom pa sdug bsngal thams cad ni spangs /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'phags pa dgra bcom pa sdug bsngal thams cad ni spangs /
translated: Thus, noble arhats have abandoned all suffering

original: bde ba thams cad ni phun sum tshogs te /
analyzed: bde ba thams cad ni phun sum tshogs te /
translated: and are endowed with all bliss.

original: rnam pa thams cad du bdag gi don bsgrubs te de dag la yang byang chub sems dpa'i thugs rje las byung ba'i sdug bsngal nyid bde bar gyur pa'i bde ba de lta bu med na 'jig rten phal pa lta zhig ga la yod de /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du bdag gi don bsgrubs te de dag la yang byang chub sems dpa'i thugs rje las byung ba'i sdug bsngal nyid bde bar gyur pa'i bde ba de lta bu med na 'jig rten phal pa lta zhig ga la yod de /
translated: How much less could there be such happiness for ordinary people in the world?

original: de bas na gang sdug bsngal ba de nyid bde ba mchog tu gyur pa de las ngo mtshar che ba ci zhig yod de /üîΩngo mtshar gyi mchog tu bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na gang sdug bsngal ba de nyid bde ba mchog tu gyur pa de las ngo mtshar che ba ci zhig yod de / ngo mtshar gyi mchog tu bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, what could be more wondrous than that very suffering which is the highest happiness?

original: snying rje byas pa'i sbyin pa la rjes su bsngags pa'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snying rje byas pa'i sbyin pa la rjes su bsngags pa'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The verse on the praise of generosity that is done out of compassion.

original: 'jig rten na sbyin pa gtong bar byed pa yod kyang phan btags pa'i lan la re bas gtong ba dang / sngon phan btags pas lan du phan gdags pa'i phyir gtong ba yod de /
analyzed: 'jig rten na sbyin pa gtong bar byed pa yod kyang phan btags pa'i lan la re bas gtong ba dang / sngon phan btags pas lan du phan gdags pa'i phyir gtong ba yod de /
translated: In the world, there are those who practice generosity, but they give in the hope of getting something in return for the help they have given, or they give in order to get help in return for the help they have given in the past.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa gtong bar byed pa ni de lta bu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa gtong bar byed pa ni de lta bu ma yin gyi /
translated: But the bodhisattva does not practice generosity in this way.

original: snying rje'i shugs kyis gtong bas de ltar btang ba'i sbyin pa la yon tan dang legs pa yod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snying rje'i shugs kyis gtong bas de ltar btang ba'i sbyin pa la yon tan dang legs pa yod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the good qualities and excellence of the generosity that is practiced in that way through the power of compassion,

original: tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the verse is composed. This is the meaning.

original: snying rje dag dang ldan pa'i sbyin pas ni //
analyzed: snying rje dag dang ldan pa'i sbyin pas ni //
translated: The generosity of those who possess compassion

original: bstan pa rnams la sbyin pa bde byed pa //
analyzed: bstan pa rnams la sbyin pa bde byed pa //
translated: brings happiness to those who are taught.

original: khams gsum pa yi longs spyod de dag gis //üîΩbde ba de la de yi char mi 'gro //
analyzed: khams gsum pa yi longs spyod de dag gis // bde ba de la de yi char mi 'gro //
translated: The enjoyments of the three realms

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: do not approach a portion of that happiness.üîΩHere, when bodhisattvas practice generosity, they give gifts out of their love for destitute and needy sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa gtong ba ni sems can brel @71b ba dang phongs pa rnams la thugs brtse ba'i dbang gis sbyin pa btang nas de'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpa' dga' ba dang bde ba skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa gtong ba ni sems can brel @71b ba dang phongs pa rnams la thugs brtse ba'i dbang gis sbyin pa btang nas de'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpa' dga' ba dang bde ba skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: After that, the bodhisattvas give rise to joy and happiness.

original: dga' ba dang bde ba de la ni khams gsum pa'i lha dang mi'i bde ba gang gis kyang brgya'i cha'am stong gi cha 'am bye ba'i cha'am bye ba brgya stong gi char yang mi phod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dga' ba dang bde ba de la ni khams gsum pa'i lha dang mi'i bde ba gang gis kyang brgya'i cha'am stong gi cha 'am bye ba'i cha'am bye ba brgya stong gi char yang mi phod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the joy and bliss of the bodhisattva who has attained the stage of joy is not excelled by any of the bliss of the gods and humans of the three realms, not even by a hundredth part, not even by a thousandth part, not even by a hundred thousandth part.

original: snying rje dag dang ldan pa'i sbyin pas ni //
analyzed: snying rje dag dang ldan pa'i sbyin pas ni //
translated: The generosity of the compassionate one

original: bstan pa rnams la bde ba byed pa zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyi don sla bas ma bshad kyi /üîΩkhams gsum pa yi longs spyod dag gis ni //
analyzed: bstan pa rnams la bde ba byed pa zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyi don sla bas ma bshad kyi / khams gsum pa yi longs spyod dag gis ni //
translated: The meaning of the first half of the verse, ‚ÄúThe generosity of the compassionate one brings happiness to the teachings,‚Äù is easy and so is not explained.

original: zhes bya ba yan chad kyi tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyi don 'grel pas bkrol te bshad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yan chad kyi tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyi don 'grel pas bkrol te bshad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the second half of the verse, ‚ÄúThe generosity of the compassionate one brings happiness to the teachings,‚Äù is explained by the commentary, beginning with ‚ÄúThe generosity of the compassionate one brings happiness to the teachings through the enjoyments of the three realms.‚Äù

original: snying rjes sdug bsngal khas len pa la tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snying rjes sdug bsngal khas len pa la tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The verse on accepting suffering through compassion

original: kha cig 'di snyam du byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don du 'khor ba khas blangs kyang 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal khams blangs so snyam pa la /
analyzed: kha cig 'di snyam du byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don du 'khor ba khas blangs kyang 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal khams blangs so snyam pa la /
translated: Some think that although the bodhisattva accepts samsara for the sake of sentient beings, he accepts the sufferings of samsara.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'khor ba khas blangs pas na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'khor ba khas blangs pas na /
translated: To demonstrate that the bodhisattvas accept samsara,

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rnams kyang khas blangs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rnams kyang khas blangs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: they also accept the sufferings of samsara.

original: tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The verse is composed for that purpose.

original: 'khor ba dag ni sdug bsngal rang bzhin te //
analyzed: 'khor ba dag ni sdug bsngal rang bzhin te //
translated: Samsara has the nature of suffering,

original: sems can don du snying rje gang mi gtong //üîΩgzhan dag la ni phan phyir sdug bsngal ni //
analyzed: sems can don du snying rje gang mi gtong // gzhan dag la ni phan phyir sdug bsngal ni //
translated: but out of compassion, one does not abandon it for the sake of sentient beings.

original: snying rje can gyis khas kyang ma blangs sam //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snying rje can gyis khas kyang ma blangs sam // zhes bya ba la /
translated: For the sake of others, the compassionate one does not even accept suffering.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo dag las //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo dag las //
translated: Here, the Bhagavat has said in the sutras:

original: skye ba sdug bsngal ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba sdug bsngal ba dang / 'dod pa ji snyed pa sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa sdug bsngal ba dang / mdza' ba dang bral ba sdug bsngal ba dang /
analyzed: skye ba sdug bsngal ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba sdug bsngal ba dang / 'dod pa ji snyed pa sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa sdug bsngal ba dang / mdza' ba dang bral ba sdug bsngal ba dang /
translated: Birth is suffering, aging, sickness, death is suffering, not obtaining what one desires is suffering, encountering what is unpleasant is suffering,

original: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba'o zhes 'khor ba yang sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin du bshad la /
analyzed: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba'o zhes 'khor ba yang sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin du bshad la /
translated: in brief, the five appropriated aggregates are suffering.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad kyang 'khor bar ma 'dus pa gang yang med de de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don du snying rje'i shugs kyis 'khor ba yongs su ma btang ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad kyang 'khor bar ma 'dus pa gang yang med de de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don du snying rje'i shugs kyis 'khor ba yongs su ma btang ste /
translated: In brief, there is not a single suffering that is not included within cyclic existence. Therefore, the bodhisattva, for the sake of sentient beings, does not abandon cyclic existence through the force of compassion.

original: 'khor ba khas blangs na sems can gzhan la phan pa bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: 'khor ba khas blangs na sems can gzhan la phan pa bya ba'i phyir //
translated: If one accepts cyclic existence, then in order to benefit other sentient beings,

original: snying rje can gyis 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad khas ma blangs pa ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: snying rje can gyis 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad khas ma blangs pa ci zhig yod de /
translated: what suffering of cyclic existence could the compassionate one not accept?

original: sdug bsngal thams cad kyang khas blangs ches so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad kyang khas blangs ches so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and also all the sufferings, because of the great acceptance.
This is the meaning.

original: 'bras bu dang gsum 'phel ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang gsum 'phel ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The verse on the result of the three increases.

original: byang chub sems dpa' snying rje can rnams chos gsum 'phel ba dang / chos gsum gyi 'bras bu 'phel ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' snying rje can rnams chos gsum 'phel ba dang / chos gsum gyi 'bras bu 'phel ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the increase of the three dharmas and the increase of the result of the three dharmas of the compassionate bodhisattvas,

original: tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the verse is composed. This is the meaning.

original: snying rje dang ni sbyin dang longs spyod rnams //
analyzed: snying rje dang ni sbyin dang longs spyod rnams //
translated: Compassion, generosity, and wealth

original: snying rje can gyis rtag tu rnam 'phel 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la //
analyzed: snying rje can gyis rtag tu rnam 'phel 'gyur // zhes bya ba la //
translated: always increase for the compassionate.

original: snying rje can gyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams rtag tu chos rnam pa gsum 'phel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: snying rje can gyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams rtag tu chos rnam pa gsum 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: The three dharmas of the compassionate bodhisattvas always increase.

original: chos gsum ni snying rje 'phel ba dang / sbyin pa 'phel ba dang / longs spyod 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: chos gsum ni snying rje 'phel ba dang / sbyin pa 'phel ba dang / longs spyod 'phel ba'o //
translated: The three dharmas are the increase of compassion, the increase of generosity, and the increase of wealth.

original: byams pa ni phan pa bskyed pa dang ; de mthus byas bde de yang de las so //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byams pa ni phan pa bskyed pa dang ; de mthus byas bde de yang de las so //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: Love is the generation of benefit, and that happiness produced by its power is also from that.

original: 'bras bu gsum 'phel ba ni snying rje'i dbang gis sems can kun la phan par sems pa'i byams pa 'phel bar 'gyur ba dang / sbyin pa'i dbang gis phongs pa rnams la yo byad kyis phan btags pas phan pa bskyed pa 'phel ba dang ; longs spyod kyi dbang gis longs spyod las ni sems can la bde ba'i mthu bskyed pas 'phel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'bras bu gsum 'phel ba ni snying rje'i dbang gis sems can kun la phan par sems pa'i byams pa 'phel bar 'gyur ba dang / sbyin pa'i dbang gis phongs pa rnams la yo byad kyis phan btags pas phan pa bskyed pa 'phel ba dang ; longs spyod kyi dbang gis longs spyod las ni sems can la bde ba'i mthu bskyed pas 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: The three results that increase are the increase of love, which is the wish to benefit all sentient beings through compassion, the increase of the generation of benefit through benefiting the poor with material things through generosity and the increase of the power to generate the happiness of sentient beings through resources through resources.üîΩ

original: longs spyod yod na gdod sems can la yo byad kyis phan gdags pa'i mthu yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: longs spyod yod na gdod sems can la yo byad kyis phan gdags pa'i mthu yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The increase of the three results is the increase of love, which is the intention to benefit all sentient beings through compassion, the increase of the generation of benefit through generosity, which is the benefit of sentient beings through the giving of necessities, and the increase of the power to generate the happiness of sentient beings through resources, because if one has resources, one has the power to benefit sentient beings through necessities.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams skye ba thams cad du gsum 'phel bar 'gyur ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams skye ba thams cad du gsum 'phel bar 'gyur ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The increase of the three for bodhisattvas in all lives and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' tshe rabs kun du snying rje 'phel ba dang / sbyin pa 'phel ba dang / longs spyod 'phel ba ni snying rje'i stobs kyis 'phel te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' tshe rabs kun du snying rje 'phel ba dang / sbyin pa 'phel ba dang / longs spyod 'phel ba ni snying rje'i stobs kyis 'phel te /
translated: The increase of compassion, generosity and resources in all lives of bodhisattvas is due to the power of compassion.

original: de la snying rje nyid la goms par byas pa ni tshe rabs gzhan du snying rje nyid shas cher 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la snying rje nyid la goms par byas pa ni tshe rabs gzhan du snying rje nyid shas cher 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The cultivation of compassion itself is the cause of the increase of compassion itself in other lives.

original: sbyin pa'ang snying rje'i stobs las so //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sbyin pa'ang snying rje'i stobs las so // zhes bya ba la /
translated: And generosity increases through the power of compassion.

original: sbyin pa 'phel ba yang snying rje'i stobs kyis 'phel te //
analyzed: sbyin pa 'phel ba yang snying rje'i stobs kyis 'phel te //
translated: The increase of generosity is through the power of compassion,

original: sems can brel ba dang phongs pa rnams la snying rje yod na gdod phyi dang nang gi dngos po gtong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can brel ba dang phongs pa rnams la snying rje yod na gdod phyi dang nang gi dngos po gtong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one who has compassion for beings who are in trouble and distress gives away external and internal things.

original: longs spyod kyang sbyin pa'i stobs las te zhes bya ba la /üîΩtshe rabs gzhan du longs spyod 'phel bar 'gyur ba yang tshe 'dir sbyin pa byas pa'i stobs kyis 'phel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: longs spyod kyang sbyin pa'i stobs las te zhes bya ba la / tshe rabs gzhan du longs spyod 'phel bar 'gyur ba yang tshe 'dir sbyin pa byas pa'i stobs kyis 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: And wealth increases through the power of generosity.üîΩThe increase of wealth in other lives is through the power of generosity in this life,

original: tshe 'dir sbyin pa btang ba dang / gdod tshe phyi mar longs spyod chen por 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe 'dir sbyin pa btang ba dang / gdod tshe phyi mar longs spyod chen por 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one who gives generously in this life will have great wealth in other lives.

original: de gsum las 'bras bu bde ba gsum du 'gyur te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de gsum las 'bras bu bde ba gsum du 'gyur te zhes bya ba la /
translated: From these three, there are three kinds of happiness that result.

original: chos @72b rnam pa gsum 'phel bas 'bras bu bde ba rnam pa gsum myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos @72b rnam pa gsum 'phel bas 'bras bu bde ba rnam pa gsum myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: by the increase of the three kinds of Dharma, one experiences the three kinds of happiness as results.

original: snying rje las ni byams pa bskyed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snying rje las ni byams pa bskyed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: From compassion, one generates love.

original: sems can gyi sdug bsngal bsal lo snyam du sems pa'i snying rje'i chos las ni sems can rnams bde ba la gzhag par bya'o snyam du sems pa'i byams pa'i sems bskyed pa'i 'bras bu myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can gyi sdug bsngal bsal lo snyam du sems pa'i snying rje'i chos las ni sems can rnams bde ba la gzhag par bya'o snyam du sems pa'i byams pa'i sems bskyed pa'i 'bras bu myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: from the Dharma of compassion, which thinks, ‚ÄúI will remove the suffering of sentient beings,‚Äù one experiences the result of generating the mind of love, which thinks, ‚ÄúI will establish sentient beings in happiness.‚Äù

original: sbyin pas ni sems can la phan 'dogs pa skyed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sbyin pas ni sems can la phan 'dogs pa skyed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: From generosity, one generates the benefit of sentient beings.

original: sbyin pa'i chos 'phel bas ni sems can la zang zing gis phan 'dogs pa'i 'bras bu myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i chos 'phel bas ni sems can la zang zing gis phan 'dogs pa'i 'bras bu myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: by the increase of the Dharma of generosity, one experiences the result of benefiting sentient beings with material things.

original: longs spyod las ni de la phan gdags par bya ba'i mthu byas ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: longs spyod las ni de la phan gdags par bya ba'i mthu byas ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: From resources, one generates the ability to benefit them.

original: longs spyod kyi chos 'phel bas ni sems can la yo byad kyis phan gdags par bya ba'i mthu yod pa'i 'bras bu myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: longs spyod kyi chos 'phel bas ni sems can la yo byad kyis phan gdags par bya ba'i mthu yod pa'i 'bras bu myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: One experiences the result of having the power to help sentient beings by providing them with necessities, because one has increased the Dharma of enjoyment.

original: longs spyod yod na gdod sems can la zang zing gis phan 'dogs pa'i mthu yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: longs spyod yod na gdod sems can la zang zing gis phan 'dogs pa'i mthu yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One has the power to help sentient beings by providing them with material necessities only if one has enjoyments.

original: sbyin pa la spro bar bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /üîΩdper na mi le lo can 'ga' zhig la de la phan par 'dod pa'i mi 'ga' zhig gis le lo spang bar bya ba'i phyir sems gzengs bstod cing spro ba skyed par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: sbyin pa la spro bar bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la / dper na mi le lo can 'ga' zhig la de la phan par 'dod pa'i mi 'ga' zhig gis le lo spang bar bya ba'i phyir sems gzengs bstod cing spro ba skyed par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: One verse on the encouragement to generosity.üîΩJust as a lazy man is encouraged and aroused by someone who wants to help him in order to get rid of his laziness,

original: sbyin pa le lor gyur nas sems can la mi 'jug pa la /
analyzed: sbyin pa le lor gyur nas sems can la mi 'jug pa la /
translated: so the lazy man who is attached to enjoyments and does not engage in generosity is encouraged by the Buddhas and their disciples in order to get rid of his attachment.

original: snying rjes sbyin pa byas na yon tan phun sum tshogs par 'gyur bas sbyin pa la khyod ci'i phyir le lo byed ces sbyin pa la gzengs bstod cing spro bar byed pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snying rjes sbyin pa byas na yon tan phun sum tshogs par 'gyur bas sbyin pa la khyod ci'i phyir le lo byed ces sbyin pa la gzengs bstod cing spro bar byed pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the verse is that one should compose a verse in order to encourage and delight generosity, saying, Why are you lazy about generosity, since generosity performed with compassion becomes perfect excellence?

original: 'phel ba dang ni rab tu spel bar bya //
analyzed: 'phel ba dang ni rab tu spel bar bya //
translated: One should increase and expand it.

original: sbyin pas rab tu bde bya smin par bya //
analyzed: sbyin pas rab tu bde bya smin par bya //
translated: One should ripen it by means of generosity.

translated: Thus, even if the result of that giving does not ripen for sentient beings, he trains in giving in that way.

original: snying rje de sbyin pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod @74b chen po ci'i phyir sems can la stobs par byed ce na /üîΩde'i phyir / bdag dang bde ba tha dad ma yin pas //
analyzed: snying rje de sbyin pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod @74b chen po ci'i phyir sems can la stobs par byed ce na / de'i phyir / bdag dang bde ba tha dad ma yin pas //
translated: Why does he dedicate the result of his giving, great wealth, to sentient beings out of compassion?üîΩTherefore he says,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because my happiness and theirs is not different.

original: sems can sdug bsngal ni byang chub sems dpa' sdug bsngal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can sdug bsngal ni byang chub sems dpa' sdug bsngal bar 'gyur te /
translated: The suffering of sentient beings is the suffering of the bodhisattva.

original: sems can dang byang chub sems dpa' sdug bsngal gcig ste tha mi dad pa'i phyir dang / gzhan bde na byang chub sems dpa' bde ste /
analyzed: sems can dang byang chub sems dpa' sdug bsngal gcig ste tha mi dad pa'i phyir dang / gzhan bde na byang chub sems dpa' bde ste /
translated: Because the suffering of sentient beings and the suffering of the bodhisattva are not different, and because the happiness of others is the bodhisattva's happiness.

original: sems can dang byang chub sems dpa' bde ba gcig cing tha mi dad pas na sbyin pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod chen po sems can rnams la sngo bar byed do //
analyzed: sems can dang byang chub sems dpa' bde ba gcig cing tha mi dad pas na sbyin pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod chen po sems can rnams la sngo bar byed do //
translated: Since the happiness of sentient beings and the happiness of the bodhisattva are not different, he dedicates the result of his giving, great wealth, to sentient beings.

original: de med par bdag gi sbyin pa'i 'bras bu mi 'dod do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de med par bdag gi sbyin pa'i 'bras bu mi 'dod do zhes bya ba la /
translated: He does not want the result of his giving for himself, saying, Without them, I do not want the result of my giving.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang sems can du bde ba tha mi dad de gcig pas na snying rjes sbyin pa la 'di ltar slob par byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang sems can du bde ba tha mi dad de gcig pas na snying rjes sbyin pa la 'di ltar slob par byed de /
translated: Thus, compassion causes one to train in generosity in the following way:üîΩIf you, generosity, were to bring about the maturation of a great deal of wealth as its effect, then you should bring about its maturation in such a way that its effect is experienced by sentient beings.

original: gal te sbyin pa khyod kyi 'bras bu longs spyod chen po zhig smin par byas na 'bras bu sems can rnams kyis myong bar 'gyur bar bya ba de ltar smin par gyis shig / gal te rnam par smin pa de sems can la sbyin pa med de sems
analyzed: gal te sbyin pa khyod kyi 'bras bu longs spyod chen po zhig smin par byas na 'bras bu sems can rnams kyis myong bar 'gyur bar bya ba de ltar smin par gyis shig / gal te rnam par smin pa de sems can la sbyin pa med de sems
translated: If that maturation were not to exist for sentient beings,

original: can gyis myong bar ma gyur na ni /
analyzed: can gyis myong bar ma gyur na ni /
translated: if it were not experienced by sentient beings,üîΩthen, since there would be no desire for the maturation of the result of generosity, it would be all right if sentient beings matured.

original: de ltar na sbyin pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la 'dod pa med pas sems can smin yang rung ngo zhes sbyin pa la zer ro //
analyzed: de ltar na sbyin pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la 'dod pa med pas sems can smin yang rung ngo zhes sbyin pa la zer ro //
translated: Thus, generosity is spoken of.

original: 'bras bu bcas pa'i sbyin pa sbyin byed na //
analyzed: 'bras bu bcas pa'i sbyin pa sbyin byed na //
translated: When one gives generosity that is accompanied by its result,

original: sems can sbyin pa'i bde bas bdag bder 'gyur //
analyzed: sems can sbyin pa'i bde bas bdag bder 'gyur //
translated: one becomes happy through the happiness of sentient beings who are the objects of generosity.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba na sbyin pa'i rdzas kyi dngos po 'ba' zhig gtong bar ma zad kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba na sbyin pa'i rdzas kyi dngos po 'ba' zhig gtong bar ma zad kyi /
translated: When a bodhisattva gives a gift, he does not give only the substance of the gift.

original: sbyin pa de'i 'bras bu longs spyod chen po rnam par smin pa yang sems can gyis myong bar gyur cig ces sems can la bsngo zhing sbyin par byed de //
analyzed: sbyin pa de'i 'bras bu longs spyod chen po rnam par smin pa yang sems can gyis myong bar gyur cig ces sems can la bsngo zhing sbyin par byed de //
translated: He gives the gift by dedicating it to sentient beings, saying, ‚ÄúMay they experience the great wealth that is the evolutionary development of this gift.‚Äù

original: de ltar sems can rnams la rdzas kyi dngos po sbyin pa dang / sbyin pa de'i 'bras bu longs spyod chen po yang byin nas sems can bde bar gyur na de nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa' bde bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ltar sems can rnams la rdzas kyi dngos po sbyin pa dang / sbyin pa de'i 'bras bu longs spyod chen po yang byin nas sems can bde bar gyur na de nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa' bde bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Thus, having given to sentient beings both the substance of the gift and the great wealth that is the evolutionary development of the gift, the bodhisattva is happy when sentient beings are happy.

original: rdzas kyi dngos po btang ste sems can bde la sbyin ba'i 'bras bu longs spyod byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyis myong ba la ni byang chub sems dpa' bde bar mi 'dzin to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdzas kyi dngos po btang ste sems can bde la sbyin ba'i 'bras bu longs spyod byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyis myong ba la ni byang chub sems dpa' bde bar mi 'dzin to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But the bodhisattva does not consider himself happy when he gives away the substance of the gift and the sentient beings do not experience the evolutionary development of the gift, the great wealth.

original: gal te khyod kyis bya ba nga la yod //
analyzed: gal te khyod kyis bya ba nga la yod //
translated: If you have a duty to me,

original: de rnams la ni shin tu 'bras bu 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de rnams la ni shin tu 'bras bu 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: For them, it is a very great result.

original: snying rje de sbyin pa la 'di ltar slob par byed de /
analyzed: snying rje de sbyin pa la 'di ltar slob par byed de /
translated: Thus, compassion teaches generosity in this way:

original: gal te sbyin pa khyod kyis nga la phan btags shing /
analyzed: gal te sbyin pa khyod kyis nga la phan btags shing /
translated: ‚ÄúIf you, generosity, benefit me,

original: @75a * // sbyin pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod chen po zhig sbyin par bya ba yod /
analyzed: @75a * // sbyin pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod chen po zhig sbyin par bya ba yod /
translated: and if there is a generosity that bestows the result of great wealth,

original: 'bras bu de rnams khyod kyis sems can rnams la sbyin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu de rnams khyod kyis sems can rnams la sbyin te /
translated: you should give that result to sentient beings,üîΩand you should do so in such a way that sentient beings will experience it.

original: sems can rnams kyis ji nas kyang myong bar 'gyur ba de ltar khyod kyis shig dang / de ltar byas na gdod khyod kyis nga la phan btags pa yin no zhes snying rje sbyin pa la de ltar ston cing slob par byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyis ji nas kyang myong bar 'gyur ba de ltar khyod kyis shig dang / de ltar byas na gdod khyod kyis nga la phan btags pa yin no zhes snying rje sbyin pa la de ltar ston cing slob par byed do //
translated: If you do that, then you will have benefited me.‚Äù

original: sbyin pa byin na sbyin pa dang sbyin pa'i 'bras bu de dag bdag gis sems can la byin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sbyin pa byin na sbyin pa dang sbyin pa'i 'bras bu de dag bdag gis sems can la byin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: When one gives a gift, one should give it in such a way that one thinks, ‚ÄúI give this gift and the result of this gift to sentient beings.‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa gtong ba'i dus na yang tshul 'di ltar gtong ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa gtong ba'i dus na yang tshul 'di ltar gtong ste /
translated: The bodhisattva gives a gift at the time of giving in this way.

original: sbyin pa'i dngos po dang / sbyin pa de btang ba'i 'bras bu gnyis ka sems can gyis myong bar gyur cig ces bsngo zhing sbyin par byed de de ltar zang zing dang 'bras bu gnyis ka sems can gyis myong ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i dngos po dang / sbyin pa de btang ba'i 'bras bu gnyis ka sems can gyis myong bar gyur cig ces bsngo zhing sbyin par byed de de ltar zang zing dang 'bras bu gnyis ka sems can gyis myong ste /
translated: One dedicates the gift and the thing given to the experience of sentient beings, thinking, May both the thing given and the result of giving it be experienced by sentient beings. Thus, both the material thing and the result are experienced by sentient beings.

original: sems can bde bar gyur na gdod byang chub sems dpa' bde bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can bde bar gyur na gdod byang chub sems dpa' bde bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement, When sentient beings are happy, then the bodhisattva is happy, is this.

original: gang gi phyir de nyid kyis ji tsam du 'bras bur bya bde tsam du 'bras bur 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de nyid kyis ji tsam du 'bras bur bya bde tsam du 'bras bur 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: Since he gives both the thing given and the result to sentient beings, to the extent that they are the effect, to that extent he has the effect.

original: gang gi phyir sbyin pa'i dngos po dang / 'bras bu gnyi ga sems can la btang nas sems can bde bar gyur na byang chub sems dpa' yang bde bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sbyin pa'i dngos po dang / 'bras bu gnyi ga sems can la btang nas sems can bde bar gyur na byang chub sems dpa' yang bde bar 'gyur bas /
translated: Since he gives both the thing given and the result to sentient beings, and when sentient beings are happy, the bodhisattva is happy,

original: sbyin pa khyod kyis sbyin pa ji snyed cig btang ba'i 'bras bu bdag la ji tsam zhig sbyin par bya ba'i 'bras bu'i 'bras bu de dag thams cad sems can la smin par gyis shig dang / de nyid kyis nga la phan btags pa yin no zhes snying rjes sbyin pa la ston cing slob par byed do //
analyzed: sbyin pa khyod kyis sbyin pa ji snyed cig btang ba'i 'bras bu bdag la ji tsam zhig sbyin par bya ba'i 'bras bu'i 'bras bu de dag thams cad sems can la smin par gyis shig dang / de nyid kyis nga la phan btags pa yin no zhes snying rjes sbyin pa la ston cing slob par byed do //
translated: By means of the results of the results of whatever gifts you give, may all of them ripen for sentient beings, and thereby I will be benefited.

original: sbyin pa yin no longs spyod mi 'dod pas //üîΩzhes bya ba la /üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa gtong ba yang /
analyzed: sbyin pa yin no longs spyod mi 'dod pas // zhes bya ba la / byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa gtong ba yang /
translated: He teaches and trains in giving with compassion.üîΩHe does not desire enjoyments, thinking, May I experience the results of giving.

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod chen por 'gyur ba de dag bdag gis myong bar ni mi 'dod de 'bras bu la thams cad nas thams cad du rgyab kyis lta zhing longs spyod myong bar bya ba la gcig tu ma myong zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod chen por 'gyur ba de dag bdag gis myong bar ni mi 'dod de 'bras bu la thams cad nas thams cad du rgyab kyis lta zhing longs spyod myong bar bya ba la gcig tu ma myong zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The bodhisattva who gives gifts does not desire to experience the great enjoyments that will result from giving, thinking, May I experience the results of giving. The meaning is that he turns his back on the results in every way and does not experience enjoyments at all.

original: longs spyod mang po mchog dang phrad gyur na //
analyzed: longs spyod mang po mchog dang phrad gyur na //
translated: Having met with many supreme enjoyments,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: he gives them away, thinking, May all sentient beings enjoy them.

original: de ltar 'bras bu la mos pa med na /
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu la mos pa med na /
translated: Thus, if one has no interest in the result,üîΩeven if one does not desire the result, one will always encounter the vast resources of the bodhisattvas, and by the nature of things, it is not possible for one who has given gifts not to experience great resources.

original: 'bras bu mi 'dod du zin kyang byang chub sems dpa'i rgya chen po dang ldan pa dang / chos nyid kyis ni sbyin pa btang ba dang / longs spyod chen po mi myong du mi rung ba yin pas gang dang gang du skyes par longs spyod mang po rgya chen po rnams dang byang chub sems dpa' @75b rtag tu phrad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras bu mi 'dod du zin kyang byang chub sems dpa'i rgya chen po dang ldan pa dang / chos nyid kyis ni sbyin pa btang ba dang / longs spyod chen po mi myong du mi rung ba yin pas gang dang gang du skyes par longs spyod mang po rgya chen po rnams dang byang chub sems dpa' @75b rtag tu phrad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that wherever one is born, one will encounter vast, abundant resources.

original: de yi bde ba dag ni bdag mi 'dod //üîΩsbyin pa rgyun de yang ni sbyin par 'dod //
analyzed: de yi bde ba dag ni bdag mi 'dod // sbyin pa rgyun de yang ni sbyin par 'dod //
translated: One does not desire their happiness,

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: but one does desire the continuity of giving.

original: de ltar longs spyod rgya chen po dang phrad du zin kyang longs spyod kyi bde ba de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' ni mi 'dod kyi ci zhig 'dod ce na /
analyzed: de ltar longs spyod rgya chen po dang phrad du zin kyang longs spyod kyi bde ba de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' ni mi 'dod kyi ci zhig 'dod ce na /
translated: One does not desire the happiness of those resources, but one does desire the continuity of giving.

original: ji ltar btang ba'i sbyin pa'i 'bras bu'i tshe rabs gzhan du yang sbyin pa rgyun du gtong zhing sbyin pa byed par 'gyur ba tsam 'dod par zad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar btang ba'i sbyin pa'i 'bras bu'i tshe rabs gzhan du yang sbyin pa rgyun du gtong zhing sbyin pa byed par 'gyur ba tsam 'dod par zad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he desires only the result of the giving that he has given, namely, that he will give gifts continuously in other lives and that he will be a giver.

original: gang gi phyir sbyin pa rgyun du byed pa de rgyun du mi 'dod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sbyin pa rgyun du byed pa de rgyun du mi 'dod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Since he is a continuous giver, he does not desire continuity, etc.

original: de ltar longs spyod chen po longs spyod dam pa dang rtag tu phrad kyang longs spyod kyi bde ba la cung zad kyang 'dod pa med kyi /
analyzed: de ltar longs spyod chen po longs spyod dam pa dang rtag tu phrad kyang longs spyod kyi bde ba la cung zad kyang 'dod pa med kyi /
translated: Thus, even though he always encounters great wealth and the best enjoyments, he does not desire the slightest enjoyment for himself.

original: gzhan du na bdag gi sbyin pa yongs su btang ba'i 'bras bu'i 'bras bu tshe rabs gzan du sems can rnams la sbyin par rgyun du gtong ba dang / sbyin pa gtong ba de rgyun mi 'chad par gtong ba tsam du zad do //
analyzed: gzhan du na bdag gi sbyin pa yongs su btang ba'i 'bras bu'i 'bras bu tshe rabs gzan du sems can rnams la sbyin par rgyun du gtong ba dang / sbyin pa gtong ba de rgyun mi 'chad par gtong ba tsam du zad do //
translated: Rather, he desires only the result of the result of his giving, namely, that he will give gifts continuously to sentient beings in other lives and that he will be a giver who gives without interruption.

original: bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba la //üîΩsnying rjes bdag la rtag tu rab lta na //
analyzed: bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba la // snying rjes bdag la rtag tu rab lta na //
translated: In giving away all one has,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: one should always look to oneself with compassion.

original: gzhan snying rje ni sbyin pa la 'di ltar slob ste /
analyzed: gzhan snying rje ni sbyin pa la 'di ltar slob ste /
translated: Compassion is taught generosity as follows.

original: snying rje lag na bdog pa'i dngos po phyi dang nang gi dngos po thams cad gtong ba yang sbyin pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa'i phyir gtong ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: snying rje lag na bdog pa'i dngos po phyi dang nang gi dngos po thams cad gtong ba yang sbyin pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa'i phyir gtong ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Compassion is the giving away of all outer and inner things that are in one's possession. It is not that one gives in order to obtain the results of generosity.

original: sems can la snying rje bas na bdag gi lag na yod pa rnams la chags pa med par gtong ste /üîΩde'ang phyi dang nang gi dngos po 'ba' zhig gtong bar ma zad kyi /
analyzed: sems can la snying rje bas na bdag gi lag na yod pa rnams la chags pa med par gtong ste / de'ang phyi dang nang gi dngos po 'ba' zhig gtong bar ma zad kyi /
translated: One gives without attachment to what is in one's possession because one has compassion for sentient beings.

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod chen po yang sems can la yongs su gtong ngo //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod chen po yang sems can la yongs su gtong ngo //
translated: Moreover, one gives not only outer and inner things but also the results of generosity, one's great wealth.

original: de ltar 'bras bu yang btang na sbyin pa khyod 'bras bu sems can la smin par mi byed par ci'i phyir 'bras bu bdag la rtag tu lta zhing bdag la 'khor la 'bras bu bdag la smin par byed ces sbyin pa'i 'bras bu yang sems can la sbyin
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu yang btang na sbyin pa khyod 'bras bu sems can la smin par mi byed par ci'i phyir 'bras bu bdag la rtag tu lta zhing bdag la 'khor la 'bras bu bdag la smin par byed ces sbyin pa'i 'bras bu yang sems can la sbyin
translated: If one gives away even the results of generosity, why, generosity, do you not bring the results of generosity to fruition for sentient beings? Why do you always look to me for the results? Why do you bring the results of generosity to fruition for me alone?

original: pa'i rigs so zhes 'bras bu don mi gnyer //
analyzed: pa'i rigs so zhes 'bras bu don mi gnyer //
translated: ‚ÄúThe type that does not seek the result.‚ÄùüîΩ

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus, generosity is taught.

original: de bas na sbyin pa khyod kyis snying rje 'di ni sbyin pa'i 'bras bu la chags pa med de /
analyzed: de bas na sbyin pa khyod kyis snying rje 'di ni sbyin pa'i 'bras bu la chags pa med de /
translated: Therefore, O generosity, this compassion of yours is not attached to the result of generosity.

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu la don du mi gnyer bas na snying rje 'bras bu sbyin pa ni mi rigs kyi /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu la don du mi gnyer bas na snying rje 'bras bu sbyin pa ni mi rigs kyi /
translated: Since it does not seek the result of generosity, it is not right that compassion should give its result to generosity.üîΩRather, the result of generosity should be given to sentient beings. Thus, O generosity, you should understand it in this way.

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu yang sems can la sbyin pa'i rigs so zhes sbyin pa khyod kyis de ltar shes par gyis shig ces sbyin pa la slob par byed do //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu yang sems can la sbyin pa'i rigs so zhes sbyin pa khyod kyis de ltar shes par gyis shig ces sbyin pa la slob par byed do //
translated: In this way, he teaches generosity.

original: gang bdag gis snying rjes sbyin pa'i 'bras bu thams cad yongs su gtong bar shes par @76a * //üîΩbya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang bdag gis snying rjes sbyin pa'i 'bras bu thams cad yongs su gtong bar shes par @76a * // bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: One should understand that through compassion, I give up all the results of generosity.

original: snying rjes bdag gi phyi nang gi dngos po thams cad dang de'i 'bras bu sems can la rtag par btang ba yang sems can rnams la snying rje'i sgo nas rtag par gtong bar zad kyi /
analyzed: snying rjes bdag gi phyi nang gi dngos po thams cad dang de'i 'bras bu sems can la rtag par btang ba yang sems can rnams la snying rje'i sgo nas rtag par gtong bar zad kyi /
translated: Through compassion, one always gives up to sentient beings all one‚Äôs outer and inner things and their results. However, one always gives them to sentient beings through compassion.

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu la ni cung zad kyang chags pa med do zhes khyod kyis de ltar shes par gyis shig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu la ni cung zad kyang chags pa med do zhes khyod kyis de ltar shes par gyis shig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: You should understand that there is not the slightest attachment to the results of generosity.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa la rjes su bstan to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa la rjes su bstan to zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva teaches generosity.

original: gong du bshad pa ltar na sbyin pa khyod kyis 'di ltar shes par bya ba'i rigs te /
analyzed: gong du bshad pa ltar na sbyin pa khyod kyis 'di ltar shes par bya ba'i rigs te /
translated: As explained above, generosity, you should understand it in this way.

original: snying rjes 'di ni sbyin pa'i 'bras bu la chags pa med pas /
analyzed: snying rjes 'di ni sbyin pa'i 'bras bu la chags pa med pas /
translated: Out of compassion, you are not attached to the results of generosity.üîΩIt is not right for you to give the results to others, but it is right for the sentient beings to experience the results of that.üîΩThus, generosity, you should understand it in this way.

original: 'di la 'bras bu sbyin par bya ba'i mi rigs kyi de'i 'bras bu sems can rnams kyis myong bar bya ba'i rigs so zhes sbyin pa khyod kyis de ltar shes par gyis shig ces sbyin pa la de ltar ston cing 'doms so //
analyzed: 'di la 'bras bu sbyin par bya ba'i mi rigs kyi de'i 'bras bu sems can rnams kyis myong bar bya ba'i rigs so zhes sbyin pa khyod kyis de ltar shes par gyis shig ces sbyin pa la de ltar ston cing 'doms so //
translated: Thus, generosity is taught and instructed in this way.

original: khyod kyis 'bras bu thob pa ma spangs na //
analyzed: khyod kyis 'bras bu thob pa ma spangs na //
translated: If you do not give up the attainment of results,

original: sbyin pa la ni mngon par mos ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sbyin pa la ni mngon par mos ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: you are not devoted to generosity.

analyzed: gal te ngas sbyin pa'i dngos po ni btang gi sbyin pa khyod kyis 'bras bu longs spyod chen po thob pa de bdag gis ma spangs te ma btang na /

analyzed: de ltar na ni snying rje 'di sbyin pa gtong ba la ma mos pa yin no zhes sbyin pa khyod kyis de ltar rig par bya ba'i rigs so // ji ltar skad cig tsam yang sbyin med par //
translated: then compassion would not be devoted to giving generosity. It is right for you, generosity, to understand it in this way.üîΩHow could I not delight in giving

analyzed: sbyin pa la ni mngon par dga' ma yin // zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: de'i 'bras bu mi gtong ba de lta bu'i sbyin pa la yang bdag dga' ba ma yin la /

analyzed: bdag ni sbyin pa mi gtong zhing sbyin pa byed pa med par skad cig tsam yang gnas par mi dga' zhing ma mos pa yin te /
translated: I do not delight in remaining for even a moment without giving, without being generous.

original: de bas na 'bras bu thob pa rnams kyang gtong ba dang sbyar na snying rje sbyin pa gtong ba la mngon par dga' ba yin no zhes khyod kyis de ltar shes par gyis shig ces ston to//
analyzed: de bas na 'bras bu thob pa rnams kyang gtong ba dang sbyar na snying rje sbyin pa gtong ba la mngon par dga' ba yin no zhes khyod kyis de ltar shes par gyis shig ces ston to//
translated: Thus, you should understand that compassion is the one who delights in giving gifts.üîΩThe verse says,

analyzed: ma byas 'bras bur mi 'gyur bas // de ltar lan re yong bas nga mi mtshungs //
translated: ‚ÄúThe result of not giving does not occur.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du yang snying rjes ni sbyin pa la 'di ltar slob par byed de /
translated: In another way, compassion teaches giving like this:

analyzed: sbyin pa khyod ni sbyin pa la byas pa rnams ni 'bras bur mi 'gyur zhing 'bras bu smin par mi byed pas de ltar na khyod ni @76b lan la re ba ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúYou, giving, do not give results to those who have given, and do not ripen results. Thus, you are not one who hopes for a return.

original: snying rjes ni gang byin yang rung ma byin yang rung /
analyzed: snying rjes ni gang byin yang rung ma byin yang rung /
translated: But through compassion, whether one gives or does not give,

original: 'bras bu smin yang rung ma smin yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu smin yang rung ma smin yang rung ste /

analyzed: gang gis byas pa de las 'bras bur smin //
translated: The giver is like the gift, since the result ripens from what is given.

analyzed: de'i phyir khyod lan re bas nga mi mtshungs // zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: nga ni sbyin pa ma byas pa la yang 'bras bu sgrub par byed de /

analyzed: byas pa dang ma byas pa kun la phan 'dogs pa la lan re ba med pa'i phyir khyod dang mi mtshungs so zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: de lta bu'i sbyin pa btang ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa gnyis rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //

translated: generosity that is free of reproach, generosity that is a pure state, generosity that is helpful, generosity that is protective, generosity that is free of expectation of a reward, and generosity that is free of any attachment.

analyzed: de la kha na ma tho ba med pa ni /

analyzed: sdug bsngal bskyed de sbyin par byed pa ni kha na ma tho ba zhes bya ste /

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩdug dang mtshon cha la @77a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / dug dang mtshon cha la @77a * //

analyzed: sogs pa ma brtags pa'i dngos po mi gtong gi dngos po gtsang ma sbyin par byed kyi /

analyzed: sbyin pas sems can rnams bsrungs nas //

analyzed: tshe phyi mar lha dang mi'i 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i phyir dge ba byed du bcug pa ni phan par byed pa'i sbyin pa zhes bya'o //

translated: ‚ÄúGiving with protection‚Äù is giving to others without harming the welfare of one‚Äôs retinue.

analyzed: bsrung bar bcas pa'i sbyin pa ni sbyin pa gtong ba de yang thams cad btod nas cung zad kyang med par byas te /

translated: One does not give away one's children, wife, servants, etc. in such a way that one's retinue is harmed. One gives in such a way that one's retinue is not harmed, and one sets aside a little for later.üîΩOr, giving with protection means that the bodhisattva does not give away his children, wife, servants, etc. to yakshas, rakshasas, etc. who harm sentient beings.

translated: Otherwise means

analyzed: thams cad rgyas dang gtso bo dang // zhes bya ba la /

translated: Giving both external and internal is
