translated: It is called ‚Äúgiving of pure things‚Äù because one does not give things that are harmful, such as poison, weapons, and intoxicants.

original: sbyin pa byas pa rnams 'jig rten gyi lha'am mi'am nyan thos kyi mya ngan las 'das par bya ba'i phyir mi bsngo'i bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir bsngo bas na byang chub tu bsngo ba gtong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa byas pa rnams 'jig rten gyi lha'am mi'am nyan thos kyi mya ngan las 'das par bya ba'i phyir mi bsngo'i bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir bsngo bas na byang chub tu bsngo ba gtong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The giving of dedication is the dedication of the giving to the attainment of supreme enlightenment, not to the mundane gods, or to the nirvana of the disciples.

original: dge ba la bsngo ba'i don ni gong du phan par byed pa'i sbyin pa bshad pa dang don gcig ste /üîΩsbyin pas bsdus @78a * //
analyzed: dge ba la bsngo ba'i don ni gong du phan par byed pa'i sbyin pa bshad pa dang don gcig ste / sbyin pas bsdus @78a * //
translated: The giving of virtue is the same as the giving of benefit explained above.üîΩHaving attracted beings by giving, one establishes them in virtue.

original: nas dge ba la bkod ba ni dge ba la bsngo ba'i gtong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nas dge ba la bkod ba ni dge ba la bsngo ba'i gtong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is the giving of virtue.

original: spyad par bya ba'i khyad par gyi tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: spyad par bya ba'i khyad par gyi tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: One verse on the distinction of practice.

original: 'jig rten pa dag sbyin pa byas nas longs spyod dag myong bar 'gyur ba dang / 'phags pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag sbyin pa btang nas zag pa med pa'i bde ba myong ba yod mod kyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dag sbyin pa byas nas longs spyod dag myong bar 'gyur ba dang / 'phags pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag sbyin pa btang nas zag pa med pa'i bde ba myong ba yod mod kyi /
translated: There is the practice of giving in the world, which is the experience of enjoyments after giving; and there is the practice of giving of the noble disciples and hermit buddhas, which is the experience of the bliss of the uncontaminated.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams su thugs rje dang ldan pa'i thugs kyis sbyin pa btang ba'i 'bras bu de dag pas longs spyod khyad par can 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩji ltar bde ba gsum gyis tshim pa'i yid //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams su thugs rje dang ldan pa'i thugs kyis sbyin pa btang ba'i 'bras bu de dag pas longs spyod khyad par can 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to // ji ltar bde ba gsum gyis tshim pa'i yid //
translated: The verse is:

original: snying rje can gyi gtong ba dag rnyed ltar //
analyzed: snying rje can gyi gtong ba dag rnyed ltar //
translated: Just as the compassionate one, with a mind satisfied by the three kinds of satisfaction,üîΩfinds delight in giving,

original: longs spyod can dag longs spyod dag gis ni //
analyzed: longs spyod can dag longs spyod dag gis ni //
translated: so the enjoyments of those who enjoy giving

original: de ltar dga' bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar dga' bar 'gyur ba ma yin no // zhes bya ba la /
translated: are not a source of satisfaction.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa gtong ba na bde ba gsum gyis yid tshim par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa gtong ba na bde ba gsum gyis yid tshim par 'gyur te /
translated: When the bodhisattva gives a gift, his mind is satisfied by the three kinds of satisfaction.

original: bde ba gsum ni sbyin na dga' ba'i bde ba dang / pha rol la phan btags pa'i dga' ba'i bde ba dang / byang chub kyi tshogs rdzogs pas dga' ba'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba gsum ni sbyin na dga' ba'i bde ba dang / pha rol la phan btags pa'i dga' ba'i bde ba dang / byang chub kyi tshogs rdzogs pas dga' ba'i bde ba'o //
translated: The three kinds of satisfaction are: the satisfaction of delight in giving; the satisfaction of delight in helping others; and the satisfaction of delight in completing the requisites for enlightenment.

original: de ltar bde ba gsum gyis tshim pa'i yid dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' snying rje dang lnga pas sems can la sbyin pa yongs su btang nas btang ba'i 'og tu sems can la phan thogs par ma thong ste /
analyzed: de ltar bde ba gsum gyis tshim pa'i yid dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' snying rje dang lnga pas sems can la sbyin pa yongs su btang nas btang ba'i 'og tu sems can la phan thogs par ma thong ste /
translated: After giving, he does not see that he has benefited sentient beings.

original: sems dga' ba dang bde ba rnyed pa ltar /
analyzed: sems dga' ba dang bde ba rnyed pa ltar /
translated: Just as he finds joy and happiness in giving,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la phyi nang gi dngos po kun btang ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la phyi nang gi dngos po kun btang ste /
translated: the bodhisattva gives everything, outer and inner things, to sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams longs spyod dang ldan par byas pa'i sems can longs spyod can de dag de tsam gyis dga' ba dang bde ba mi skye'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can rnams longs spyod dang ldan par byas pa'i sems can longs spyod can de dag de tsam gyis dga' ba dang bde ba mi skye'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But those sentient beings who have been made to possess resources do not experience that much joy and happiness.

original: yang na byang chub sems dpa' snying rje can rnams gzhan la sbyin pa yongs su btang nas sems can la phan thogs par mthong ste dga' ba'i khyad par skyes pa ste /
analyzed: yang na byang chub sems dpa' snying rje can rnams gzhan la sbyin pa yongs su btang nas sems can la phan thogs par mthong ste dga' ba'i khyad par skyes pa ste /
translated: Or else, the compassionate bodhisattva gives gifts to others and sees that he has benefited sentient beings, so he generates a special joy.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa yongs su btang ba'i sgo nas longs spyod can du byas pa'i sems can longs spyod can dag de tsam gyi dga' ba mi skye ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa yongs su btang ba'i sgo nas longs spyod can du byas pa'i sems can longs spyod can dag de tsam gyi dga' ba mi skye ste /
translated: The bodhisattva, having given gifts, makes beings prosperous. But those beings who are prosperous do not experience that much joy.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpas sbyin pa yongs su btang nas bde ba rnam pa gsum gyis tshim par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas sbyin pa yongs su btang nas bde ba rnam pa gsum gyis tshim par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because the bodhisattva, having given gifts, is satisfied with three kinds of joy.

original: bde ba rnam pa gsum ni sbyin pas dga' ba dang / pha rol la phan btags pas dga' ba dang / byang chub @78b kyi tshogs rdzogs pas dga' ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba rnam pa gsum ni sbyin pas dga' ba dang / pha rol la phan btags pas dga' ba dang / byang chub @78b kyi tshogs rdzogs pas dga' ba'o //
translated: The three kinds of joy are: the joy of giving, the joy of helping others, and the joy of completing the requisites for enlightenment.

original: sbyin pas dga' ba dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sbyin pas dga' ba dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The joy of giving.

original: sbyin pa gtong ba na slong ba rnams tshogs shing 'dus pa mthong nas dang por dga' ba ni sbyin pas dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa gtong ba na slong ba rnams tshogs shing 'dus pa mthong nas dang por dga' ba ni sbyin pas dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When one gives gifts, seeing the beggars gathered together, one is joyful at first. This is called the joy of giving.

original: pha rol la phan btags pas dga' ba dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: pha rol la phan btags pas dga' ba dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The joy of helping others.

original: slong ba 'dus pa'i 'og tu zang zing rnams gzhan la byin nas /
analyzed: slong ba 'dus pa'i 'og tu zang zing rnams gzhan la byin nas /
translated: After the beggars have gathered, one gives away the material goods to others.

original: des sems can la phan thogs par mthong ste dga' ba ni /
analyzed: des sems can la phan thogs par mthong ste dga' ba ni /
translated: The joy in seeing that one has benefited sentient beings is

original: phan btags pas dga' ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: phan btags pas dga' ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: the joy in benefiting others.

original: bar du dga' ba'o //
analyzed: bar du dga' ba'o //
translated: This is the intermediate joy.

original: byang chub kyi tshogs rdzogs pas dga' ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub kyi tshogs rdzogs pas dga' ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The joy in completing the stores for enlightenment isüîΩthe joy in completing the stores for enlightenment.

original: dngos po btang ste dga' ba la gzhan la phan thogs pa'i rgyus bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs par mthong nas dga' ba ni byang chub kyi tshogs rdzogs pas dga' ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dngos po btang ste dga' ba la gzhan la phan thogs pa'i rgyus bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs par mthong nas dga' ba ni byang chub kyi tshogs rdzogs pas dga' ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The joy in giving is the joy in seeing that the stores of merit and knowledge are completed through the cause of benefiting others.

original: 'di ni tha mar dga' ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tha mar dga' ba'o //
translated: This is the final joy.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams mngon par sgrub pa la snying brtse ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams mngon par sgrub pa la snying brtse ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: One verse on compassion in accomplishing the transcendences.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa la gnas pa rnams la thugs brtse nas //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa la gnas pa rnams la thugs brtse nas //
translated: Having compassion for those who stand in the resistances to the six transcendences,

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa byed du bcug pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams mngon par sgrub pa la snying brtse ba zhes bya ste //üîΩde bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa byed du bcug pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams mngon par sgrub pa la snying brtse ba zhes bya ste // de bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: The compassion of the bodhisattva is the urging of others to give and so forth. It is called compassion because it establishes others in the perfections.üîΩIn order to demonstrate that, he says: the verse is composed.

original: tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is composed.

original: ser snas snying rje ma rungs snying rje dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ser snas snying rje ma rungs snying rje dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Stinginess is the fault of compassion, and compassion is the fault of stinginess.

original: ser sna ni phyi dang nang gi dngos po gtong bar mi nus shing zang zing mi dgos pa dag sdud par byed pa ste /
analyzed: ser sna ni phyi dang nang gi dngos po gtong bar mi nus shing zang zing mi dgos pa dag sdud par byed pa ste /
translated: Stinginess is the inability to give up external and internal things, and the gathering of things that are not needed.

original: de dag la byang chub sems dpa' thugs brtse nas /
analyzed: de dag la byang chub sems dpa' thugs brtse nas /
translated: The bodhisattva, having compassion for those who are stingy,

original: ser sna'i skyon dag brjod cing sbyin pa'i chos la 'jog par mdzad do //
analyzed: ser sna'i skyon dag brjod cing sbyin pa'i chos la 'jog par mdzad do //
translated: speaks of the faults of stinginess and establishes them in the Dharma of giving.

original: ma rungs pa ni ngan pa'i ngang tshul can te srog gcod pa dang ma byin par len pa byed pa'i sgo nas sems can la gnod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ma rungs pa ni ngan pa'i ngang tshul can te srog gcod pa dang ma byin par len pa byed pa'i sgo nas sems can la gnod par byed pa'o //
translated: Badness is a bad disposition, and is the harm done to sentient beings by means of killing and stealing.

original: de dag la byang chub sems dpa' thugs brtse nas tshul khrims ngan pa'i skyon dag brjod nas tshul khrims la 'jog par mdzad do //
analyzed: de dag la byang chub sems dpa' thugs brtse nas tshul khrims ngan pa'i skyon dag brjod nas tshul khrims la 'jog par mdzad do //
translated: The Bodhisattva, out of compassion, having pointed out the faults of immorality, establishes them in morality.

original: 'khrug pa bag med snying rje dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'khrug pa bag med snying rje dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: (1) agitation, (2) heedlessness, (3) compassion,

original: zhe sdang gi sems 'tshig par byas pa ni 'khrug pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi sems 'tshig par byas pa ni 'khrug pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Agitation is the burning up of the mind by the thought of hatred.

original: de dag la byang chub sems dpa' thugs brtse nas zhe sdang gi skyon dag smos shing bzod pa la 'jog par mdzad do //üîΩbag med pa ni nyal ba dang 'phres pa la sogs pa'i las la dga' bas le lo'i dbang gis @79a * //
analyzed: de dag la byang chub sems dpa' thugs brtse nas zhe sdang gi skyon dag smos shing bzod pa la 'jog par mdzad do // bag med pa ni nyal ba dang 'phres pa la sogs pa'i las la dga' bas le lo'i dbang gis @79a * //
translated: The Bodhisattva, out of compassion, having pointed out the faults of hatred, establishes them in patience.

original: dge ba'i las mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i las mi byed pa ste /
translated: Heedlessness is the delight in the activities of sleeping, lying down, etc., and the non-performance of good actions through the power of laziness.

original: de dag la byang chub sems dpa' thugs brtse nas le lo'i skyon dag brjod cing brtson 'grus la 'god par mdzad do //
analyzed: de dag la byang chub sems dpa' thugs brtse nas le lo'i skyon dag brjod cing brtson 'grus la 'god par mdzad do //
translated: The Bodhisattva, out of compassion, having pointed out the faults of laziness, establishes them in effort.

original: yul gyi dbang du song la snying rje dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yul gyi dbang du song la snying rje dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Compassion for those who are under the sway of objects,

original: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la sems g-yengs pa ni yul gyi dbang du song ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la sems g-yengs pa ni yul gyi dbang du song ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The mind distracted by the five sense objects such as form and sound is said to be under the control of objects.

original: de dag la byang chub sems dpa' thugs brtse nas sems g-yengs pa'i skyon dag brjod cing bsam gtan la 'jog par mdzad do //
analyzed: de dag la byang chub sems dpa' thugs brtse nas sems g-yengs pa'i skyon dag brjod cing bsam gtan la 'jog par mdzad do //
translated: The Bodhisattva, out of compassion, speaks of the faults of distraction and sets them in meditative concentration.

original: log par mngon par zhen la snying rje'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: log par mngon par zhen la snying rje'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Compassion for those who are wrongly attached.

original: log par mngon par zhen pa ni bdag rtag pa la sogs par 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: log par mngon par zhen pa ni bdag rtag pa la sogs par 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Wrong attachment is the grasping of the self as permanent, etc.

original: mu stegs pa la sogs pa'i log pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa rnams so //
analyzed: mu stegs pa la sogs pa'i log pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa rnams so //
translated: It is the possession of wrong wisdom by the tirthikas, etc.

original: de dag la byang chub sems dpa' thugs brtse nas log pa'i shes rab kyi skyon dag brjod cing yang dag pa'i shes rab la 'jog par mdzad do //
analyzed: de dag la byang chub sems dpa' thugs brtse nas log pa'i shes rab kyi skyon dag brjod cing yang dag pa'i shes rab la 'jog par mdzad do //
translated: The Bodhisattva, out of compassion, speaks of the faults of wrong wisdom and sets them in right wisdom.

original: 'di dag ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'di dag ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: These are the resistances to the perfections, etc.

original: ser sna nas log par lam mngon par zhen pa rnams ni sbyin pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: ser sna nas log par lam mngon par zhen pa rnams ni sbyin pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs te /
translated: From stinginess up to the false view of the body, these are the resistances to the transcendences, from generosity to wisdom.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnas pa'i sems can de dag la byang chub sems dpa' snying brtse ba ni snying rje zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnas pa'i sems can de dag la byang chub sems dpa' snying brtse ba ni snying rje zhes bya'o //
translated: The compassion of the bodhisattva for those beings who are established in the resistances is called compassion.

original: de'ang de dag gi mi mthun par phyogs rnam par sun 'byin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de'ang de dag gi mi mthun par phyogs rnam par sun 'byin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Moreover, the verse says that the resistances are to be rejected.

original: ser sna la sogs pa de dag kyang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te /
analyzed: ser sna la sogs pa de dag kyang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te /
translated: Stinginess and so on are resistances to generosity and so on.

original: snying rjes ser sna la sogs pa'i skyon brjod cing sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa byed du bcug pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams mngon par sgrub pa la snying brtse ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: snying rjes ser sna la sogs pa'i skyon brjod cing sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa byed du bcug pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams mngon par sgrub pa la snying brtse ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The compassion that reproves the faults of stinginess and so on and induces the practice of generosity and so on is called compassion in the accomplishment of the transcendences.

original: snying rje'i rkyen bstan pa'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snying rje'i rkyen bstan pa'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: A verse on the teaching of the conditions of compassion.

original: 'di ltar mig la sogs pa rnam par shes pa rnams dmigs pa dang / rgyu dang bdag po dang / de ma thag pa'i rkyen las skye ba bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje yang dmigs pa dang rgyu dang bdag po dad de ma thag pa ste rkyen bzhi las skye ba bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ltar mig la sogs pa rnam par shes pa rnams dmigs pa dang / rgyu dang bdag po dang / de ma thag pa'i rkyen las skye ba bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje yang dmigs pa dang rgyu dang bdag po dad de ma thag pa ste rkyen bzhi las skye ba bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, just as the eye consciousnesses, etc. arise from the objective condition, the causal condition, the dominant condition, and the immediate condition, so also the compassion of the bodhisattva arises from four conditions: the objective condition, the causal condition, the dominant condition, and the immediate condition. The verse is composed in order to demonstrate this.

original: bde dang mi bde'i rgyu las byung //
analyzed: bde dang mi bde'i rgyu las byung //
translated: The cause of happiness and unhappiness.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje ste //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje ste //
translated: The compassion of the bodhisattva

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: arises from the cause of happiness and unhappiness.

original: tshigs su @79b bcad pa phyed kyis snying rje'i dmigs pa'i rkyen bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs su @79b bcad pa phyed kyis snying rje'i dmigs pa'i rkyen bstan to //
translated: In the first half of the verse, the objective condition of compassion is taught.

original: de la snying rje'i dmigs par bya ba'i yul ni tshor ba bde ba dang tshor ba sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de la snying rje'i dmigs par bya ba'i yul ni tshor ba bde ba dang tshor ba sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa la bya'o //
translated: Therein, the object of compassion is the experience of happiness, the experience of unhappiness, and the experience of neither unhappiness nor happiness.

original: rgyu dang bshes gnyen rang bzhin las //
analyzed: rgyu dang bshes gnyen rang bzhin las //
translated: From the cause, the spiritual friend, and nature.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is the compassion of the bodhisattva.

original: tshe rabs gzhan du snying rje la goms par byas pas kun gzhi la snying brtse ba'i bag chags bsags pa ni snying rje'i rgyu'i rkyen to //üîΩdge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten nas /üîΩdam pa'i chos nyan pa'i dbang gis snying rje skye ste /
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan du snying rje la goms par byas pas kun gzhi la snying brtse ba'i bag chags bsags pa ni snying rje'i rgyu'i rkyen to // dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten nas / dam pa'i chos nyan pa'i dbang gis snying rje skye ste /
translated: Here, the cause of compassion is the condition of the habitual tendency of compassion that is stored in the store-consciousness through the practice of compassion in other lives.

original: de ni bdag po'i rkyen te /üîΩsnying rje dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba snga ma 'gags /üîΩde dang rang bzhin gcig la snying rje dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba phyi ma 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ni bdag po'i rkyen te / snying rje dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba snga ma 'gags / de dang rang bzhin gcig la snying rje dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba phyi ma 'byung ste /
translated: The dominant condition is the arising of compassion through the power of listening to the holy Dharma in dependence on a spiritual friend.

original: snga ma 'gags pa ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen to //üîΩtshor ba rnam pa gsum la dmigs nas sdug bsngal gsum gyis snying rje bar byed do /
analyzed: snga ma 'gags pa ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen to // tshor ba rnam pa gsum la dmigs nas sdug bsngal gsum gyis snying rje bar byed do /
translated: The immediate condition is the cessation of the former moment of mind and mental factors endowed with compassion, and the arising of the subsequent moment of mind and mental factors endowed with compassion, which have the same nature.üîΩThe objective condition is the three kinds of feelings, which are the objects of compassion.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The three kinds of feelings are the objects of the three kinds of compassion.

original: byang chub sems dpa' tshor ba bde ba dang / tshor ba sdug bsngal ba dang / tshor ba bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa la dmigs nas snying rje skye ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' tshor ba bde ba dang / tshor ba sdug bsngal ba dang / tshor ba bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa la dmigs nas snying rje skye ste /
translated: Bodhisattvas generate compassion by observing the three kinds of feelings: pleasant, unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: tshor ba gsum la sdug bsngal rnams kyis khyab par gzigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba gsum la sdug bsngal rnams kyis khyab par gzigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they see that the three kinds of feelings are pervaded by the three kinds of suffering.

original: de la tshor ba bde ba la ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyis khyab par dmigs so //
analyzed: de la tshor ba bde ba la ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyis khyab par dmigs so //
translated: They observe that pleasant feelings are pervaded by the suffering of change.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gyis khyab par dmigs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gyis khyab par dmigs so //
translated: They observe that unpleasant feelings are pervaded by the suffering of suffering.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin ba'i tshor ba la ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyis khyab par dmigs so //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin ba'i tshor ba la ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyis khyab par dmigs so //
translated: They observe that feelings that are neither pleasant nor unpleasant are pervaded by the suffering of conditioned existence.

original: sdug bsngal dang bde ba'i tshor ba'i rgyu ni bde ba dang mi bde ba ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bde ba'i tshor ba'i rgyu ni bde ba dang mi bde ba ste /
translated: The causes of pleasant and unpleasant feelings are pleasure and pain,

original: phyir zhing de bskyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyir zhing de bskyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: because they generate those feelings again and again.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba bskyed pa'i rgyu dang / bde ba'i tshor ba bskyed pa'i rgyu ni bde ba'i tshor ba'i bag la nyal dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i bag la nyal ba la bya ste don du bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba bag chags kyi rang bzhin la de'i rgyu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba bskyed pa'i rgyu dang / bde ba'i tshor ba bskyed pa'i rgyu ni bde ba'i tshor ba'i bag la nyal dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i bag la nyal ba la bya ste don du bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba bag chags kyi rang bzhin la de'i rgyu zhes bya ste /
translated: The cause of the feeling of pain and the cause of the feeling of pleasure are the latent impressions of the feeling of pleasure and the latent impressions of the feeling of pain. In reality, the cause is the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain, which is of the nature of latent impressions.

original: ci'i phyir bag la nyal la rgyu zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bag la nyal la rgyu zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are latent impressions called causes?

original: 'di ltar bag chags de las tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal gnyis yang nas yang du 'byung zhing skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar bag chags de las tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal gnyis yang nas yang du 'byung zhing skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because from those latent impressions, the two feelings of pleasure and pain arise again and again.

original: snying rje chen po'i rang @80a * //üîΩbzhin gyi tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i rang @80a * //üîΩbzhin gyi tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /

translated: The compassion of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and so on, although it exists, is the compassion that arises for suffering sentient beings but does not arise for happy sentient beings, and therefore it is not great compassion.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i lha rnams la yang snying rje bas na snying rje chen po'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i lha rnams la yang snying rje bas na snying rje chen po'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ste /
translated: However, since bodhisattvas see all feelings as suffering, they have great compassion, because they have compassion for the gods of the peak of existence in the same way that they have compassion for the beings of the Avƒ´ci hell.

analyzed: de bstan par bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //

translated: How so?üîΩWhatever feelings they experience, whether the feeling of pleasure, the feeling of pain, or the feeling that is neither of those, he knows that all feelings are suffering.

translated: Thus, with compassion for those in the hells,

translated: Compassion is equal through equal practice, because it acts as a refuge for beings at the peak of existence just as it does for beings in the hells.

original: 'dod chags dang bral bas snying rje mnyam pa ni snying rje'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhe sdang dang sems can la brdeg brtsog la sogs pa 'tshe ba byed pa spangs pa'i phyir su la yang zhe sdang ba med /

translated: Compassion is equal through freedom from attachment, because it is free from hatred, the opposite of compassion, and from harming sentient beings through beating and binding, etc.

original: gang la yang byams par byed pa yang med de kun la snyoms par lta ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la yang byams par byed pa yang med de kun la snyoms par lta ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also free from love, because it views all equally.

original: mi dmigs pas snying rje mnyam pa ni sems can dang bdag dang snying rje gsum char yang stong pa nyid du ro gcig par khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pas snying rje mnyam pa ni sems can dang bdag dang snying rje gsum char yang stong pa nyid du ro gcig par khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Compassion is equal through the absence of perceptions, because it comprehends that the three‚Äîsentient beings, oneself, and compassion‚Äîare of one taste in emptiness.

original: rnam par dag pa thob pas snying rje mnyam pa ni sa brgyad pa la byang chub sems dpa' rnams mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pas rtsol ba dang 'bad pa med par snying rje lhun gyis grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa thob pas snying rje mnyam pa ni sa brgyad pa la byang chub sems dpa' rnams mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pas rtsol ba dang 'bad pa med par snying rje lhun gyis grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Compassion that is equal through obtaining purity is on the eighth level, because bodhisattvas obtain patient acceptance of the fact that phenomena are not produced and their compassion is spontaneous, without effort or exertion.

original: de la gzugs kyi khams kyi lha rnams kyang byams pa la sogs pa ni tshad med pa bzhi bsgoms te nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas tshad med pa bsgom mod kyi /
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi khams kyi lha rnams kyang byams pa la sogs pa ni tshad med pa bzhi bsgoms te nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas tshad med pa bsgom mod kyi /
translated: The gods of the world of form cultivate the four boundless attitudes of love and so on, but they do not cultivate them to the same extent as the disciples and hermit buddhas.üîΩIn order to show that the bodhisattvas' cultivation of the four boundless attitudes is superior to that of the disciples and hermit buddhas, a single verse is stated:üîΩThe bodhisattvas' boundless attitudes are superior

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams tshad med pa bzhi bsgom pa mchog tu 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir rang gi sems dang chos la mos dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig smos te /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams tshad med pa bzhi bsgom pa mchog tu 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir rang gi sems dang chos la mos dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig smos te /
translated: Through their basis, their objects, their aspects,üîΩTheir full extent, their categories, their virtuesüîΩAnd their result, which should be understood.

original: tshe rabs snga ma la byams pa bsgoms pa'i bag chags sems la brlan pa'i sems de nyid la brten nas tshe 'di la byams pa la sogs pa bsgoms na bsgom pa de mchog tu gzhag go //
analyzed: tshe rabs snga ma la byams pa bsgoms pa'i bag chags sems la brlan pa'i sems de nyid la brten nas tshe 'di la byams pa la sogs pa bsgoms na bsgom pa de mchog tu gzhag go //
translated: That meditation is supreme when, on the basis of the mind itself, moistened by the instinct for cultivating love in previous lives, one cultivates love, etc. in the present life.

original: tshad med pa bzhi dang yang dag par ldan pa'i mdo sde rnams la mos shing dad na byams pa la sogs pa bsgom pa mchog tu gzhag go //
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi dang yang dag par ldan pa'i mdo sde rnams la mos shing dad na byams pa la sogs pa bsgom pa mchog tu gzhag go //
translated: That meditation is supreme when one has faith and conviction in the Sutras endowed with the four immeasurables.

original: bsam pa dang ni rnam par 'byor ba las //
analyzed: bsam pa dang ni rnam par 'byor ba las //
translated: From the point of view of intention and mastery.

original: zhes bya ba la ro myang ba dang rjes su yi rang ba dang mngon par dga' ba la sogs pa'i bsam pa rnam pa dgu dang ldan pa yang byams pa la sogs pa bsgom pa mchog tu gzhag go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la ro myang ba dang rjes su yi rang ba dang mngon par dga' ba la sogs pa'i bsam pa rnam pa dgu dang ldan pa yang byams pa la sogs pa bsgom pa mchog tu gzhag go //
translated: That meditation is supreme when it is endowed with the nine intentions, such as savoring, rejoicing, and delighting.

original: sa brgyad pa la sogs pa'i dus na rtsol ba dang 'bad pa med par byams pa la sogs pa lhun gyis grub par 'byung ba ni rnam par 'byor ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la sogs pa'i dus na rtsol ba dang 'bad pa med par byams pa la sogs pa lhun gyis grub par 'byung ba ni rnam par 'byor ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: When, on the eighth stage, etc., love, etc. occur spontaneously without effort or exertion, that is called mastery.

original: de lta bur gnas pa yang bsgom pa mchog tu gzhag go //
analyzed: de lta bur gnas pa yang bsgom pa mchog tu gzhag go //
translated: Such abiding is also posited as the highest meditation.

original: rnam par mi rtog dang gcig gnyis las zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog dang gcig gnyis las zhes bya ba la /
translated: Nonconceptuality, one, and two is said.

original: bdag dang sems can dang tshad med pa rnams rnam par mi rtog par bsgom pa yang byams pa la sogs pa bsgom pa mchog tu gzhag go //
analyzed: bdag dang sems can dang tshad med pa rnams rnam par mi rtog par bsgom pa yang byams pa la sogs pa bsgom pa mchog tu gzhag go //
translated: Nonconceptually meditating on self, sentient beings, and the immeasurables is also posited as the highest meditation on love and so on.

original: sa brgyad pa'i @81a * //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa'i @81a * //
translated: On the eighth ground,

original: dus na byang chub sems dpa' rnams bya ba 'dres pa dang / nye bar 'dres par gyur bas byang chub sems dpa' gcig gis tshad med pa bsgom na byang chub sems dpa' rnams gzhan gyis kyang bsgoms pa yin te /

translated: the bodhisattvas are mixed with activity and thoroughly mixed with activity. When one bodhisattva meditates on the immeasurables, the other bodhisattvas also meditate on them.

original: bya ba gcig tu gyur ba yang byams pa la sogs pa bsgom pa mchog tu gzhag go //
analyzed: bya ba gcig tu gyur ba yang byams pa la sogs pa bsgom pa mchog tu gzhag go //
translated: This is also posited as the highest meditation on love and so on.

original: de ni sangs rgyas la mchod pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa dang / tshad med pa bsgom pa rnams kyi don gong du bshad pa gzung sla bar bya ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis mdor bsdus te bstan pa /
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas la mchod pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa dang / tshad med pa bsgom pa rnams kyi don gong du bshad pa gzung sla bar bya ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis mdor bsdus te bstan pa /
translated: In order to make it easy to remember the meaning of the above explanations of making offerings to the Buddhas, relying on spiritual friends, and cultivating the immeasurables, he summarizes them in one verse:

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la dad pa rab bskyed dang // dngos po chen por rtag tu gus mchod par //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //

original: de la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la /
translated: Among them, having understood that the Blessed Buddhas

translated: have qualities such as being Thus-Gone, Foe-Destroyer, and Perfectly Enlightened, one should generate faith and, with great things, always make offerings with respect. It should be connected as one will attain all accomplishments.

analyzed: de la chos gos dang lhung bzed dang phyag 'tshal ba dang bskor ba la sogs pas mchod pa ni dngos po chen pos rtag tu mchod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Worship with robes, alms-bowls, prostrations, circumambulations, etc. is called ‚Äúconstant worship with great things.‚Äù

original: de ni rnyed pa dang bkur stis mchod pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rnyed pa dang bkur stis mchod pa'o //
translated: This is worship with gain and honor.

analyzed: nyan pa dang sems pa dang sgom pas mchod pa ni gus pas mchod pa zhes bya ste /

analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa khyed kyis sangs rgyas la mchod pa'i don mdor bstan to //
translated: Thus, you have stated in verse the meaning of worship of the Buddha in brief.

original: yon tan mang po'i phan bshes rtag bsnyen na //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yon tan mang po'i phan bshes rtag bsnyen na // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Always attend the spiritual friend who has many good qualities.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen na zhes bya ba la yon tan gong du bshad pa dang ldan pa dang / de las gzhan yang mdo sde dang gtsug lag dag gi nang nas 'byung ba'i yon tan mang po dang ldan par bdag la tshe 'dir yang phan par byed /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen na zhes bya ba la yon tan gong du bshad pa dang ldan pa dang / de las gzhan yang mdo sde dang gtsug lag dag gi nang nas 'byung ba'i yon tan mang po dang ldan par bdag la tshe 'dir yang phan par byed /
translated: The spiritual friend is one who has the good qualities explained above and also many other good qualities that appear in the sutras and the scriptures. He is helpful to you in this life.

original: tshe rabs gzhan du phan par byed pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rtag tu bsnyen na grub pa kun thob ces bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan du phan par byed pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rtag tu bsnyen na grub pa kun thob ces bya bar sbyar te /
translated: If one always attends to the spiritual friend who benefits in other lives, one obtains all perfections.

original: des ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa mdor bstan to //
analyzed: des ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa mdor bstan to //
translated: This briefly teaches the reliance on the spiritual friend.

original: grub pa kun thob 'gro ba snying rje can //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: grub pa kun thob 'gro ba snying rje can // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The compassionate one obtains all perfections for the sake of beings.

original: gzhan yang tshad med pa bzhi byams pa dang / snying rje dang / @81b dga' ba dang / btang snyoms kyi sgo nas sems can la phan btags na grub pa kun thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang tshad med pa bzhi byams pa dang / snying rje dang / @81b dga' ba dang / btang snyoms kyi sgo nas sems can la phan btags na grub pa kun thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if one benefits beings by means of the four immeasurables, loving kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity, one obtains all perfections.

original: grub pa kun ni bdag gi don grub pa dang / gzhan gyi don grub pa dang / de la sangs rgyas la mchod pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pas ni bdag gi don grub pa 'thob po //
analyzed: grub pa kun ni bdag gi don grub pa dang / gzhan gyi don grub pa dang / de la sangs rgyas la mchod pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pas ni bdag gi don grub pa 'thob po //
translated: All perfections are the perfection of one's own aim, the perfection of others' aim, and the perfection of both. Therein, by worshipping the Buddha and relying on the spiritual friend, one obtains the perfection of one's own aim.

original: tshad med pa bsgoms pas ni gzhan gyi don grub pa thob bo //
analyzed: tshad med pa bsgoms pas ni gzhan gyi don grub pa thob bo //
translated: By cultivating the immeasurables, one obtains the perfection of others' aim.

original: go rims dang yon tan bstan to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: go rims dang yon tan bstan to zhes bya ba la /
translated: The order and the qualities are taught.

original: dngos po chen pos sangs rgyas la mchod pa dang dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa dang / tshad med pa bsgoms pas ni go rims bstan to //
analyzed: dngos po chen pos sangs rgyas la mchod pa dang dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa dang / tshad med pa bsgoms pas ni go rims bstan to //
translated: The great things are worship of the Buddhas, reliance on spiritual friends, and meditation on the immeasurables, which are taught in order.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don grub pas ni yon tan bstan to //üîΩdngos po chen pos rtag tu grub par rab tu mchod pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don grub pas ni yon tan bstan to // dngos po chen pos rtag tu grub par rab tu mchod pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The accomplishment of one's own and others' aims teaches the virtues.üîΩWorship is always accomplished by great things means

original: dngos po chen pos rtag tu mchod pa dang / gus pas rtag tu mchod pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: dngos po chen pos rtag tu mchod pa dang / gus pas rtag tu mchod pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: worship is always accomplished by great things and worship is always accomplished with devotion.

original: dngos po chen pos mchod pa ni rnyed pa dang bkur stis mchod pa bstan to //
analyzed: dngos po chen pos mchod pa ni rnyed pa dang bkur stis mchod pa bstan to //
translated: Worship by great things teaches worship by gain and honor.

original: gus pas mchod pa ni grub pas mchod pa bstan to //
analyzed: gus pas mchod pa ni grub pas mchod pa bstan to //
translated: Worship with devotion teaches worship by accomplishment.

original: mchod pa dang / bsten pa dang / tshad med pa'i skabs bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: mchod pa dang / bsten pa dang / tshad med pa'i skabs bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The section on worship, reliance, and the immeasurables is concluded.

original: // / ngo tsha ba rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bcu drug ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / ngo tsha ba rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bcu drug ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Sixteen verses on the analysis of conscience.

original: mchod pa dang bsnyen pa dang tshad med pa'i skabs bshad pa'i 'og tu ngo tsha ba dang brtan pa la sogs pa'i skabs bshad par 'brel ba ci yod ce na /
analyzed: mchod pa dang bsnyen pa dang tshad med pa'i skabs bshad pa'i 'og tu ngo tsha ba dang brtan pa la sogs pa'i skabs bshad par 'brel ba ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the connection between the topics explained in the section on worship, service and the immeasurables and those explained in the section on shame, stability and so on?

original: 'di ltar mchod pa dang bsnyen pas bdag la phan par bya ba'i phyir zhugs /
analyzed: 'di ltar mchod pa dang bsnyen pas bdag la phan par bya ba'i phyir zhugs /
translated: Worship and service are engaged for the sake of benefiting oneself and the immeasurables are engaged for the sake of benefiting others.

original: tshad med pas gzhan la phan par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa des bdag dang gzhan gyi don rdzogs shing mthar phyin par bya ba'i phyir de dang rjes su mthun pa'i lam bsgom dgos pas na tshad med pa la sogs pa'i 'og tu ngo tsha shes pa la sogsüîΩpa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams bshad par 'brel to //
analyzed: tshad med pas gzhan la phan par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa des bdag dang gzhan gyi don rdzogs shing mthar phyin par bya ba'i phyir de dang rjes su mthun pa'i lam bsgom dgos pas na tshad med pa la sogs pa'i 'og tu ngo tsha shes pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams bshad par 'brel to //
translated: Since one must cultivate the path that is compatible with that in order to perfect and complete the benefit of self and other, it is connected that the factors of enlightenment such as shame and so on are explained after the immeasurables.

original: de yang bslab pa'i dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / rang bzhin dang / khyad par rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rjes su mthun pa'i bslab pa'i lam bstan te /
analyzed: de yang bslab pa'i dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / rang bzhin dang / khyad par rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rjes su mthun pa'i bslab pa'i lam bstan te /
translated: Moreover, the path of training that is compatible with the bodhisattvas is taught through the focal object, aspect, nature and distinctions of the training.

original: de la dang po ngo tsha shes pa nas brtsams nas gang zag la bdag med pa'i skabs kyi bar du thams cad kyang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la dang po ngo tsha shes pa nas brtsams nas gang zag la bdag med pa'i skabs kyi bar du thams cad kyang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The first of these, beginning with ‚Äúconscience‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúselflessness of persons,‚Äù should be understood as the factors of enlightenment.

original: ngo tsha log pa'i phyogs spangs dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su @82a * //
analyzed: ngo tsha log pa'i phyogs spangs dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su @82a * //
translated: One verse on the characteristics of conscience and shame.

original: bcad pa gcig gis ngo tsha shes pa'i rang bzhin dang / grogs dang / dmigs pa dang / las phun sum tshogs pa'i sgo nas ngo tsha shes pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: bcad pa gcig gis ngo tsha shes pa'i rang bzhin dang / grogs dang / dmigs pa dang / las phun sum tshogs pa'i sgo nas ngo tsha shes pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: The first verse teaches the characteristics of conscience and shame from the point of view of their nature, their helpers, their objects, and their functions.

original: de la ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni ngo tsha mi shes pa dang khrel med pa ste ;
analyzed: de la ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni ngo tsha mi shes pa dang khrel med pa ste ;

original: de gnyis spangs na ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur bas na 'dis ni rang bzhin bstan to //
analyzed: de gnyis spangs na ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur bas na 'dis ni rang bzhin bstan to //
translated: When these two are abandoned, conscience and shame are present, so this shows their nature.

original: de la ngo tsha shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' bdag la bdag ltos nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa ma yin pa nyan thos la sogs pa'i chos spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i cha ma yin no snyam nas theg pa de dag la
analyzed: de la ngo tsha shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' bdag la bdag ltos nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa ma yin pa nyan thos la sogs pa'i chos spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i cha ma yin no snyam nas theg pa de dag la
translated: The definition of shame is that a bodhisattva, considering himself, thinks, ‚ÄúIt is not proper for a bodhisattva to practice the Dharma of the sravakas, etc., which is not the bodhisattva practice,‚Äù and

original: mi 'jug pa ni ngo tsha shes pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'jug pa ni ngo tsha shes pa'o //
translated: does not engage in those vehicles.

original: khrel yod pa'i mtshan nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' bslab pa ma yin pa nyan thos kyi bslab pa la zhugs na skyes bu dam pa byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag gis kyang smod par 'gyur ro snyam nas nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa la mi 'jug
analyzed: khrel yod pa'i mtshan nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' bslab pa ma yin pa nyan thos kyi bslab pa la zhugs na skyes bu dam pa byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag gis kyang smod par 'gyur ro snyam nas nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa la mi 'jug
translated: The definition of modesty is that a bodhisattva, thinking, ‚ÄúIf I engage in the training of the sravakas, which is not the bodhisattva training, I will be criticized by other holy beings, the bodhisattvas,‚Äù does not engage in the vehicles of the sravakas, etc.

original: pa ni khrel yod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa ni khrel yod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called modesty.

original: rnam par mi rtog ye shes ldan //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ye shes ldan // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Possessing nonconceptual intuition.

original: grogs bstan te /
analyzed: grogs bstan te /
translated: This teaches the friend.

original: de la sems can dang / bdag dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa'i chos rnams yod par ma mthong zhing de de dag la yod par mi dmigs pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la sems can dang / bdag dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa'i chos rnams yod par ma mthong zhing de de dag la yod par mi dmigs pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes zhes bya ste /
translated: The non-perception of sentient beings, the self, and the phenomena of shame and modesty, and the non-apprehension of their existence, is called non-conceptual wisdom.

original: ldan zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa de ye shes dang grogs zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩngan cing sdig pa med pa'i yul //
analyzed: ldan zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa de ye shes dang grogs zhes bya ba'i don to // ngan cing sdig pa med pa'i yul //
translated: The word ‚Äúendowed‚Äù means that the bodhisattva‚Äôs shame and modesty are associated with wisdom, which is the meaning of the word ‚Äúfriend.‚Äù

original: zhes bya bas dmigs pa bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas dmigs pa bstan te /
translated: The object is taught by the words ‚Äúinferior and non-virtuous.‚Äù

original: ngan cing sdig pa med pa'i yul ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la bya ste /
analyzed: ngan cing sdig pa med pa'i yul ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la bya ste /
translated: Inferior and non-virtuous objects refer to the vehicles of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: theg pa chen po la ltos nas bdag gi don tsam byed kyi sems can thams cad kyi don tsam mi byed pas na ngan pa zhes bya la /üîΩkhams gsum du skye ba'i las mi rtsom gyi /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la ltos nas bdag gi don tsam byed kyi sems can thams cad kyi don tsam mi byed pas na ngan pa zhes bya la / khams gsum du skye ba'i las mi rtsom gyi /
translated: Compared to the Great Vehicle, they are called ‚Äúinferior‚Äù because they only accomplish one‚Äôs own welfare and not the welfare of all sentient beings.üîΩThey do not create the karma for being born in the three realms.

original: khams gsum las byung ba'i las rtsom ste ;
analyzed: khams gsum las byung ba'i las rtsom ste ;
translated: They create the karma for leaving the three realms.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pas sdig pa med pa'i yul zhes bya ste /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pas sdig pa med pa'i yul zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called the object without sin because it is without sin, since there is no offense.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa bdag gi don du zhugs pa de byang chub sems dpa' sgrub cing spyad na des ngo tsha shing khrel ba zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa bdag gi don du zhugs pa de byang chub sems dpa' sgrub cing spyad na des ngo tsha shing khrel ba zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas are engaged in their own aim, but when the Bodhisattva practices and trains in their vehicle, that is called shame.üîΩThe teaching of the maturation of beings

original: sems can smin byed bstan pa rnams //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems can smin byed bstan pa rnams // zhes bya ba la /
translated: And the teaching for the sake of ripening beings.üîΩüîΩ

original: ngo tsha ba @82b dang khrel ba des sems can theg pa gsum du bkod nas smin par byed pa de ni las so //
analyzed: ngo tsha ba @82b dang khrel ba des sems can theg pa gsum du bkod nas smin par byed pa de ni las so //
translated: By that shame and abashment, the Bodhisattva establishes beings in the three vehicles and brings them to maturity. That is the action.

original: de ltar na brtan pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa'i mtshan nyid ni de lta bu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar na brtan pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa'i mtshan nyid ni de lta bu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: des byang chub sems dpa' ngo tsha byed do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: des byang chub sems dpa' ngo tsha byed do zhes bya ba la /
translated: By that, the Bodhisattva is ashamed.

original: byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa sgrub na de nyid kyis ngo tsha ba dang khrel bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa sgrub na de nyid kyis ngo tsha ba dang khrel bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: ngo tsha de nyid la gzhan rnams rab tu 'god pa yin no zhes bya ba la /

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i don 'chad de /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i don 'chad de /

original: byang chub sems dpa' ngo tsha bar bya ba'i yul nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa de nyid la sems can 'god par byed pa ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa zhes bya'o //

translated: The bodhisattvas establish sentient beings in that very shame which is the object of shame, the vehicles of the disciples and solitary sages. This is called maturing sentient beings.

original: yang na ngo tsha bar byed pa'i gnas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la sems can mi 'god kyi /
analyzed: yang na ngo tsha bar byed pa'i gnas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la sems can mi 'god kyi /

analyzed: theg pa chen po la sems can rab tu 'god na sems can yongs su smin par byed pa yin no //
translated: But if they establish sentient beings in the Great Vehicle, they mature sentient beings.

original: pha rol phyin drug mi mthun 'phel //
analyzed: pha rol phyin drug mi mthun 'phel //
translated: The six perfections increase their resistance.

original: de yi gnyen po 'grib pa la //
analyzed: de yi gnyen po 'grib pa la //
translated: Its antidote is the decrease of those.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dag ni //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dag ni //
translated: The bodhisattvas

original: mi bzad ngo tsha ba skyed par byed //
analyzed: mi bzad ngo tsha ba skyed par byed //
translated: generate intense shame.

original: ces bya ba 'dis 'phel ba dang 'grib pa la ngo tsha ba bstan to //
analyzed: ces bya ba 'dis 'phel ba dang 'grib pa la ngo tsha ba bstan to //
translated: This shows shame with regard to increase and decrease.

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni ser sna nas 'chal ba'i shes rab kyi bar du ste /
translated: The resistances to the transcendences range from stinginess to false wisdom.

original: de dag 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur ba byang chub sems dpa' shin tu ngo tsha ba skyes te /
analyzed: de dag 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur ba byang chub sems dpa' shin tu ngo tsha ba skyes te /
translated: When they increase and expand, the bodhisattva generates intense shame.

original: des ni 'phel ba la ngo tsha ba'o //
analyzed: des ni 'phel ba la ngo tsha ba'o //
translated: This is shame with regard to increase.

original: ser sna la sogs pa'i gnyen po ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar drug ste /
analyzed: ser sna la sogs pa'i gnyen po ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar drug ste /
translated: The antidotes to stinginess and so on are the six transcendences, from generosity to wisdom.

original: de dag 'gribs shing nyes par 'gyur na byang chub sems dpa' rnams shin tu ngo tsha bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag 'gribs shing nyes par 'gyur na byang chub sems dpa' rnams shin tu ngo tsha bar 'gyur te /
translated: When they decrease and are lost, the bodhisattvas generate intense shame.

original: 'dis ni 'grib pa la ngo tsha ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'grib pa la ngo tsha ba'o //
translated: This is shame with regard to decrease.

original: pha rol phyin pa drug rnams la //
analyzed: pha rol phyin pa drug rnams la //
translated: With regard to the six transcendences,

analyzed: goms par bya phyir le lo dang // nyon mongs chos mthun sbyor ba la ;
translated: For the sake of cultivation, the steadfast feel shame

original: / brtan pa rnams ni ngo tshar byed //
analyzed: / brtan pa rnams ni ngo tshar byed //
translated: at applying themselves to the resistances to the factors of enlightenment.

analyzed: ces bya ba 'dis sbyor ba dang / mi sbyor ba la ngo tsha bar bstan te /
translated: This shows shame at not applying oneself and at applying oneself.

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnams la goms par bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnams la bsgom par bya ba ste / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la ji ltar bsgom par bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa @83a * //
translated: Cultivating the six perfections is meditating on the six perfections.

analyzed: drug bsgom pa rnam par dbye ba'i skabs su bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: How one should meditate on the six perfections is explained in the chapter on the divisions of the cultivation of the six perfections.

analyzed: 'di ltar pha rol tu phyin pa rnams bsgom zhing goms par bya ba la /
translated: Thus, in cultivating and meditating on the perfections,

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams skye ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos mig gi dbang po nas yid kyi dbang po'i bar du dbang po'i sgo mi sdom zhing 'dod pa lnga'i yul la 'jug pa sbyor na byang chub sems dpa' rnamsüîΩngo tsha ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams skye ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos mig gi dbang po nas yid kyi dbang po'i bar du dbang po'i sgo mi sdom zhing 'dod pa lnga'i yul la 'jug pa sbyor na byang chub sems dpa' rnams ngo tsha ba ste /
translated: When bodhisattvas apply themselves to the practice of not guarding the doors of the senses from the eye faculty to the mind faculty, which is compatible with the arising of defilements such as attachment and aversion, and engage in the objects of the five sense pleasures, they are ashamed.

original: 'di ni sbyor ba'i ngo tsha ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sbyor ba'i ngo tsha ba'o //
translated: This is shame in application.üîΩThe nature of the small and great,üîΩthe level of the beginner, the two middling,

original: mnyam par ma bzhag rang bzhin dang // mgo ma'i sa dang 'bring gnyis dang // bsam pa ngan dang nga can dang // chung dang gzhan ni de las lhag //üîΩces bya ba 'dis /
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag rang bzhin dang // mgo ma'i sa dang 'bring gnyis dang // bsam pa ngan dang nga can dang // chung dang gzhan ni de las lhag // ces bya ba 'dis /
translated: bad thoughts, conceit,üîΩsmall and the others, greater than that.

original: ngo tsha ba chung ngu'i rang bzhin dang / chen po'i rang bzhin bstan te /
analyzed: ngo tsha ba chung ngu'i rang bzhin dang / chen po'i rang bzhin bstan te /
translated: This verse shows the nature of the small and great.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa 'dod pa'i khams kyi ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa thams cad ni chung ngur gzhag go //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa 'dod pa'i khams kyi ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa thams cad ni chung ngur gzhag go //
translated: All the shame and embarrassment of the level of non meditative equipoise, the desire realm, are posited as small.

original: sa gong ma gong ma rnams la ltos nas sa 'og ma 'og ma rnams kyi ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa yang chung ngur gzhag go //
analyzed: sa gong ma gong ma rnams la ltos nas sa 'og ma 'og ma rnams kyi ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa yang chung ngur gzhag go //
translated: In relation to the higher and higher stages, the shame and embarrassment of the lower and lower stages are posited as lesser.

original: sa dang po la ltos nas mos pas spyod pa'i sa pa'i ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa chung ngur gzhag go //
analyzed: sa dang po la ltos nas mos pas spyod pa'i sa pa'i ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa chung ngur gzhag go //
translated: In relation to the first stage, the shame and embarrassment of the stage of action out of faith are posited as lesser.

original: de bzhin dus gnyis pa la ltos nas sa dang po'i ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa rnams chung ngur gzhag ste /
analyzed: de bzhin dus gnyis pa la ltos nas sa dang po'i ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa rnams chung ngur gzhag ste /
translated: In the same way, in relation to the second stage, the shame and embarrassment of the first stage are posited as lesser.

original: de bzhin du sa gong ma rnams la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa gong ma rnams la yang sbyar ro //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to the higher stages.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa la yang ngo tsha ba dang khrel ba chung ngu dang 'bring po dang / chen po rnam pa gsum yod pa las /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa la yang ngo tsha ba dang khrel ba chung ngu dang 'bring po dang / chen po rnam pa gsum yod pa las /
translated: Also, in the stages of meditative equipoise of the form and formless realms, there are three types of shame and embarrassment: lesser, medium, and great.

original: chung ngu dang 'bring po yang chung ngur gzhag go //
analyzed: chung ngu dang 'bring po yang chung ngur gzhag go //
translated: The lesser and medium are posited as lesser.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas lta bu bsam pa ngan pa'i rgyud la yod pa'i ngo tsha ba dang khrel pa yang chung ngur gzhag ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas lta bu bsam pa ngan pa'i rgyud la yod pa'i ngo tsha ba dang khrel pa yang chung ngur gzhag ste /
translated: The shame and abashment that exist in the mental continuum of those with bad thoughts, such as sravakas and pratyekabuddhas, are posited as small.

original: de dag gi ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pas bdag gi don tsam las mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pas bdag gi don tsam las mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their shame and abashment do not accomplish more than just their own purpose.

original: sa dang po nas sa bdun man chad kyi nga rgyal dang bcas pa'i ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa yang chung ngur gzhag ste /
analyzed: sa dang po nas sa bdun man chad kyi nga rgyal dang bcas pa'i ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa yang chung ngur gzhag ste /
translated: The shame and abashment with pride from the first to the seventh bhumis are posited as small.

original: nga rgyal dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni brtsal 'bad dang bcas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni brtsal 'bad dang bcas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What is called with pride means with exertion.

original: gzhan ni zhes bya ba'i don ni gong ma las bzlog pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan ni zhes bya ba'i don ni gong ma las bzlog pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The other means the opposite of the above.

original: de las lhag ces bya ba ni gong ma las bzlog na chen por 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i @83b don to //
analyzed: de las lhag ces bya ba ni gong ma las bzlog na chen por 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i @83b don to //
translated: Superior to that means the opposite of the above is great.

original: ji ltar chen por 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar chen por 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it great?

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa thams cad chung ngu'i nang du bsdus nas mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa thams cad chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa thams cad chung ngu'i nang du bsdus nas mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa thams cad chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: All levels of non-equipoise are included in the small, and all levels of equipoise are great.

original: sa 'og ma thams cad chung ngur gzhag dang sa gong ma thams cad chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa 'og ma thams cad chung ngur gzhag dang sa gong ma thams cad chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: All lower levels are small, and all higher levels are great.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa yang chung ngu dang 'bring po chung ngu'i nang du gzhag dang mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa yang chung ngu dang 'bring po chung ngu'i nang du gzhag dang mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: The small and medium of the level of equipoise are included in the small, and the great of the level of equipoise is great.

original: bsam pa ngan pa'i ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa chung ngu'i nang du gzhag dang bsam pa chen po byang chub sems dpa' dang sangs rgyas kyi ngo tsha ba dang brel yod pa chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam pa ngan pa'i ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa chung ngu'i nang du gzhag dang bsam pa chen po byang chub sems dpa' dang sangs rgyas kyi ngo tsha ba dang brel yod pa chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: The shame and embarrassment of bad thoughts are included in the small, and the great shame and embarrassment of the great thought of bodhisattvas and buddhas is great.

original: sa bdun pa man chad nga rgyal dang bcas pas chung ngur gzhag dang sa brgyad pa yan chad mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob ste /
analyzed: sa bdun pa man chad nga rgyal dang bcas pas chung ngur gzhag dang sa brgyad pa yan chad mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob ste /
translated: Up to and including the seventh level, there is pride, so it is small. From the eighth level onward, one obtains forbearance for the nonarising of phenomena,

original: ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa brtsal 'bad med par lhun gyis grub par 'byung bas na chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngo tsha ba dang khrel yod pa brtsal 'bad med par lhun gyis grub par 'byung bas na chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: It is great because it is spontaneous, not contrived, and it is a source of shame and abashment.

original: 'di man chad tshigs su bcad pa bzhi dang gsum gyis rim bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'di man chad tshigs su bcad pa bzhi dang gsum gyis rim bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: From here on, in four and three verses respectively, it shows the opposite of shamelessness, and the qualities of shame.

original: tshigs su bcad pa bzhis ni ngo tsha ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang ngo tsha ba'i nyes pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa bzhis ni ngo tsha ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang ngo tsha ba'i nyes pa bstan to //
translated: In four verses, it shows the opposite of shamelessness and the faults of shamelessness.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis ni ngo tsha ba'i yon tan gyi bye brag bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis ni ngo tsha ba'i yon tan gyi bye brag bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In three verses, it shows the different qualities of shame.

original: blo ldan ngo tsha med pa ni //
analyzed: blo ldan ngo tsha med pa ni //
translated: The wise are ashamed of unseemliness,

original: tshul bzhin min pas nyon mongs bzod //
analyzed: tshul bzhin min pas nyon mongs bzod //
translated: and of not being ashamed, they are ashamed of the faults of shamelessness.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis bdag la gnod pa dang / sems can la gnod pa dang / gnyi ga la gnod pa bstan to //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis bdag la gnod pa dang / sems can la gnod pa dang / gnyi ga la gnod pa bstan to //
translated: In one verse, it shows the harm to oneself, the harm to others, and the harm to both, respectively.

original: de la blo dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems pa'i ngo tsha ba med par gyur ba dang khrel med par gyur na srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa la sogs pa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i chos dag yod de /
analyzed: de la blo dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems pa'i ngo tsha ba med par gyur ba dang khrel med par gyur na srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa la sogs pa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i chos dag yod de /
translated: If the intelligent bodhisattva becomes shameless and immodest, then he will have the unwholesome qualities of killing, stealing, and so on.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams byung ba la bzod par byas nas sdig pa'i chos mi spong zhing srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa la sogs pa'i las byas na bdag la gnod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams byung ba la bzod par byas nas sdig pa'i chos mi spong zhing srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa la sogs pa'i las byas na bdag la gnod par 'gyur te /
translated: If he indulges in the afflictions and does not abandon the unwholesome qualities, and if he commits the actions of killing, stealing, and so on, he will harm himself.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: de'i rkyen gyis tshe 'dir yang gsad pa dang bcing ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa 'byung la /
analyzed: de'i rkyen gyis tshe 'dir yang gsad pa dang bcing ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa 'byung la /
translated: As a result of that, he will be harmed in this life by being killed, imprisoned, and so on.

original: tshe rabs gzhan du yang sems can dmyal ba la sogs par skye bar 'gyur te 'dis ni bdag la gnod pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan du yang sems can dmyal ba la sogs par skye bar 'gyur te 'dis ni bdag la gnod pa bstan to //
translated: And in other lives, he will be born in the hells and so on. This shows how he harms himself.

original: khong khro zhes bya bas gzhan la gnod pa bstan to /
analyzed: khong khro zhes bya bas gzhan la gnod pa bstan to /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand anger‚Äù shows how he harms others.

original: ngo tsha ba dang khrel med par gyur @84a * //
analyzed: ngo tsha ba dang khrel med par gyur @84a * //
translated: He becomes shameless and immodest.

original: pa dang ; khong kho ba dang 'dod chags kyi sgo nas sems can gzhan gyi srog gcod cing gzhan gyi nor la ma byin par len pas sems can la gnod do //üîΩbtang snyoms nga rgyal gyis zhes bya ba la /üîΩbtang snyoms dang nga rgyal gnyis kyis ni gnyi ga la gnod de de bas na /
analyzed: pa dang ; khong kho ba dang 'dod chags kyi sgo nas sems can gzhan gyi srog gcod cing gzhan gyi nor la ma byin par len pas sems can la gnod do // btang snyoms nga rgyal gyis zhes bya ba la / btang snyoms dang nga rgyal gnyis kyis ni gnyi ga la gnod de de bas na /
translated: They harm sentient beings by killing other sentient beings through anger, hatred, and desire, and by stealing the property of others.üîΩThey harm both through equanimity and pride.

original: sems can dang ni tshul khrims gnod //
analyzed: sems can dang ni tshul khrims gnod //
translated: They harm both sentient beings and morality through equanimity and pride.

original: ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ces bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore it says,üîΩThey harm sentient beings and morality.

original: de la btang snyoms kyis ni sems can gyi don la bag med de sems can dag yal bar 'dor bas na sems can la gnod do //
analyzed: de la btang snyoms kyis ni sems can gyi don la bag med de sems can dag yal bar 'dor bas na sems can la gnod do //
translated: Among them, they harm sentient beings through equanimity because they are heedless of the welfare of sentient beings and abandon sentient beings.

original: nga rgyal gyis kyang gdol ba la sogs pa sems can dman pa rnams dge ba la dgod par mi byed cing shes pa cung zad tsam yod kyang nga rgyal gyi dbang du song bas gzhan la mi 'chad la /
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis kyang gdol ba la sogs pa sems can dman pa rnams dge ba la dgod par mi byed cing shes pa cung zad tsam yod kyang nga rgyal gyi dbang du song bas gzhan la mi 'chad la /
translated: They also harm sentient beings through pride because they do not establish inferior sentient beings such as untouchables in virtue. And even if they have a little knowledge, they do not teach it to others because they are overcome by pride.

original: grong dang ljongs la sogs pa de dang de dag tu song ste /
analyzed: grong dang ljongs la sogs pa de dang de dag tu song ste /
translated: They go to this and that town and village,

original: sems can gyi don mi byed pas na sems can la gnod do //
analyzed: sems can gyi don mi byed pas na sems can la gnod do //
translated: Since they do not benefit sentient beings, they harm sentient beings.

original: btang snyoms dang nga rgyal gyis bdag la yang gnod do //
analyzed: btang snyoms dang nga rgyal gyis bdag la yang gnod do //
translated: They also harm themselves through equanimity and pride.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: btang snyoms kyis bdag nyid dge ba'i chos la 'jug par bya ba la yal bar 'dor zhing mi dge ba'i chos spang par bya ba la yang yal bar 'dor bas /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyis bdag nyid dge ba'i chos la 'jug par bya ba la yal bar 'dor zhing mi dge ba'i chos spang par bya ba la yang yal bar 'dor bas /
translated: Through equanimity, they neglect to engage in virtuous dharmas and to abandon nonvirtuous dharmas.

original: tshul khrims nyams pas bdag la gnod pa dang / nga rgyal gyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung du nye bar mi 'gro zhing dam pa'i chos la sogs pa mi byed pas /
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams pas bdag la gnod pa dang / nga rgyal gyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung du nye bar mi 'gro zhing dam pa'i chos la sogs pa mi byed pas /
translated: Through pride, they do not approach spiritual teachers and do not practice the holy Dharma, etc.

original: bya ba dang mi bya ba'i dmigs pa mi shes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bya ba dang mi bya ba'i dmigs pa mi shes pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they do not know what should and should not be done,

original: mi bya ba dag byas pa dang / bya ba dag ma byas pa'i sgo nas tshul khrims nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi bya ba dag byas pa dang / bya ba dag ma byas pa'i sgo nas tshul khrims nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: they violate morality by doing what should not be done and not doing what should be done.

original: de ltar bdag la gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar bdag la gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus they harm themselves.

original: 'gyod las gdung dang bcas par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gyod las gdung dang bcas par 'gyur //
translated: They are tormented by remorse.

original: zhes bya bas bdag la smod par bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas bdag la smod par bstan te /
translated: This shows that they reproach themselves.

original: gong du bshad pa bzhin du /
analyzed: gong du bshad pa bzhin du /
translated: As explained above,

original: ngo tsha ba dang khrel med par gyur nas 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pas srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i las byas nas /
analyzed: ngo tsha ba dang khrel med par gyur nas 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pas srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i las byas nas /
translated: having become shameless and without embarrassment, one commits such actions as killing through desire, hatred, and so on.

original: las byas pa'i 'og tu bdag gis ni ngan song du skye bar 'gyur ba'i las mi cha ba dag byas so zhes sems la gnod pa dang / gdung ba skye bar 'gyur zhing bdag ni tha shal lo zhes bdag la bdag smod par byed do //
analyzed: las byas pa'i 'og tu bdag gis ni ngan song du skye bar 'gyur ba'i las mi cha ba dag byas so zhes sems la gnod pa dang / gdung ba skye bar 'gyur zhing bdag ni tha shal lo zhes bdag la bdag smod par byed do //
translated: After committing the action, one thinks, ‚ÄúI have done an action that will lead to rebirth in the lower realms,‚Äù and one‚Äôs mind is tormented and one‚Äôs heart is pained. One disparages oneself, saying, ‚ÄúI am worthless.‚Äù

original: mchod pa thob par mi 'gyur dang // zhes bya bas /
analyzed: mchod pa thob par mi 'gyur dang // zhes bya bas /
translated: ‚Äú One will not receive offerings‚Äù

original: gzhan gyis smod par byed pa bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan gyis smod par byed pa bstan to //
translated: teaches that others will disparage one.

original: de ltar sdig pa'i chos dag spyad pa dang / grong dang mi dang / sbyin bdag @84b la sogs pa yang gang zag 'di la ni rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la sogs pa sbyin par mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ltar sdig pa'i chos dag spyad pa dang / grong dang mi dang / sbyin bdag @84b la sogs pa yang gang zag 'di la ni rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la sogs pa sbyin par mi rigs te /
translated: In that way, one who has practiced evil actions will think, ‚ÄúIt is not right to give this person gifts, respect, and so on, because he is a person who has practiced evil actions.‚Äù

original: 'di ni sdig pa'i chos can yin gyi bsod nams kyi zhing ma yin no zhes rnyed pa la sogs pa mi ster cing mi snyan par grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni sdig pa'i chos can yin gyi bsod nams kyi zhing ma yin no zhes rnyed pa la sogs pa mi ster cing mi snyan par grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not give gifts and so on to those who have impaired ethics, saying, They are immoral, not a field of merit, and they have a bad reputation.

original: dad can mi min tshogs chen gyis //üîΩzhes bya bas lhas smod pa bstan te /
analyzed: dad can mi min tshogs chen gyis // zhes bya bas lhas smod pa bstan te /
translated: The great hosts of faithful nonhumansüîΩwill not protect them.üîΩThis shows that the gods reproach those with impaired ethics.

original: tshul khrims nyams par byed na sngon tshul khrims srung bar byed pas na lha dad pa can rnams bdag la srung bar byed pa de dag kyang de phan chad 'di ni tshul khrims 'chal pas shi ba'i ro dang 'dra'o zhes srung bar mi byed cing rgyab kyis lta
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams par byed na sngon tshul khrims srung bar byed pas na lha dad pa can rnams bdag la srung bar byed pa de dag kyang de phan chad 'di ni tshul khrims 'chal pas shi ba'i ro dang 'dra'o zhes srung bar mi byed cing rgyab kyis lta
translated: If you have impaired ethics, the gods who previously protected you because you observed ethics will no longer do so, saying, He is immoral, like a corpse.
